children.definition: worship, honour besides, A. Th. 1028.
rushing upon, Q.S. 8.166.
signify or indicate besides, connote, Arist. Int. 16b6, Rh. 1374a13, Po. 1457a17.
brand in addition, ἐπὶ ποδός Supp.Epigr. 4.512.13 ( Ephesus, ii A.D.):— Med., annotate, Gloss.
spit upon, LXX Le. 15.8.
feed also on, Philum. ap. Orib. 45.29.10 ( Pass.).
Hsch.
to have oneʼs teeth scraped, Hp. Epid. 6.6.13.
throw up earth about, δένδρεα ποτισκαψεῖ ( Dor. fut.) Tab.Heracl. 1.173.
grow dry in a thing: metaph. in intr. pf. προσέσκληκα, to be importunate, EM 384.54, Phot., Suid. s.v. ἐσκληκότα.
to be adjacent, ἐν Αἰθιοπία καὶ τοῖς -οῦσιν αὐτὴν τόποις prob. for προσκυνοῦσιν in Nech. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 7.140.
consider besides, Str. 8.3.3 (v.l. προσκοπεῖν).
jeer besides, J. AJ 6.9.4:— Pass., D.L. 2.120.

definition: πρόσσοθεν, Adv., Ep. for πρόσθεν, read by Aristarch. in Il. 23.533.

children.definition: pant after, c. dat., Plu. Oth. 2.
to be contracted, Arist. Phgn. 807b1 (sed leg. κατεσπ-).
pour besides, οἶνον κατὰ τῶν ἁγνιζομένων D.H. 7.72.15.
to be eager besides, Teles p.43 H. codd. (fort. πρὸς σπεύδει).
to be deeply engaged in, τοῖς βιβλίοις Philostr. VA 6.3.
drop on, shed over, τοῖς αἰδοία π. Χάρις μορφάν Pi. O. 6.76; πραῢν . . ποτιστάζων ὄαρον letting fall mild words, Id. P. 4.137.
reduction, contraction, τῆς γαστρός Paul.Aeg. 1.97.
reducing, π. τῶν ὄγκων φάρμακα Aët. 12.49.
stir up to sedition, τινας D.C. 38.37:— Pass., to have a sedition stirred up against one, Id. 44.10.
adhesion, Hp. Loc.Hom. 13 (written προστ-): pl., in concrete sense, things which touch the tongue, Id. Epid. 6.5.10 (written προστ-).

children.label: II
children.definition: Dor. forms ποίστασις, ποτίστασις (qq. v.).

definition: προσστάτης, written for προστάτης in SIG 546 B 33 ( Delph., iii B.C.).

children.definition: draw a stockade along or before a place, c. acc., π. τὰς τριήρεις Th. 4.9; τὰς τάφρους App. BC 5.33.
go or come towards, προσέστῐχε μακρὸν Ὄλυμπον Od. 20.73; δεῦρο π. S. OC 30, cf. 320, OT 79 (in codd. of S. always προστ-).
bring close to, καρχησίῳ τὸ κέρας Luc. Am. 6:— Med., keep close to, τοῖς ὀρεινοῖς, of a general, Plu. Sull. 19.
tuck in, τοὺς μηρούς prob. in Arist. IA 713a22.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be tight-drawn, close tucked in, προσεσταλμένος, of an abscess which does not project, Hp. Prog. 7; προσστέλλεται τῷ χρωτὶ τὸ δέρμα Gal. 18(2).599; ἰσχία ἔνδοθεν προσεσταλμένα loins drawn or tucked up, of dogs, X. Cyn. 4.1, cf. Poll. 5.58; κοιλία πλατεῖα καὶ π., ἰσχίον π., Arist. Phgn. 807a34, 37; ἡ [τοῦ βονάσου] θρὶξ τῆς τοῦ ἵππου . . προσεσταλμένη μᾶλλον lying closer to the skin, Id. HA 630a25; αἱ σάρκες αὐτοῖς ὀστέοις π. Luc. Am. 14; αἰδοῖον, τιτθοὶ π., Gal. 8.451,452; φύλλα Dsc. 4.88; προστείλας (leg. προσστ-) τὰ ἄρθρα reducing swellings in the joints, Philagr. ap. Aët. 12.49.
to be orderly, modest, ἐπιστήμη προσεσταλμένη καὶ κοσμία Pl. Grg. 511d.
clasp to oneʼs breast, J. AJ 2.9.7, Sor. 1.106, Longus 4.23; aor. inf. written προστερνίσασθαι in Poll. 2.162.
venture further experiments, τὰ ὅμοια Demetr. Eloc. 256 (s.v.l.).
encamp near, [ πόλει] Plb. 1.42.8, al., cf. D.S. 14.17.
place additional foundation-courses in, [ τόπον] πώροις IG 7.3073.65 ( Lebad., ii B.C.).
anoint besides, Alex.Trall. Febr. 7.
agree in addition, BGU 1098.45 (i B.C.).
slander besides, D. 55.29 (sed leg. divisim).
steal or carry off in addition, UPZ 6.19 (ii B.C.).
join or add to, Porph. in Ptol. 192:— Med., take part in besides, contribute to, προσξυνελάβοντο . . τῆς ὁρμῆς αἱ νῆες Th. 3.36 (v.l. -εβάλετο); help to confirm, λόγου D.C. 43.47.
contribute to besides or at the same time, abs., Hp. Fract. 27; πρός τι Id. Art. 30; cf. foreg.

definition: προσσυμβιόω, f.l. in Ph. Fr. 51 H.

children.definition: entangle besides:— Pass., προσσυμπλᾰκήσομαι v.l. in Thd. Da. 11.10.
collect in addition, Yale Classical Studies 2.6 ( Dura, ii A.D., Pass.).
lose besides, τὰ ὄντα Ph. 2.284.
add besides, τῷ ἐνεστῶτι τὸν παρῳχημένον [χρόνον] S.E. M. 9.46; στίχους Ath. 5.180c.
work with as well, Ruf. Ren.Ves. 13.5.
warm besides, Hp. Morb. 4.51:— Pass., ib. 46.
understand besides, Hp. Acut. 52, Fract. 8; π. τὴν ἕξιν, τὰ χωρία, Aret. SD 1.9.
recommend further, D. 61.31.
settle with others in a place, join with others in a settlement, c. dat. pers., Th. 6.2.
give oneʼs daughter in marriage besides, D.C. 60.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be settled in addition, [ ψυχαὶ] -οικιζόμεναι cj. for προσυν- in M.Ant. 4.21.
finish in addition, PSI 5.547.13 ( Pass., iii B.C.).
concert or agree besides, c. inf., D.C. 46.56.
give a signal to, Plb. 8.29.5; cf. προσυρίζω.
drag on or along, τὰ σκέλη Gal. 6.155.
slay at, Ὁρτήσιον τῷ μνήματι Plu. Brut. 28.
bind tightly, οἱ -σφίγγοντες τὸ ἄρθρον μύες Gal. 18(1).350:— Pass., Arr. Tact. 34.7 (cj.).
seal as well, Dor. pf. part. Pass. ποτεσφραγισμέναν Delph. 3(2).120 (ii B.C.).
add besides, τοῖς πεπραγμένοις τὰ μὴ γενόμενα J. BJ 3.9.5.
one must attend, τοῖς ἀριθμοῖς dub. cj. for προσσχηστέον in Vett.Val. 244.18.
piling up: in Arith., name for the series 1 + 2 + 3 + 4, Nicom. Ar. 2.8.
heap up beside, λίθους τοῖς Ἑρμαῖς Corn. ND 16.

children.label: II
children.definition: store up, Luc. Anach. 25 [moved to προσωρεύω in Supp.], Gloss.
Schwyzer 323 C 39 (iv B.C.).
= sq., LXX Da. 3.28 ( 95), Sammelb. 3924.15 (i A.D.), Diog.Oen. 11, Ps.-Plu. Fluv. 6.4, 10.2; κατὰ -ταγήν τινος τινος J. AJ 1.7.1, al.; προσταγῇ IG 42(1).497 ( Epid., ii/iii A.D.).

definition: πρόσταγμα, ατος, Dor. ποτίταγμα SIG 569.28 ( Cos, iii B.C.): τό: ( προστάσσω):—

children.definition: ordinance, command, Pl. R. 423c, al., Isoc. 4.176, etc.; ἐκ προστάγματος D. 17. 16; κατὰ πρόσταγμα D.S. 14.41, cf. OGI 225.37 ( Didyma, iii B.C.), PEnteux. 6.11, al. (iii B.C.), PTeb. 5.206 ( ii B.C., pl.), UPZ 112 i 7 ( ii B.C., pl.), etc.; κατὰ τὸ π. τοῦ παιδαγωγοῦ ζῆν by his prescription, Arist. EN 1119b13, cf. PCair.Zen. 426.7 (iii B.C.), Ael. VH 9.23; = Lat. edictum, OGI 665.3 ( Egypt, i A.D.), etc.
order to pay or deliver, PCair.Zen. 8.3, 375.8 (iii B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: command, as division of the army, ὑπηρέτης προστάγματος PRein. 15.30 (ii B.C.), unless an error for τάγματος.

definition: προστάδιον [ᾰ], τό, Dim. of προστάς, PSI 5.546 (iii B.C.).

children.definition: one must order, X. Hier. 9.3; π. ὅπως . . Pl. R. 527c.

of or for commanding, imperative, imperious, τὸ π. [ἡ ψυχή], opp. τὸ ὑπηρετικόν (of the body), Arist. Top. 128b19; π. τινῶν Corn. ND 16; λόγος Plu. Stoic.rep. 2.1037f; Προστακτικός (sc. λόγος), title of work by Protagoras, D.L. 9.55; βραχυλογία Plu. Phoc. 5; also of persons, ἄρχων Max.Tyr. 13.2 ( Sup.).

children.label: II
children.definition: ἡ -κὴ ἔγκλισις the imperative mood, D.T. 638.7, A.D. Synt. 31.20; π. ἐκφορὰ τῶν ῥημάτων ib. 69.20; τὸ π. σχῆμα Anon. Fig. 24; also τὸ -κόν D.L. 7.66, 67, Ps.-Plu. Vit.Hom. 53. Adv. -κῶς in the imperative mood, D.H. 4.18, Sch. Ar. Av. 1163.
hold out, persevere, ἔτʼ ὀλίγον χρόνον Ar. Lys. 766; π. τῷ δόξαντι καλῷ persevere in . . , Th. 2.53, cf. Plu. Arat. 27: abs., Id. Ant. 40.
posting of additional troops on the wings of a phalanx, Ael. Tact. 24.3, Arr. Tact. 20.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: ordinance, command, Pl. Lg. 631d (pl.), 673c; προστάξεις προστάττοντες ἀνίσους ib. 761e; τινὶ τὴν πρόσταξιν ποιεῖσθαι to command him, Arist. Top. 103a35, cf. Lys. 2.1; ἐκ προστάξεως τοῦ κυρίου μου κτλ. POxy. 1204.7 (iii A. D.), cf. 1252r. 19 (iii A. D.); requisition, τὴν π. ταῖς πόλεσιν ἑκατὸν νεῶν τῆς ναυπηγίας ἐποιοῦντο Th. 8.3.

data.quote: ἐκ προστάξεως τοῦ κυρίου μου κτλ.
τὴν π. ταῖς πόλεσιν ἑκατὸν νεῶν τῆς ναυπηγίας ἐποιοῦντο

children.label: III
children.definition: ἄτιμοι κατὰ προστάξεις citizens deprived of their rights in certain specified particulars (opp. παντάπασιν ἄτιμοι), And. 1.75.
trouble further, LXX Si. 4.3.
fasten to, Lyc. 748 ( Pass.).
part between the two antae (or wall-ends) of a building, Vitr. 6.7.1, cf. EM 688.35.

children.label: II
children.definition: vestibule, porch, portico, Callix. 1, LXX Jd. 3.23, GDI 3723.5 ( Cos), OGI 51.22 ( Egypt, iii B.C.), PSI 4.396 (iii B.C.), PCair.Zen. 445.3, al. (iii B.C.), UPZ 77 i 22 (ii B. C.), PTeb. 793 xii 25, al. (ii B.C.).
standing in front, κατὰ τὴν τῶν θηρίων π., i.e. opposite the animals which were posted in front, Plb. 11.1.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: standing before or at the head of, leadership, τοῦ δήμου Th. 2.65; τοῦ πλήθους Id. 6.89: abs., chieftainship, presidency, ἐπʼ ἐτησίῳ π. v.l. for προστατείᾳ in Id. 2.80; leadership, authority, οἱ προστασίας ἀξιούμενοι D. 19.295; ἡ ἰατρικὴ π. authority or dignity of a physician, Hp. Praec. 10, cf. Medic. 1; ἡ τοῦ ξυγγραφέως π. Plb. 12.28.6, cf. Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.43, Plot. 3.4.3.

children.label: b
children.definition: governorship, Ph. 2.63; = Lat. praefectura, Id. 1.675.

children.label: c
children.definition: superintendence, care, charge, διʼ ἣν ποιεῖται ἡμῶν π. UPZ 20.28 (ii B. C.); πρὸ τῆς π., of a midwife, before taking up a charge, Sor. 1.4 cod. (nisi leg. πρὸς ταῖς π.) ; τοῦ σωματίου π. ποιησαμένη, of a wet-nurse, PSI 3.204.8 (i A.D.), cf. PStrassb. 40.25 (vi A.D.); management, εὐθηνίας PTeb. 397.28 (ii A.D.); of a temple, PTheb.Bank 2.6 (ii B.C.); ἡ τοῦ θεοῦ π. καὶ ὅλου ἡμῶν τοῦ οἴκου OGI 331.22 ( Pergam., ii B.C.).

data.quote: ἡ τοῦ θεοῦ π. καὶ ὅλου ἡμῶν τοῦ οἴκου

children.definition: outward dignity, pomp, show, etc., οὐ μόνον π. βασιλική, ἀλλὰ καὶ δύναμις Plb. 4.2.6, cf. 5.43.3, D.S. 18.23 (leg. βασιλείων) ; π. τῶν ἱερῶν Plb. 1.55.8.

data.quote: οὐ μόνον π. βασιλική, ἀλλὰ καὶ δύναμις

children.label: III
children.definition: patronage, protection, SIG 685.97 ( Magn. Mae., ii B.C.), IPE 12.79.9 ( Olbia, i A.D.), J. AJ 16.2.4, etc.
= Lat. patronatus, Plu. Rom. 13; = Lat. patrocinium, Lib. Or. 47.7 (pl.), al.
partisanship, D. 10.52 (pl.); collusion, champerty, ταῦτʼ οὐχ ὁμολογουμένη π.; Id. 30.30; προστασίᾳ ( -σίαι codd.) τινὲς ὠνοῦνται καὶ πωλοῦσι Thphr. Fr. 97.3.

children.label: IV
children.definition: place before a building, court (= προστάς, Did. ap. Harp.), τὰ τῆς Ἀθηναίων Ἀκροπόλεως Προπύλαια μετενεγκεῖν εἰς τὴν προστασίαν τῆς Καδμείας Aeschin. 2.105; τῆς περὶ τὸ Διονυσιακὸν θέατρον προστασίας Plb. 15.30.4; in this sense oxyt. προστασιά acc. to Hdn.Gr. 1.294.

data.quote: τὰ τῆς Ἀθηναίων Ἀκροπόλεως Προπύλαια μετενεγκεῖν εἰς τὴν προστασίαν τῆς Καδμείας
τῆς περὶ τὸ Διονυσιακὸν θέατρον προστασίας

definition: προστάσιμον [ᾰ], dub. sens. in Gloss.Oxy. 1801.11 (i A.D.).

children.definition: Δημήτηρ π. Paus. 2.11.3.
outward dignity, Pl. R. 577a; τοῦ ἱεροῦ Delph. 3(4).43.7 (ii B.C.).

children.label: IV
children.definition: BGU 432 ii ( 2). 7 (ii A.D.).

definition: προστάσσω, Att. προστάττω; Dor. ποτιτάσσω IG 12(1).155.91 ( Rhodes), Anon. in PSI 9.1091.1, also ποιτάσσω IG 42(1).122.39, al. (Epid.): pf. προστέταχα LXX Da. 2.8:— Pass., 1 aor. προσετάχθην (v. infr.), also 2 aor. προσετάγην ib. Si. 3.22:

children.definition: place or post at a place, χωρεῖτε οἷ προστάσσομεν (sc. ὑμᾶς) E. Or. 1678: — Pass., προσταχθέντα . . πύλαις A. Th. 527, cf. S. Ant. 670; ᾗ ἄν τις προσταχθῇ Th. 2.87, cf. 7.70.

attach to, πρὸς τοῖσι ἔθνεσι τοὺς πλησιοχώρους π. attaching to certain tribes their next neighbours, Hdt. 3.89; π. τινάς τινι assign them to his command, Th. 5.8, cf. X. Cyr. 7.1.20:— Pass., Ἰνδοὶ προσετετάχατο . . Φαρναζάθρῃ Hdt. 7.65; κατὰ τέλη στρατηγῷ τινι προστεταγμένοι Th. 6.42.
ἐπὶ μὲν τῇ [μοίρῃ] ἑωυτὸν π. appointed himself to the one part as their head, Hdt. 1.94; π. ἄρχοντά τισι appoint as commander over them, Th. 6.93: with dat. omitted, Id. 3.16, 8.23:— Pass., ib. 8.

children.label: II
children.definition: command, prescribe, enjoin, περὶ βοηθείας ἢ ἄλλο τι προστάττοντες τῆσι πόλεσι IG 1(2).57.43; ἑκάστῳ ἔργον π., αὑτῷ πόνον π., Hdt. 1.114, E. Ion 1176, cf. X. Cyr. 4.5.25; πολὺ ἔργον π. ὡς τηλικῷδε Pl. Prm. 136d, etc.; πολλὰς ἐπιμελείας Arist. Pol. 1299b8; π. μνᾶς ἕξ prescribe 6 minae, Id. EN 1106b2; τισὶ περί τινος π. D. 19.71:— Pass., τοῖσι δὲ ἵππος προσετέτακτο to others orders had been given to supply cavalry, Hdt. 7.21, cf. A. Eu. 208; τὰ προσταχθέντα orders given, Hdt. 2.121.δʹ, cf. Isoc. 3.13; τὸ προστεταγμένον Hdt. 9.104; τὸ προσταχθέν Id. 1.114, S. Ph. 1010; τὰ προσταχθησόμενα X. Mem. 3.5.6: abs., προσταχθὲν αὐτῷ the order having been given him, Lys. 30.2, cf. D. 50.12; πλείω τῶν ὑπὸ τῆς πόλεως προσταττομένων δαπανᾶσθαι Lys. 25.13.

data.quote: περὶ βοηθείας ἢ ἄλλο τι προστάττοντες τῆσι πόλεσι
πλείω τῶν ὑπὸ τῆς πόλεως προσταττομένων δαπανᾶσθαι

children.definition: inf., command, order one to do, Hdt. 5.105, 9.99, S. OC 1018, Th. 7.29, X. Cyr. 8.6.3, PEnteux. 6.4 (iii B.C.), etc.; the dat. must be supplied in Hdt. 1.80, S. OC 494, etc.:— Pass., impers., ἐκέλευε τοῖσι προσετέτακτο ταῦτα πρήσσειν διαταμεῖν Hdt. 7.39; ὁ βασιλεὺς . . ἢ ἄλλος τις οἷς προστέτακται περὶ τούτων IG 1(2).94.19.

data.quote: ἐκέλευε τοῖσι προσετέτακτο ταῦτα πρήσσειν διαταμεῖν
ὁ βασιλεὺς . . ἢ ἄλλος τις οἷς προστέτακται περὶ τούτων

children.definition: inf., E. Hel. 890; both usages in successive clauses, ὅσα οἱ νόμοι π. τοὺς προσήκοντας ποιεῖν, ἡμῖν π. καὶ ἀναγκάζουσι ποιεῖν D. 43.59:— Pass., to be ordered to do, τέσσερες . . κῶμαι . . τοῖσι κυσὶ προσετετάχατο σιτία παρέχειν Hdt. 1.192, etc.; ὥσπερ προσετάχθησαν (sc. ἐξεργάσασθαι) Th. 5.75.

data.quote: ὅσα οἱ νόμοι π. τοὺς προσήκοντας ποιεῖν, ἡμῖν π. καὶ ἀναγκάζουσι ποιεῖν
τέσσερες . . κῶμαι . . τοῖσι κυσὶ προσετετάχατο σιτία παρέχειν

children.definition: command, order, opp. ὑπηρετέω, Arist. Top. 129a12:— Pass., receive orders, ib. 14; οἱ προστεταγμένοι Th. 1.136.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἀκούω V, Ptol. Tetr. 35, Heph.Astr. 1.9 [? 1.38], Serapio in Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).226.
Th. 2.80 (cf. προστασία II.1), X. Mem. 3.6.10, Oec. 2.6 (pl.), Supp.Epigr. 3.468.16 (Thess., i B.C.), IG 2(2).1099.23 (Epist.Plotinae, ii A.D.), D.C. 41.34, Porph. Abst. 4.18, etc.
of or for exercising authority, Poll. 1.178.

to be leader or ruler of, εἴτε χοροῦ εἴτε οἴκου εἴτε πόλεως εἴτε στρατεύματος X. Mem. 3.4.6, cf. Hier. 11.5, 7; [ θυσίας] IG 42(1).73.34 ( Epid., iii B.C., prob.): abs., exercise authority, X. HG 3.3.6, Vect. 5.6; ἐν ταῖς πόλεσιν Id. Mem. 2.8.4.

data.quote: εἴτε χοροῦ εἴτε οἴκου εἴτε πόλεως εἴτε στρατεύματος

children.label: II
children.definition: π. ὅπως . . to have authority for providing that . . , provide or take care that . . , Id. An. 5.6.21, Cyr. 1.2.5: with gen. added, π. ἀνθρώπων ὅπως ἕξουσιν . . ib. 1.6.7; cf. sq. [προστατέω]

children.label: III
children.definition: hold office of προστάτης II.3, SIG 241 A 39 ( Delph., iv B.C.), IG 14.208 ( Acrae).

children.label: IV
children.definition: to be guardian of, regent for, τῶν βασιλέων App. Syr. 52.

rule over, lord it over, χθονός E. Heracl. 206; αἰσχρὸν προστατεῖν γε δωμάτων γυναῖκα Id. El. 932; τῆς πόλεως Pl. Grg. 519c; τῶν μεγίστων Id. La. 197e; π. τοῦ ἀγῶνος to be steward of the games, X. An. 4.8.25; π. νούσου, of a physician, to be in charge, Hp. Praec. 13; τοῦ λύχνου τῶν ἱερῶν POxy. 1453.14 (i B.C.): abs., ὁ προστατῶν he that acts as chief, v.l. in X. Cyr. 8.3.25; ὅταν δημοκρατουμένη πόλις ἐλευθερίας διψήσασα κακῶν οἰνοχόων προστατούντων τύχῃ Pl. R. 562d; = προστατεύω II, X. Mem. 2.7.9; π. τοῦ θεμελιωθῆναι τὴν σύνοδον IG 2(2).1343.14:— Pass., προστατεῖσθαι ὑπό τινων to be ruled or led by them, X. Hier. 5.1.

data.quote: ὅταν δημοκρατουμένη πόλις ἐλευθερίας διψήσασα κακῶν οἰνοχόων προστατούντων τύχῃ

children.label: b
children.definition: to be president, ἐκκλησίας Ἀρχ.Ἐφ. 1914.180 ( Gonni); βουλᾶς IG 14.612 ( Rhegium).

children.label: II
children.definition: stand before as a defender, to be guardian or protector of, πυλῶν A. Th. 396; Ἥρα π. [Ἀργείων] E. Heracl. 349; ἁ διὰ παντὸς Χερσονασιτᾶν προστατοῦσα Παρθένος IPE 12.352.23 (ii/i B.C.); ἀναίδειαν, ἥπερ μόνη π. ῥητόρων Ar. Eq. 325 (lyr.); πολιτῶν π. αἱρούμενον Men. 578.

data.quote: ἁ διὰ παντὸς Χερσονασιτᾶν προστατοῦσα Παρθένος

children.definition: π. περὶ τοῦ ἀνατεθέντος ἀργυρίου bring forward a measure respecting . . , IG 9(1).694.106 (Corc.).

children.label: III
children.definition: ὁ προστατῶν χρόνος the time that stands before, i.e. is close at hand, S. El. 781 (cf. Sch. ad loc.), unless rather tyrannous.
standing before, δεῖμα π. καρδίας fear hovering before, or lording it over, my heart, A. Ag. 976 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: standing before, protecting, of Artemis, Id. Th. 449; of Apollo as the tutelary god or (acc. to Hsch., Phot.) from his statue standing before the doors, S. El. 637, Orac. ap. D. 21.52, IG 2(2).674.6, al.; π. θεοί CIG 3530 ( Cyme).

children.label: III
children.definition: ὁ Π. (sc. μήν), a Boeot, month, Plu. QConv. 2.655e.
one who stands before, front-rank man, f.l. for πρωτοστάτης in X. Cyr. 3.3.41, Eq.Mag. 2.2, 6:—but elsewh.,

children.label: II
children.definition: leader, chief, esp. of a democracy, προστάτεω ἐπιλαβέσθαι Hdt. 1.127, 5.23; οἱ π. τοῦ δήμου Th. 3.75, 4.46, 66; οἱ τῶν δήμων π. Id. 3.82; ὁ π. Κλέων Ar. Ra. 569, cf. Eq. 1128 (lyr.); μεταβολὴ ἐκ προστάτου ἐπὶ τύραννον Pl. R. 565d; [ Σόλων] πρῶτος τοῦ δήμου π. Arist. Ath. 2.2, al.

ruler, opp. ἀστοί, A. Supp. 963; Καδμείων Id. Th. 1031; Κνωσίων Arr. Epict. 3.9.3; Μολοσσῶν GDI 1334 ( Epirus, iii B.C.); χώρας, χθονός, E. Heracl. 964, IA 373 (troch.); τῆς Ἑλλάδος προστάται, of the Spartans, X. HG 3.1.3, cf. Isoc. 4.103, D. 9.23; π. τοῦ ἐμπορίου, of Greeks in Egypt, Hdt. 2.178; τοῦ πολέμου X. Cyr. 7.2.23; προστάται τῆς εἰρήνης its chief authors, Id. HG 5.1.36; τῆς πρὸς τοὺς θεοὺς ἐπιμελείας π. D. 22.78; administrator, τῆς κεχωρισμένης προσόδου PTeb. 81.19 (ii B.C.); [ τοῦ ἱεροῦ] OGI 531.3 ( Bithynia, iii A.D.); θεᾶς ib. 209.4 ( Philae, iii A.D.), cf. Ostr. 412, al. (i A.D.): metaph., ἔρως π. τῶν ἀργῶν ἐπιθυμιῶν Pl. R. 572e.

president or presiding officer, π. τοῦ γυμνασίου CIG 2881.16 ( Branchidae), cf. OGI 130.16 ( Egypt, ii B.C.), Supp.Epigr. 4.598.37 ( Teos, i B.C.), IG 2(2).1368.13; π. συνεδρίου ib. 9(2).205.33 (Aetolian League); προβούλων ib. 9(1).694.116 (Corc.); [ γερουσίας] ib. 7.2808 ( Hyettus, iii B.C.); δαμιοργῶν ib. 5(1).1425.16 ( Messene); [ βουλᾶς] ib. 14.256.5 ( Phintias); τῆς μέσης Ἀκαδημίας S.E. P. 1.232: freq. in pl., = πρυτάνεις, SIG 194.15 ( Amphipolis, iv B.C.), etc.; γνώμα προστατᾶν ib. 187.1 ( Cnidus, iv B.C.), cf. IG 12(8).264.13 ( Thasos, iv B.C.).

children.label: III
children.definition: one who stands before and protects, guardian, champion, πυλωμάτων A. Th. 408, cf. 798; πόλεως Pl. Grg. 519b; [ τῆς ποιητικῆς] Id. R. 607d; τῆς πάντων ἐλευθερίας D. 15.30, etc.; epith. of gods, as Apollo, S. Tr. 209 (lyr.), IPE 12.89 (ii A.D.).

patron who took charge of the interests of μέτοικοι, etc.: hence ἐπὶ προστάτου οἰκεῖν live under protection of a patron, Lys. 31.9, 14, Lycurg. 145; προστάτην ἐπιγράφειν τινά choose as oneʼs patron, Luc. Peregr. 11; αὑτῷ πονηρὸν προστάτην ἐπεγράψατο Ar. Pax 684; ἔχειν Id. Pl. 920, cf. S. OT 882 (lyr.); νέμειν π. Arist. Pol. 1275a13; also γράφεσθαι προστάτου to be entered by oneʼs patronʼs name, be attached to a patron, οὐ Κρέοντος προστάτου γεγράφομαι S. OT 411.
= Lat. patronus, Plu. Rom. 13, Mar. 5, IG 3.687, 14.1078 ( Rome, iii A.D.), OGI 549.6 ( Ancyra, iii A.D.), etc.

children.label: IV
children.definition: θεοῦ π. one who stands before a god to entreat him, suppliant, S. OC 1278, cf. 1171.

children.label: V
children.definition: prostate gland, Herophil. ap. Gal. UP 14.11 (v.l.).
of or for a προστάτης II.1, ἐκ π. ῥίζης ἐκβλαστάνει [τύραννος] Pl. R. 565d.
magnificent, τὸ τῆς τιμῆς σεμνὸν καὶ π. Plb. 6.33.9, al. Adv. -κῶς, σεμνῶς καὶ π. Id. 5.88.4.
ready to champion or protect, π. καὶ βοηθητικός Plu. Thes. 36.
-κόν, τό, name of a charge included in a lease, POxy. 590 (ii A.D.).

definition: προστατίνα, ἡ, = sq., title of priestess at Messene, IG 5(1).1447.13 (iii/ii B.C.).

children.definition: προστάτης, ἐὰν . . θέληθʼ ὁμοῦ προστάτισι ταῖς σεμναῖσι . . θεαῖς (Dind. for ἐὰν . . θέλητέ μου πρὸς ταῖσι ταῖς σ.) S. OC 458; προστάτιν ἐπιγράφεσθαί τινα Luc. Bis Acc. 29; ὁ δῆμος ἀρχὴν ἑαυτοῦ π. ἀπέφηνε καὶ ἐκάλεσε δημαρχίαν App. BC 1.1; νύμφαις ὑδάτων προστάτισιν Porph. Antr. 12, cf. 18, Luc. Charid. 10; τὴν ἰδίαν π., of Rhea, prob. in CIG 6835 (inc. loc.); π. τοῦ Ἀνούβεως PMag.Osl. 1.338.

data.quote: ὁ δῆμος ἀρχὴν ἑαυτοῦ π. ἀπέφηνε καὶ ἐκάλεσε δημαρχίαν

children.definition: = foreg., Lex.Havn. ap.Schmidt Hsch. s.v. ταῖη.
draw a stockade in front of or along, τὴν θάλασσαν Th. 6.75:— Pass., πυλίδα, ἢ προεσταύρωτο σταυροῖς App. BC 4.79.
to be converted into raisins before, Dsc. 5.3.
SIG 707.5 ( Olbia, ii B.C.).
projecting roof, penthouse, Apollod. Poliorc. 154.6.
provisional roofing, Delph. 3(5).26 i A 36 (iv B.C.).
Plu. Caes. 17.
stop up before, Gal. 11.480 ( Pass.).
house-rent, PLond. 5.1708.40 ( vi A.D., pl.).
include in the city-wall, ἡ ἔξω -τειχισθεῖσα πόλις Th. 6.3; π. τῇ πόλει τὸν λόφον D.H. 3.1.
judge of by further symptoms, Hp. Art. 50 (v.l. for προτεκμαίρομαι).
to be noticed besides, Hp. Acut. 38.
add of oneʼs own device, Plu. Lys. 26.
pay besides, μισθόν X. An. 7.6.30, cf. BGU 1115.8 (i B.C.), PGiss. 48.22 ( iii A.D., Pass.); f.l. for προτελέω in Th. 6.31.

definition: προστέλλω, in Med., Δίκη δʼ ὁμαίμων κάρτα νιν προστέλλεται

children.definition: sends him forth as a champion, A. Th. 415:— Pass., μακρὰν γὰρ ὡς γέροντι προὐστάλης ὁδόν hast travelled far . . , S. OC 20.

children.label: II
children.definition: διὰ τὸ . . προστέλλειν τὰ γυμνὰ ἕκαστον . . τῇ τοῦ ἐν δεξιᾷ παρατεταγμένου ἀσπίδι protect, shield, Th. 5.71, cf. D.C. 40.23 (unless f.l. for προσστ-, = draw close to, in both).
cut also, ἀλλᾶντος προστετμημένον a slice of sausage also, Antiph. 71: Dor. 2 aor. ποτέταμε IG 42(1).110 C 9 (Epid.).
sigh or grieve beforehand, A. Ag. 253 (lyr.).
Ph. 2.189, Dam. Isid. 88.
covering or ornament for the breast of horses, X. Eq. 12.8, An. 1.8.7, Cyr. 6.4.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: padding for the chest, Luc. Salt. 27.
before or on the breast, στολμοί A. Ch. 29 (lyr.).
delight or please besides, Il. 15.401.
crown beforehand, τινά τινι Ath. 4.128c.
devise besides, Plu. Sert. 11, Iamb. in Nic. p.101 P.

definition: προστηθίδιος, ον, = προστήθειος, = πρόστερνος, before or on the breast.

children.definition: breast-ornament, of horses, Plb. 21.6.7 (pl.), Poll. 2.162 (pl.).
ball of the foot (cf. στῆθος), Poll. 2.198.

stick fast to, cling to, προστᾰκέντος ἰοῦ, of the poisoned robe clinging to Heracles, S. Tr. 833 (lyr.); ὕδρας προστετᾱκὼς φάσματι ib. 836 (lyr.): metaph., to be given up to, engrossed by, πορισμῷ Plu. Cupid. 2.524d; τοῖς ἀνιαροῖς ib. Exil. 600c; τέχνῃ Ael. VH 3.31; τῷ Κριτίᾳ Philostr. VS 2.1.14; δόξῃ Jul. Or. 7.226a; ταῖς αἱρέσεσι Gal. 8.657.
attachment, devotion, τῆς φυχῆς Plu. Suav. 2.1089c.
keep watch, Phleg. Fr. 36.1J.

definition: προστιβάς, f.l. (ap. Suid.) for στιβάς in D.S. 17.85.

children.definition: former, earlier, Schwyzer 410 ( Elis).

definition: προστίθημι, Dor. ποτι-, also aor. inf. ποιθέμεν IG 42(1).121.17 (Epid.); ποτθέμειν prob. in Epich. 170.8: late pres. προστιθῶ Ps.-Luc. Philopatr. 18, 27; imper. προστίθει A. Pr. 83: fut. προσθήσω: aor. προσέθηκα, pl. -έθεμεν, subj. προσθῶ Th. 4.86, Ion. προσθέω Hdt. 1.108:— Med., fut. προσθήσομαι LXX Ex. 14.13: aor. 1 προσεθηκάμην Hdt. 4.65: more freq. aor. 2 προσεθέμην, subj. προσθῶμαι (not πρόσθωμαι), 3 sg. opt. προσθεῖτο D. 6.12, but πρόσθοιτο Id. 11.6; Dor. part. ποτθέμενος, Πρακτικά 1931.89 ( Dodona): pf. -τέθειμαι LXX De. 23.15:— Pass., aor. 1 προσετέθην Th. 3.82: fut. -τεθήσομαι LXX Nu. 27.13, al. ( -τεθήσεσθαι is f.l. ib. Ex. 5.7): but the pf. Pass. is chiefly supplied by πρόσκειμαι:—

children.definition: put to, χερσὶν ἀπώσασθαι λίθον ὃν προσέθηκεν Od. 9.305; π. τὰς θύρας, τὴν θύραν, put to, close the door, Hdt. 3.78, Lys. 1.13; τὰς πύλας Th. 4.67; κλίμακας [τοῖς πύργοις] Id. 3.23; κόμῃ προσθεῖσα βόστρυχον holding it close to . . , A. Ch. 229; χέρα ἐλάτῃ E. Ba. 1110; γόνασιν ὠλένας Id. Andr. 895, cf. S. Ph. 942; τοῖς καλλίστοις τοῦ ζῴου τὰ κάλλιστα φάρμακα Pl. R. 420c; π. μύωπας apply the spur, Plb. 11.18.4; π. χεῖρʼ ἐπὶ πρόσωπα E. Ph. 1699; apply a pessary, Hp. Nat.Mul. 32, Sor. 1.62, al.; [ κύαθον] Arist. Pr. 890b24:— Pass., of pessaries, Dsc. 1.76, al., Sor. 1.35, al.

data.quote: τοῖς καλλίστοις τοῦ ζῴου τὰ κάλλιστα φάρμακα

children.definition: hand over, deliver to, θεῶν γέρα . . ἐφημέροισι προστίθει A. Pr. 83, cf. h.Merc. 129; τινὶ γυναῖκα π. give her to him as wife, Hdt. 6.126; but π. γυναικὶ τάλαντον, as a dower, Hyp. Lyc. 13; π. τινὰ ἄλλῳ πατρί E. Ion 1545; Ἅιδῃ ἐμὸν δέμας Id. Hec. 368, cf. IA 540; π. τινὰ πυρί Id. Supp. 948; σφαγέντα παῖδα π. πόλει Id. Ph. 964; τισὶ π. πόλιν Th. 4.86; τὴν διοίκησιν τῶν κοινῶν ἑαυτῷ D.C. 52.14; also νᾶσον εὐκλέϊ π. λόγῳ Pi. N. 3.68.

give besides or also, φερνάς E. Hipp. 628; προῖκα D. 19.195; χρήματα Id. 18.239, etc.; πίστιν ὑμῖν Id. 54.42; τὰ ἴδια τοῖς ἀλλοτρίοις Men. 557: abs., spend money, οὐ μόνον ἄνευ μισθοῦ, ἀλλὰ καὶ προστιθεὶς ἂν ἡδέως Pl. Euthphr. 3d, cf. Arist. EN 1130a25, Iamb. Protr. 9.

data.quote: οὐ μόνον ἄνευ μισθοῦ, ἀλλὰ καὶ προστιθεὶς ἂν ἡδέως

children.label: II
children.definition: impose upon, πρῆγμα τὸ ἄν τοι προσθέω Hdt. 1.108, cf. 3.62: c. inf., π. τινὶ πρήσσειν Id. 5.30; π. μέτρον impose measure or bounds, A. Ch. 796 (lyr.); π. τινὶ ἀτιμίην impose, inflict disgrace upon him, Hdt. 7.11; π. <φθόρον> A. Ch. 482; ἐπʼ ἐμαυτῷ ἀράς S. OT 820; ὄκνον Id. Ant. 243; αύτὸς αὑτῷ τὴν βλάβην Id. Fr. 350; λύπην, πόνους, E. Supp. 946, Heracl. 505; ἀναλώματα IG 14.830.12 ( Puteoli, ii A.D., Pass.); π. τινὶ ἔκπληξιν ἀφασίαν τε strike him dumb with fear, E. Hel. 549; ἐνθύμιον τοῖς ζῶσι Antipho 3.1.2; τισὶ ζημίας Th. 3.39; π. φιλανθρωπίαν εἰς τὰ τῆς πόλεως πράγματα employ it on . . , D. 19.140.

attribute or impute to, τῷ θεῷ τὴν αἰτίαν E. Ion 1525, cf. Th. 3.39 ( Pass.); π. θράσος μοι impute boldness to me, E. Heracl. 475; θεοῖσι π. ἀμαθίαν Id. Hipp. 951; ἀπληστίαν λέχους γυναιξί Id. Andr. 219; τὸ ἐμπλήκτως ὀξὺ ἀνδρὸς μοίρᾳ προσετέθη Th. 3.82.

data.quote: τὸ ἐμπλήκτως ὀξὺ ἀνδρὸς μοίρᾳ προσετέθη

children.label: III
children.definition: add, τάδε τούτοισι Hdt. 1.20, al.; πρὸς [τῇ γνώμῃ] ἔργα Id. 4.139; ἄλλον πρὸς ὦν ἔθηκαν χρυσόν ib. 196; χάριτι χάριν E. HF 327; νοσοῦντι νόσον Id. Alc. 1048; π. τῷ νόμῳ τὸν λόγον τόνδε Th. 2.35, cf. Hdt. 2.136 ( Pass.), Pl. R. 468b; προσθεῖναι τῷ δικαίῳ ἢ ὡς ἐλέγομεν (for πλέον ἤ . . ) ib. 335a; ἄγγελλε δʼ ὅρκον π. S. El. 47 (Reiske for ὅρκῳ codd., cf. ὅρκου προστεθέντος Fr. 472; ὀμόσας . . προσθείς τε χεῖρα δεξιάν Ph. 942); τὴν στήλην ὕστερον προσέθηκε IG 1(2).374.174; τοῖς εὖ ἔχουσιν ἔργοις οὔτʼ ἀφελεῖν ἔστιν οὔτε προσθεῖναι Arist. EN 1106b11; ἐάν τι ἀφέλωμεν ἢ προσθῶμεν ἢ μεταθῶμεν Pl. Cra. 432a; π. γράμματα ib. 418a, cf. 431c; also π. ἐπὶ τοῖσδε χάριν S. Tr. 1253; ἵππον πρὸς τοὔνομα Ar. Nu. 63; πρὸς τὸν μισθὸν ἑκάστῳ ὀβολόν X. HG 1.5.6, cf. Pl. Phlb. 33c: abs., make additions, Th. 3.45; πρὸς τὰ ὑπάρχοντα -τιθέντες πλουσιώτεροι γίνονται Arist. Rh. 1359b28; make additions to a story, improve it, Id. Po. 1460a18; also of actors, ib. 1461b30: esp. of adding articles to statements or documents, προσθεῖναι οὐδὲν εἶχον τοῖς εἰρημένοις οὐδʼ ἀφελεῖν Isoc. 12.264, cf. POxy. 1062.4 (ii A.D.), etc.; π. καὶ ἀφελεῖν τι περὶ τῆς ξυμμαχίας Foed. ap. Th. 5.23, cf. 29; π. τὶ πρὸς τοῖς ξυγκειμένοις Foed. ib. 47; πρὸς τὰς συνθήκας Foed. ap. Plb. 21.43.27; π. ὅτι . . D. 18.231; of entries in accounts, προσετέθη τὰ τέλη τῷ κυριακῷ λόγῳ PAmh. 77.15 (ii A.D.), cf. BGU 620.15 (iv A.D.), etc.; π. τινὶ [ἀργύριον] pay, PMich.Zen. 28.24 (iii B.C.), cf. PCair.Zen. 647.56 (iii B.C.), PRyl. 153.27 (ii A.D.); πρόσθες εἰς ὄνομα Ἐπωνύχου credit to account of E., Ostr. 1159 (ii/iii A.D.); pay in, deposit gold in a bank or mint, PCair.Zen. 23.32 (iii B.C.).

data.quote: π. τῷ νόμῳ τὸν λόγον τόνδε
τοῖς εὖ ἔχουσιν ἔργοις οὔτʼ ἀφελεῖν ἔστιν οὔτε προσθεῖναι
ἐάν τι ἀφέλωμεν ἢ προσθῶμεν ἢ μεταθῶμεν
προσθεῖναι οὐδὲν εἶχον τοῖς εἰρημένοις οὐδʼ ἀφελεῖν
προσετέθη τὰ τέλη τῷ κυριακῷ λόγῳ

children.definition: τίνα τῇδε προστιθῶ στάσει; A. Ch. 114; Ἀθηναίοις π. σφᾶς αὐτούς join their party, Th. 3.92; π. ἑαυτόν τινι ἐς πίστιν, ἐπὶ ἰδίοις κέρδεσι, Id. 8.46, 50.

add, πὸτ ἀριθμόν . . φᾶφον Epich. 170.8 (prob.); [ χωρίον] ἕτερον αὐτῷ τουτὶ ἴσον Pl. Men. 84d; πρὸς πεπερασμένον ἀεὶ π. Arist. Ph. 266b2:— Pass., εἴ κα . . ποτὶ τὸ ἕτερον τῶν βαρέων ποτιτεθῇ, . . ῥέπειν ἐπὶ τὸ βάρος ἐκεῖνο ᾧ ποτετέθη Archim. Aequil. 1 Def. 2, cf. Euc. 1 Ax. 2, etc.; κοινοῦ -τεθέντος Papp. 742.15.

data.quote: εἴ κα . . ποτὶ τὸ ἕτερον τῶν βαρέων ποτιτεθῇ, . . ῥέπειν ἐπὶ τὸ βάρος ἐκεῖνο ᾧ ποτετέθη

children.definition: add some determining word, opp. ἀφαιρεῖν, Arist. APo. 91b27, cf. EN 1147b33.

LXX and NT, continue or repeat an action, c. inf., προσέθηκεν ἔτι λαλῆσαι LXX Ge. 18.29; οὐ προσθήσω ἔτι πατάξαι ib. 8.21; οὐ μὴ προσθῶ πεῖν I will not drink again, Ev.Marc. 14.25 (v.l.); also προσθεὶς Ἰὼβ εἶπεν Job continued and said, LXX Jb. 27.1; προσθεὶς εἶπε παραβολήν Ev.Luc. 19.11; προσθεῖσα ἔτεκεν υἱόν she bore another son, LXX Ge. 38.5:—also in Med., v. infr. B.III.

children.label: B
children.definition: Med., side with one, οἷς ἂν σὺ προσθῇ S. OC 1332, cf. Th. 3.11, 8.48, 87, D. 6.12, 11.6, 52.25; τῷ ἀστῷ π. to be favourable, well-inclined to him, Hdt. 2.160, cf. D. 43.34; τῇ ἡδονῇ side with pleasure, Arist. MM 1201a2: abs., come in, submit, Epist. Phil. ap. D. 18.39.

assent, agree, οὔ οἱ ἔγωγε π. τῇ γνώμῃ Hdt. 1.109, cf. 3.83, Th. 6.50, X. An. 1.6.10; τῷ λόγῳ τῷ λεχθέντι Hdt. 2.120; τῷ Καρχηδονίων νόμῳ Pl. Lg. 674a: later c. inf., consent, bring oneself to, J. AJ 19.1.8.

data.quote: οὔ οἱ ἔγωγε π. τῇ γνώμῃ

children.definition: φῆφον δʼ Ὀρέστῃ τήνδʼ ἐγὼ προσθήσομαι will deposit this vote in favour of Orestes, i.e. will vote in his favour, A. Eu. 735; ἡμῖν ἂν προσθέμενοι τὴν φῆφον εὐορκοίητε D. 57.69; so μὴ μιᾷ φήφῳ π. (sc. τὴν γνώμην) , ἀλλὰ δυοῖν Th. 1.20; φῆφον π. ἐναντίαν τινί ib. 40; φῆφον π. ὥστε ἀποκτεῖναι OGI 218.102 ( Ilium, iii B.C.).

data.quote: ἡμῖν ἂν προσθέμενοι τὴν φῆφον εὐορκοίητε

children.definition: add, Sammelb. 6951 ii 30, al. (ii A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: associate with oneself, i.e. take to one as a friend, ally, or helper, win over, π. τὸν δῆμον πρὸς τὴν ἑωυτοῦ μοῖραν Hdt. 5.69, cf. Th. 6.18; εἰ στρατὸν προσθέοιτο φίλον Hdt. 1.53, cf. 69, S. OC 404; ταύτην προσθοῦ δάμαρτα take her to wife, Id. Tr. 1224: also in bad sense, πολέμιον π. τινά X. Cyr. 2.4.12.

data.quote: π. τὸν δῆμον πρὸς τὴν ἑωυτοῦ μοῖραν

children.definition: apply to oneself, βάλανον Hp. Epid. 1.4.1 [1.26.αʹ], cf. 4.30 (abs., ib. 1.4.4 [1.26.δʹ]); ὀξύβαφον προσθοῦ λαβών Ar. Av. 361; πατρὸς στέρνα προσθέσθαι θέλω E. HF 1408: metaph., put on, τῇ ὄφει ἀχθηδόνας Th. 2.37; add to oneself, gain, τί ἂν προσθείμην πλέον; what should I be profited? S. Ant. 40; π. χάριν, = ἐπιχαρίζεσθαι, Id. OC 767; esp. of evils, bring or take upon oneself, πρὸς κακοῖσι κακόν A. Pers. 531; μέριμναν S. OT 1460; κακά E. Heracl. 146; ἄχθος ἐπʼ ἄχθει π. διπλοῦν Id. Andr. 396; οἰκεῖον πόνον, κινδύνους αὐθαιρέτους, Th. 1.78, 144; ἔχθρας ἑκουσίους πρὸς ταῖς ἀναγκαίαις π. Pl. Prt. 346b.

children.label: b
children.definition: bring upon others, οἱ . . πόλεμον προσεθήκαντο made war upon him, Hdt. 4.65; οὐκ ἄν σφι Σπαρτιήτας μῆνιν οὐδεμίαν προσθέσθαι vented any wrath upon . . , Id. 7.229.

children.label: III
children.definition: LXX and NT, continue or repeat an action (cf. supr. A.III.5), οὐ προσθήσεσθε ἔτι ἰδεῖν αὐτούς LXX Ex. 14.13; προσέθετο πέμφαι ἕτερον Ev. Luc. 20.11; προσέθετο συλλαβεῖν καὶ Πέτρον he caused Peter also to be arrested, Act.Ap. 12.3; also Φαραὼ προσέθετο τοῦ ἁμαρτάνειν LXX Ex. 9.34; οὐ προσέθετο τοῦ ἐπιστρέψαι ib. Ge. 8.12.
bring forth besides, v.l. in Arist. HA 549a17.
befoul with dung, Ar. Nu. 411:— Pass., Artem. 2.26.

award further penalty (cf. ἀτίμητος), in Act. of the court, π. τοὺς κρίναντας τὴν δίκην ὅ τι χρὴ πρὸς τούτῳ παθεῖν Pl. Lg. 767e, cf. 943b, Arist. Ath. 63.3; πρὸς τῷ ἀργυρίῳ π. δεσμὸν τῷ κλέπτῃ D. 24.114, cf. 103; π. τῷ δημοσίῳ adjudge to the treasury as a debt, Id. 21.44; τὸ ἴσον τῷ δημοσίῳ π. ὅσονπερ τῷ ἰδιώτῃ ibid.:— Med., of the individual δικαστής who proposed the additional penalty, ἐὰν προστιμήσῃ ἡ ἡλιαία (sc. τὸ δεδέσθαι ( , προστιμᾶσθαι δὲ τὸν βουλόμενον Lex ap. D. 24.105, cf. Legem ap. Lys. 10.16:— Pass., impers., εἴ τινι τῶν ὀφειλόντων δεσμοῦ προστετίμηται if the further penalty of imprisonment has been laid on him, D. 24.46, cf. 60, 207; εἴκοσι δραχμῶν προστιμηθῆναι Id. 47.43; προστιμάσθω πρὸς χρόνον μὴ εἰσελθεῖν ὅς ον ἂν δόξῃ IG 2(2).1368.88.

data.quote: π. τοὺς κρίναντας τὴν δίκην ὅ τι χρὴ πρὸς τούτῳ παθεῖν
πρὸς τῷ ἀργυρίῳ π. δεσμὸν τῷ κλέπτῃ
προστιμάσθω πρὸς χρόνον μὴ εἰσελθεῖν ὅς ον ἂν δόξῃ

children.definition: additional penalty or fine, D. 24.2, Poll. 6.180, 8.21, 149.
infliction of a further penalty, Ael. VH 14.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: valuation, τῶν ὀθονίων PTeb. 5.63 (pl., ii B.C.).

penalty, fine, Hp. Lex 1, PHib. 1.41.9 (iii B.C.), SIG 976.76 ( Samos, ii B.C.), Plb. 1.17.11, IG 7.2872 ( Coronea), BMus.Inscr. 481*.245 ( Ephesus, ii A.D.); τὰ π. τῆς ὑπερηφανίας LXX 2 Ma. 7.36; τοιάδε τοῖς κακῶς βουλευομένοις δίδωσι τὰ π. ἡ δίκη Ael. Fr. 237 (glossed by ἐπίχειρα ap. Suid.).

data.quote: τοιάδε τοῖς κακῶς βουλευομένοις δίδωσι τὰ π. ἡ δίκη

children.definition: π. μεταφυτείας licence-fee for alteration of crop, etc., Ostr.Bodl. 1.89 (ii B.C.), cf. PAmh. 2.31.3 (ii B.C.), POxy. 1032.12 (ii A.D.).
assist besides, ὅσων δεῖται . . Hp. Acut. 16; promote, πνιγί Aret. CA 1.7:— Med., promote, νοσήματι Gal. Nat.Fac. 1.13.
shake at, AP 12.67 ( tm.).
place first as elementary, S.E. M. 1.104 ( Pass.).

definition: προστομιαῖον, τό, name of a chamber in the Erechtheum at Athens, IG 1(2).372.71.

children.definition: mouth, esp. of a river, A. Supp. 3 (anap., pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: joining of the lips, Ruf. Onom. 41, Poll. 2.90.
mouthpiece, Apollod. Poliorc. 152.4.
pointed, Eub. 107.10; ξίφος Poll. 2.101.
with protruding lips, PCair.Zen. 76.11 (iii B.C.).
predict, τὸ μέλλον Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(1).245.
exaggerate in tragic style, τούτοις, ὅτι . . Str. 17.1.43.

children.label: II
children.definition: τὸ ἔξωθεν -τραγῳδούμενον external trappings, parade, Longin. 7.1.
serve as soldiers before, in pf. part., Hsch. s.v. ἀμοιβοί.
hold office of στρατηγός before, BGU 250.4 (ii A.D.).
wrench the neck in wrestling, Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.234d.
torture first, in Pass., v.l. in J. BJ 4.5.3.

turn towards, esp. towards a god as a suppliant, approach with prayer, supplicate, τοσαῦτά σʼ, ὦ Ζεῦ, προστρέπω S. Aj. 831: c. acc. pers. et inf., entreat one to do, μή μʼ ἀτιμάσῃς . . , ὧν ( = τούτων ἃ) σε προστρέπω φράσαι Id. OC 50: c. acc. rei et inf., pray that . . , ὀλέσθαι πρόστρεπʼ Ἀργείων χθόνα E. Supp. 1195:— Med., with aor. προσετραπόμην Hom. Epigr. 15.1; π. δῶμα, δόμους, Hom. l.c., A. Eu. 205; τὴν Διὸς . . Ἐργάνην S. Fr. 844: in late Prose, Plu. Cleom. 39, Ael. NA 15.21, etc.; reverence, celebrate, τινα Plu. Col. 2.1117a.
approach (as an enemy), Ἰαωλκὸν πολεμίᾳ χερὶ προστραπών Pi. N. 4.55 codd.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., make a matter of supplication, appeal to, τοῦ παθόντος προστρεπομένου τὴν πάθην Pl. Lg. 866b.
bring up in, ἱερεύς τις ἄτας δόμοις προσεθρέφθη A. Ag. 736 (lyr.).
feed up, Ruf. Fr. 68 ( Pass., prob. cj.).

children.label: II
children.definition: feed in addition to oneself, Teles p.40 H.
run to or towards, come to one, πρὸς τοὺς νεκρούς Pl. R. 440a; τινι Ar. Ach. 1084, Av. 759, X. An. 4.3.10, etc.: abs., run up, Id. HG 3.1.18, Cyr. 7.1.15, D. l.c., etc.
make a sally, πρός τι X. Cyr. 5.4.47.
happen to one, τινι D.S. 13.37 codd.; προστρέχει πολλαχοῦ τὸ γίγνεται" occurs frequently, Dam. Pr. 401.

children.label: II
children.definition: join or side with, [ τῇ συγκλήτῳ] Plb. 24.10.4, etc.; πρὸς τὴν τῶν πολλῶν γνώμην Id. 28.7.8; πρὸς τὴν ἀλήθειαν Id. 18.15.2.
approach, -τρέχων τῇ ἐννόμῳ ἡλικίᾳ, i.e. not quite of age, POxy. 247.12 (i A.D.).
resemble, c. dat., Corn. ND 32.

rub on or against: abs., προστρίβοντα by friction, Arist. HA 535b23:— Med., rub oneself against, τῷ τοίχῳ IG 42(1).126.10 ( Epid., ii A.D.):— Pass., to be rubbed on, Dsc. 4.153; προστετριμμένος worn away, dulled, πρὸς ἄλλοισιν οἴκοις A. Eu. 238.

children.label: II
children.definition: attribute, πᾶν τὸ ἀνθρώπειον πάθος τοῖς θεοῖς D.L. Prooem. 5.

data.quote: πᾶν τὸ ἀνθρώπειον πάθος τοῖς θεοῖς

children.label: III
children.definition: Med., mostly in bad sense, inflict or cause to be inflicted, πληγάς τισι Ar. Eq. 5; ὑμῖν τὸ μήνιμα τῶν ἀλιτηρίων προστρίψομαι Antipho 4.2.8; τινὶ συμφορὰν ἢ βλασφημίαν ἢ κακόν D. 25.52; τὴν ὑποψίαν τῆς προδοσίας Plu. Util. 2.89f:— Pass., γλώσσῃ ματαίᾳ ζημία προστρίβεται A. Pr. 331, cf. Sammelb. 5273.12 (v A.D.), PMonac. 6.66 (vi A.D.).

data.quote: ὑμῖν τὸ μήνιμα τῶν ἀλιτηρίων προστρίψομαι
τινὶ συμφορὰν ἢ βλασφημίαν ἢ κακόν

children.definition: πλούτου δόξαν προστρίψασθαι τοῖς κεκτημένοις attach to them the reputation of wealth, D. 22.75, 24.183.
impart, [ χροιᾶς] φάντασμα τοῖς ὁρατοῖς Gal. 7.96.
that which is rubbed on: metaph., that which is inflicted upon one, esp. a brand, disgrace, πόλει π. ἄφερτον ἐνθείς A. Ag. 395 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: tooth powders, Gal. 12.875, Aët. 5.25.
rubbing, galling, ἀστράβης interpol. in Arist. Col. (v. ἀστράβη).

definition: προστρόπαιος, Dor. ποτιτρόπαιος ( A. Supp. 362, Eu. 176, both lyr.), ον, ( προστροπή) prop.

children.definition: turning oneself towards: hence,

turns to a god or man to obtain purification, suppliant for purification, τὸν προστρόπαιον, τὸν ἱκέτην S. Ph. 930, cf. A. Supp. 362, Eu. 234, 445, S. Aj. 1173, E. Heracl. 1015, etc.: as Adj., ἕδραν ἔχοντα π. A. Eu. 41; προστρόπαιοι λιταί S. OC 1309.

children.label: b
children.definition: suppliant for vengeance, A. Ch. 286, Ag. 1587, Antipho 2.3.10.
polluted person, E. HF 1259; π. τῆς πόλεως bringing pollution on the city, prob. in Eup. 120; αὑτοῦ π., μὴ γὰρ δὴ τῆς πόλεως Aeschin. 2.158.

data.quote: αὑτοῦ π., μὴ γὰρ δὴ τῆς πόλεως

children.definition: π. αἷμα blood that cries for vengeance, E. Ion 1260, HF 1161; οὐδενὶ οὐδὲν π. καταλείψει Antipho 3.4.9: neut. as Subst., guilt, προστρόπαιον ἑαυτοῖς προσέθεντο D.C. 42.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass. (= ᾧ ἄν τις προστρέποιτο δεόμενος, Eust. 1807.11), the god to whom the murdered person turns for vengeance, avenger, οἱ τῶν θανόντων π. Antipho 4.1.4, cf. 4.2.8, Plb. 23.10.2 (pl.), Paus. 2.18.2.
turning of a suppliant ( ἱκέτης) to a god or man to implore protection or purification, supplication, A. Eu. 718 (pl.); λιταὶ καὶ π. Plu. Vind. 2.560e: hence,

any address to a god, solemn invocation, θεοὺς . . προστροπαῖς ἱκνουμένη A. Pers. 216, cf. E. Alc. 1156, IG 5(1).26.10 ( Amyclae, ii/i B.C.); ἱκεσία ξένων π. E. Heracl. 108 (lyr.); π. καὶ ἀρὰν ὑπὲρ τούτων ἐποιήσαντο Aeschin. 3.110; θεᾶς ἔχω προστροπήν discharge the duty of ministering to the goddess, E. IT 618; but πόλεως προστροπὴν ἔχειν address a petition to the city, S. OC 558; of libations, A. Ch. 85.

data.quote: π. καὶ ἀρὰν ὑπὲρ τούτων ἐποιήσαντο

children.definition: π. γυναικῶν suppliant band of women, ib. 21.

definition: προστρόπιος, ον, poet. for προστρόπαιος, Orph. A. 1235.

children.definition: suppliant, τινος S. Ph. 773: abs., Id. OT 41.

children.label: II
children.definition: accursed, Phot. s.v. προστρόπαιος.
clean beforehand with στρουθίον, PLeid.X. 100 ( Pass.).
run to, τοῖς καθηγηταῖς Phld. Lib. p.25 O.
obsequious person, sycophant, Phld. Herc. 1457.4.
round, Hsch.
prosterno, Gloss.
obtain oneʼs share of, and generally, obtain, προστυχόντι τῶν ἴσων S. Ph. 552; ἐμοῦ κολαστοῦ προστυχών Id. El. 1463: c. dat., meet with, hit upon, Pl. Lg. 844b, 893e, Plt. 262b, Sph. 246b.
befall one, κακότας π. τινί Pi. Fr. 42.5.

ὁ προστυγχάνων the first person one meets, anybody, Pl. Lg. 914b; πᾶς ὁ π. ib. 808e; οἱ αἰεὶ -τυγχάνοντες Th. 1.97; ὁ προστυχὼν Φρύξ Herod. 3.36: so in neut., τὰ προστυχόντα ξένια whatever fare there was, E. Alc. 754; ἐρρύφεον τὸ προστυχόν anything that came handy, Hp. Acut. 39; but τὸ προστυχόν casualness, Pl. Ti. 34c; πράξει τὸ π. ἑκάστοτε will act offhand, Id. Lg. 962c; ἐκ τοῦ προστυχόντος offhand, ex tempore, Plu. Symp. 2.150d, Pyth. 407b; so κατὰ τὸ π. D.H. 7.1.
with pillars in front, ναός Vitr. 3.2.1, 7 Praef. 17.

children.label: II
children.definition: πρόστυλον, τό, portico, IG 7.2808.10 ( Hyettus, iii B.C.), perh. to be read in ib. 2(2).204.27.
mordant, τῆς πορφύρας Hsch. s.v. μήλωθρα.
adherent, ὑμένες Archig. ap. Gal. 8.91, cf. Sor. 2.41, Gal. 14.710: c. dat., Ruf. Anat. 4; θρόνῳ π. J. AJ 3.6.5; cf. sq. [πρόστυπος]
executed in low relief, opp. ἔκτυπος (in high relief), Callix. 2, Plin. HN 35.152.
Subst., πρόστυποι, οἱ, of the Cherubim, J. AJ 3.6.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: lying flat, φύλλα Dsc. 4.10.
mould to the shape of a thing, τὸν πνεύμονα τῷ θώρακι Gal. 2.700 ( Pass.), cf. Orib. 46.17.3; τοῖς τοίχοις Herod.Med. ap. eund. 10.10.4:— Pass., Dsc. 2.105.
shaping by pressure, Paul.Aeg. 6.117.
thicken beforehand, τὰ ἀρώματα Thphr. Od. 24; τὸ ἔλαιον Dsc. 1.39.

children.label: II
children.definition: apply a mordant, PHolm. 3.30, prob. in PLeid.X. 100.

engaged in or acquainted with, ταῖς τιθασείαις τῶν ἰχθύων Pl. Plt. 264c; π. [τῇ στερεομετρίᾳ] γεγονότες Id. Epin. 990e; τῷ βίῳ ib. 973c, etc.; π. γίνεται,= προστυγχάνει, Id. Lg. 955d. Adv. -χῶς by chance, Numen. ap. Eus. PE 14.5.

definition: προστῷον (on the accent v. Hdn.Gr. 1.377), τό,

children.definition: portico, Pl. Prt. 314e, 315c, IG 2(2).1675.3, 1680.1, Plu. VOrat. 2.838d, etc.; written πρόστοον in IGRom. 3.690.8 ( Aperlae, i A.D.).—As Adj., τόποι πρόστωοι Sch. Il. 20.11.
maltreat besides, D. 21.32, J. AJ 12.4.5:— Pass., D. 54.40, J. AJ 6.13.7, D.C. 69.3.
have an interview with one before, τισι Th. 8.14; become acquainted with before, τοῖς ἤθεσι καὶ βουλεύμασί σου D.C. 52.33.
write out before, Sch. Pl. Grg. 448c.
to be arranged, agreed beforehand, Aen.Tact. 18.18, al., J. AJ 18.3.2; τὸ προσυγκείμενον Aen. Tact. 31.16; τὰ π. J. AJ 19.2.5.
throw into disorder before, τὰς τάξεις Plb. 5.84.9.
anoint beforehand, Orib. Fr. 74.

definition: προσυδρεύω, misspelling of προσεδρεύω, PMasp. 328 i 10, al. (vi A.D.).

children.definition: yoke together beforehand:— Pass., ἑτέρῳ εἰς γάμον π. Eust. 61.29.
bark at, τινι D.H. Th. 2, Them. Or. 16.205 d.
carping, Simp. in Ph. 1182.38.
assemble before, D.C. 37.33, al., Hsch. s.v. πρηγορεών.
conclude by a prosyllogism (cf. sq. [προσυλλογισμός]), Arist. APr. 66a35, Top. 156a7.
prosyllogism, i.e. a syllogism the conclusion of which forms the major premiss of another, Arist. APr. 44a22: pl., ib. 42b5.
one must use a prosyllogism, Arist. Top. 148b8.
conjoined, connected with matter, Procl. in Cra. p.71 P., Dam. Pr. 265, Eustr. in EN 284.14.
happen before, Agath. 5.15; τὰ -βεβηκότα Sch. Od. 7.243.
accommodate beforehand, v.l. for προσβιβάζω in Hierocl. in CA 14p.450M.

definition: προσυμβολέω, dub.l. et sens. in PTeb. 348.2 (i A.D.).

children.definition: prognostic, or perh. preliminary contribution, ταῦτα μὲν εἰρήσθω προσύμβολα, ὥς φασι Anon. ap. Suid.

data.quote: ταῦτα μὲν εἰρήσθω προσύμβολα, ὥς φασι

of Prosymna, St. Byz.; epith. of Hera at Argos, Timoth.Hist. et Agatho Samius ap. Ps.-Plu. Fluv. 18.3; Προσυμναίᾳ θεῷ, i.e. Δήμητρι Προσύμνῃ ( Paus. 2.37.1), IG 4.666.1 ( Lerna); Προσυμναῖος λεώς prob.ib. 666.7; ἁ πάτρα τῶν Π. ib. 5(2).493 ( Megalopolis).
sing besides, gloss on ποταείσομαι, Sch. Theoc. 2.11.

children.label: II
children.definition: celebrate in song as well, τινας LXX 2 Ma. 15.9.
besprinkle first, Agathin. ap. Orib. 10.7.22.
grow together before, ἢν προσυμφῠῇ τὸ ἔξω τῷ ἔσω Hp. Morb. 1.21.

data.quote: ἢν προσυμφῠῇ τὸ ἔξω τῷ ἔσω

children.definition: harmonize beforehand, S.E. M. 8.183 ( Pass.).
arrive at a total beforehand:— Pass., ὁ προσυναχθεὶς ἀριθμός Vett.Val. 32.3.
assemble together beforehand, J. Vit. 27, AJ 18.4.1.
antecedent aggregation, Dam. Pr. 96.
to be antecedently aggregated, Dam. Pr. 96.

definition: προσυναπάντησις, εως, ἡ, a rhet. figure, in which when two nouns are placed first the words belonging to the second precede those belonging to the first (as in Il. 4.450), Alex. Fig. 2.27.

children.definition: take counsel beforehand, Hippod. ap. Stob. 4.1.94:— Pass., to be settled beforehand, τὰ προσυνηδρευμένα ibid.
to be cohabiting with already, ᾧ προσύνεστι ἀνδρί PSI 5.450.9 (ii/iii A.D.), cf. POxy. 1473.25 (iii A.D.).
recommend or praise before, D.H. Rh. 10.5, Plu. Aud.poet. 2.19b; mention before, Sch. Od. 9.187.
cohabit or live as wife with before, τινι Hdt. 3.88, Plu. Demetr. 14.
arrange beforehand, στρατιώτην ἐσδραμεῖν Polyaen. 4.6.19:— Med., arrange before, τὰς δυνάμεις J. BJ 5.1.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: compose before, in Pass., -τεταγμέναι βίβλοι Vett.Val. 330.8, cf. 173.28.
complete before, in Pass., Aristeas 55, 77.
agree upon, arrange beforehand, Aen.Tact. 18.13; οὐδὲν προσυνθέμενος J. BJ 5.13.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: contract beforehand, φιλίαν τινὶ ἐπὶ τοῖς αὐτοῖς D.C. 36.45.

one must understand, supply in thought, Phld. Po. 5.32, Sch. E. Alc. 10, Sch. Pi. P. 9.42, Sch. Luc. Tim. 48.
listen to as well, τι Pl. Lg. 898d.

children.definition: understand something not expressed, supply in thought, Gal. 16.740, Alex.Aphr. in Sens. 105.13, Hierocl. in CA 3p.423M.:— Pass., Phld. Po. 5.10 (dub.), Ph. 1.443, Sch. Luc. Anach. 17.
unfold besides, τὰ γράμματα Lib. Decl. 43.61.
meet with, Ph. 2.186, PSI 4.292.10 (iii A.D.).
one must prescribe besides, Sor. 1.53 (s.v.l.).
exist besides, δεῖ τὴν τρίτην ἔτι -ειν Arist. GC 335a31; καὶ μηδὲ [ἂν] ταφῆναι προσυπῆρχεν οἴκοι μοι and it would further have been my fate not even to be buried at home, D. 21.106.
underlie in addition, c. dat., Eustr. in EN 113.10.
indicate besides, Sch. A. Th. 495 ( Pass.).
surpass, τινὰς ὠμότητι Ph. 2.44, cf. 190; ἀλλήλους ἐν ἀσεβείαις J. BJ 7.8.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: exceed, transgress, τοὺς ἐπιεικείας ὅρους Ph. 2.393 (s.v.l.): abs., go beyond what is right or necessary, Id. 1.276, 2.262, al.
prepare the ground for another, Plu. Sol. 12.
project beyond, Hp. Epid. 5.49.
to be answerable also for, τῆς τύχης D. Prooem. 25 (v.l. πρὸς ὑπ-); also π. δίκην τῆς ὕβρεως Aristid. 2.429 J.
promise besides, Plu. Demetr. 10, D.C. 38.31, 40.60, Ant.Lib. 41.6.
make a higher bid, Wilcken Chr. 167.20 (ii B.C.).
place under, submit besides, Plu. Praec. 2.814f:— Pass., Gal. 18(2).454.
sketch out besides, τι τῇ διανοίᾳ Longin. 14.2, cf. Ph. 1.577, D.L. 6.103: abs., Ph. 1.590.

children.label: II
children.definition: subjoin, Ptol. Phas. p.10 H.; add below in writing, PMag.Lond. 121.804.

one must show besides, τι ἀκριβέστερον Ph. 1.11.
whet upon, τινί τι Ael. NA 9.16.
lie under besides, v.l. for προϋπ- in Gal. UP 3.8.
to be mortgaged besides, OGI 46.17 ( Halic., iii B.C.).
to be assumed besides, Gal. 6.246, 10.351.
place underneath, τοῖς μηροῖς τὰ γόνατα Paul.Aeg. 3.76.

subtract besides, Ptol. Geog. 1.13.7.

definition: προσυπομένω, pf. -μεμένηκα Jahresh. 15 Beibl. 96 ( Thrace, iii B.C.):—

children.definition: endure further, PPetr. 2p.22 (iii B.C.), Ph. 2.531.

one must mention besides, Str. 17.3.1.
suspect besides, τι τῶν ἀληθῶν Eun. VS p.501 B.
one must note besides, Procl. Chr. p.101 Allen.
suspect besides, Phld. Ind.Sto. 4, D.C. Fr. 40.46a; π. μή . . Id. Fr. 40.46: c. inf. fut., Id. Fr. 111.3.

put underneath besides, Dsc. 1.68.7, v.l. in Hippiatr. 74.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., assume besides, Gal. 6.127.
suspect besides, D.C. 58.18, 66.5.
assist in besides, J. AJ 15.6.2.
to be channelled, provided with a cavity beforehand, D.S. 32.10.

definition: προσυρίζω, f.l. for προσσυρίζω in Plb. 8.20.5, 8.25.10.

children.definition: preliminary exposition, Aps. Rh. p.242 H.
to be drawn up beforehand, ἡ προσυνεσταλμένη αὐθεντία LXX 3 Ma. 2.29.

definition: προσυφαίνω, 1 aor. inf. -υφᾶναι Sever. ap. Eus. PE 13.17:—

children.definition: interweave with, ἀθανάτῳ θνητόν Pl. Ti. 41d, cf. Sever. l.c.; τὸ ἀκόλουθον τῇ γραφῇ Ph. 1.511, cf. 536 ( Pass.), Jul. Gal. 178b; καινόν τι τοῖς ἀρχαίοις Them. Or. 26.316a; προσυφάνθη τὸ χόριον (sc. τῷ σώματι) Porph. Marc. 32: metaph. of buildings, οἰκίας προσυφαίνουσι ταῖς γωνίαις (in a painting) Philostr. Im. 2.28; [ στοαὶ] αἷς ἱππόδρομός τε προσύφανται καὶ θέατρον Lib. Or. 11.218.

data.quote: στοαὶ] αἷς ἱππόδρομός τε προσύφανται καὶ θέατρον

children.definition: fix on beneath, Theo Sm. p.180 H. ( Pass.).
reply, rejoin, Phld. Lib. p.6 O.; present itself to the mind from without, in pf. part., τὰ προσυφεστῶτα external objects, M. Ant. 5.19.
raise still higher, LXX 1 Ma. 12.36, J. BJ 3.7.30, etc.

definition: προσφάγημα [ φᾰ], ατος, τό, = sq., Aesop. 64, Moer. p.274 P.

children.definition: Ev.Jo. 21.5, Aesop. 325, PLond. ined. 2687 (iv A.D.); ἄρτον ἕνα καὶ π. POxy. 498.33 (ii A.D.), cf. 736.89, 739.10 ( i B.C. /i A.D.): metaph., of an illicit commission or agio, τὸ καλούμενον παρʼ αὐτοῖς π. OGI 484.26 (Pergam.).
victim sacrificed beforehand, IG 12(5).593.12 ( Iulis, v B.C.).
victim sacrificed for others, τύμβῳ πρόσφαγμα E. Hec. 41; θεᾷ π. Id. IT 243, cf. Plu. Comp.Thes.Rom. 1 (2): pl., of a single victim, E. Hec. 265; of the victimʼs blood, Id. Alc. 845.

children.label: II
children.definition: sacrifice, slaughter, A. Ag. 1278, E. Tr. 628 (pl.).
sacrifice beforehand, τινι E. Hel. 1255 ( Pass.), Pl. l.c.
kill first, dub. l. in Plu. Phoc. 30.
appear besides, π. κοινωνός τινος Aristid. Or. 45(8).24; f.l. for προφ- in X. Cyr. 4.5.57 codd.; cf. ποτιφαίνω.

definition: προσφανής, ές, dub. sens., προσφανῆ· Θεόφραστος ἐν Μεταλλικῷ χρυσίου συρροάς, Hsch.

children.definition: fresh, not decomposed, of a corpse miraculously preserved, νῦν δέ μοι ἑρσήεις καὶ π. ἐν μεγάροισιν κεῖσαι Il. 24.757; νεκρὸς π. Hdt. 2.89, 121.εʹ; τροφὴ ἔτι π. (sc. before digestion begins) Arist. PA 675b32; [ ζῷα] τὰ πεπωκότα πόμα π. which have taken a recent drink, Id. HA 520b31; πορφύρας . . πρόσφατον τὸ ἄνθος ἔτι φυλαττούσης Plu. Alex. 36; of fish, Antiph. 218.1, Men. 462.4, PMich.Zen. 72.8 (iii B.C.); ἐχῖνοι Posidipp. 14; of poultry, Gal. Vict.Att. 8; [ κρέα] Hp. Acut. (Sp.) 49, cf. Sor. 2.15, al.; δέλεαρ Arist. HA 534a12; ζῷα π., opp. salted, D.S. 3.31, cf. Gal. 6.728; ἄλφιτα καὶ ἄλητα Hp. Vict. 2.44, gloss on ποταίνια in Acut. 37; καρποί, ἔλαιον, Arist. Pr. 926a30, 927a29; ῥίζαι [σιλφίου] Thphr. HP 6.3.5; σταφυλή LXX Nu. 6.3, Sor. 1.51; φῦκος Agatharch. 35; νάρδος Dsc. 1.7; χιών Plb. 3.55.1; παγάν Pi. P. 4.299 (unless πρόσφατον ξενωθείς = recently entertained); ὕδωρ newly-drawn well-water, Plu. QConv. 2.690c; ποτόν Porph. Marc. 4; αἷμα uncoagulated, opp. πεπηγότες θρόμβοι, Hp. Epid. 7.10; [ καταμηνίων ῥύσις] -ωτέρα Arist. GA 764a6; σπέρμα, οὖρον, Id. Pr. 924b28, 907b25.

data.quote: νῦν δέ μοι ἑρσήεις καὶ π. ἐν μεγάροισιν κεῖσαι
τροφὴ ἔτι π. (sc. before digestion begins)
πορφύρας . . πρόσφατον τὸ ἄνθος ἔτι φυλαττούσης

children.definition: recent, δίκαι A. Ch. 804 (lyr.); ἐπιστολαί S. Fr. 128; ὀργή Lys. 18.19; ὀχεία Arist. HA 509b31; φόβος Aen.Tact. 3.1; φθόνος Plu. Them. 24; θεωρίαι καὶ μαθήσεις Arist. EE 1237a24; φαντασία Id. MM 1203b4; λύπη defined as δόξα πρόσφατος κακοῦ παρουσίας Zeno Stoic. 1.52; ἀτύχημα Plb. 1.21.9; εὐεργεσίαι Id. 2.46.1; [ πράγματα] Plu. Symp. 2.146b; ὄγκοι ( = οἰδήματα) Gal. 18(2).145; βήξ, i.e. not yet chronic, Sor. 1.123, cf. 2.46; γάλα, i.e. lately begun to be secreted, Id. 1.89; of persons, recent in date, of Homer, Arist. Mete. 351b35; μάρτυρες . . οἱ μὲν παλαιοὶ οἱ δὲ π. Id. Rh. 1375b27: used predicatively, χρόνοι [τοῖς πλουσίοις] τοῦ δίκην ὑποσχεῖν . . δίδονται, καὶ τἀδικήμαθʼ ἕωλα . . ὡς ὑμᾶς καὶ ψύχρʼ ἀφικνεῖται, τῶν δʼ ἄλλων ἡμῶν ἕκαστος π. κρίνεται the cases of us poor men are served up fresh, D. 21.112; νεαλὴς καὶ π. fresh (because recently imprisoned), Id. 25.61.
new, οὐκ ἔστι πᾶν π. ὑπὸ τὸν ἥλιον LXX Ec. 1.9; οὐκ ἔσται ἐν σοὶ θεὸς π. ib. Ps. 80(81).10; ὁδὸν π. καὶ ζῶσαν Ep.Hebr. 10.20; ἀεὶ ἡδίων ἡ π. ἀφροδίτη Alciphr. 1.39.

data.quote: οὐκ ἔστι πᾶν π. ὑπὸ τὸν ἥλιον

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. -τως newly, lately, π. ἠγγελμένων Aen.Tact. 16.2, cf. LXX De. 24.5, OGI 315.23 ( Pessinus, ii B.C.), Parth. 28.1, D.S. 14.115, J. BJ 1.6.2, Babr. 30.3, Anon.Hist. ( FGrH 153) p.826 J. (Orig. = νεωστὶ ἀνῃρημένος (cf. πέφαται, etc.) acc. to Phot.; perh. slaughtered for (the occasion).)

similar, like, c. dat., Hdt. 2.105, 4.33, A. Ag. 1218, Ch. 176, E. Hel. 591, Ar. Ec. 67, Th. 1.49, etc.; προσφερέστατοι [τῇ θεῷ] ἄνδρες Pl. Ti. 24d; τὸ σῶμα προσφερὴς τῇ φυχῇ Id. R. 494b, cf. Phlb. 51d; βίος οἴνῳ π. Antiph. 240; προσφερέστερον δέμας E. Hel. 559: rarely c. gen., πατρὸς προσφερεῖς ὀμμάτων αὐγαι Id. HF 131 (lyr.). Adv. -ρῶς, c. dat., Placit. 4.4.4, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: conducive, useful, τινι Hdt. 5.111 (v.l. προφερέστερον).

definition: προσφέρω (once ποσφέρω, q.v.), Dor. ποτιφέρω Prov. ap. Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.239a: fut. προσοίσω E. Andr. 257: Ion. aor. προσένεικα Hdt. 3.87: Ion. aor. Pass. προσηνείχθην Id. 9.71:—

children.definition: bring to or upon, apply to, π. πύργοισι κλιμάκων προσαμβάσεις E. Ph. 488; πῦρ σοι Id. Andr. 257; μηχανὰς [τοῖσι τείχεσι] Hdt. 6.18, cf. Th. 2.58 (and so metaph., Hdt. 6.125 (unless in signf. A. I.2); π. νόμον, ψήφισμα πρὸς τὴν συγγραφήν bring to bear against . ., D. 35.39); τὴν χεῖρα πρὸς τοὺς μυκτῆρας Hdt. 3.87; but χέρα τινὶ προσενεγκεῖν lay hands upon . . , Pi. P. 9.36; π. τὰς χεῖρας αὐτοῖς, in hostile sense, Plb. 3.79.4, cf. PCair.Zen. 18.8 (iii B.C.), PPetr. 2p.10 (iii B.C.) (but also in a friendly relation, X. Mem. 2.6.31 sq., and in supplication to the gods, hold out oneʼs hands to, UPZ 106.12, 107.14 (ii B.C.)); ἀνάγκην or ἀναγκαίην τισὶ π. Hdt. 7.136, 172, cf. A. Ch. 76 (lyr.); βίην τισί Hdt. 3.19; τινὶ βάσανον Pl. Phlb. 23a; so of surgical or medical treatment, Hp. Ulc. 24; πταρμὸν [τῇ λυγγί] Pl. Smp. 189a ( Pass.). cf. 187e; τὰς τομὰς καὶ τὰς καύσεις τινί D.C. 55.17; κλύδωνα σαυτῷ αὐθαίρετον bring upon thyself, Trag.Adesp. 568: without dat., apply, employ, use, καινὰ σοφά E. Med. 298, Ar. Th. 1130 (cf. infr. 3); ἴαμα Th. 2.51; τεχνήματα A. Fr. 322; πάσας μηχανάς E. IT 112; πάντας ἐλέγχους Ar. Lys. 484; π. τόλμαν bring it to bear, Pi. N. 10.30; also π. πόλεμον Hdt. 7.9.γʹ (v.l.); ἔρωτα Pl. Smp. 187e.

data.quote: τὰς τομὰς καὶ τὰς καύσεις τινί

children.definition: add, μηδὲ π. μέθυ S. OC 481 (or in signf. A. I.3a); εἰ κακὸν προσοίσομεν νέον παλαιῷ E. Med. 78 (or perh., bear in addition); π. τι πρός τι Hdt. 6.125 (or in signf. A. I.1).

present, offer, ἄεθλον, of a triumphal ode, Pi. O. 9.108; λουτρὰ πατρί S. El. 434; [ τόξα] Id. Ph. 775; τὴν δᾷδά τινι Ar. Pl. 1052; τὴν χεῖρά τινι ἄκραν Id. Lys. 436; δῶρα Th. 2.97 ( Pass.); οὐθὲν κολοβὸν προσφέρομεν πρὸς τοὺς θεούς Arist. Fr. 101; οἶνον μὴ π. Schwyzer 696 ( Chios); σφάγια καὶ θυσίας LXX Am. 5.25, al., cf. Ep.Hebr. 11.4; τὸ δῶρόν σου Ev.Matt. 5.24, etc.

data.quote: οὐθὲν κολοβὸν προσφέρομεν πρὸς τοὺς θεούς

children.label: b
children.definition: θαλλὸν χιμαίραις S. Fr. 502; π. τὰ ῥυφήματα καὶ τὰ πόματα Hp. Acut. 26, cf. Pl. Phdr. 270b, Pl.Com. 55, Alex. 189, etc.; π. τὸ φάρμακον τῇ κεφαλῇ Pl. Chrm. 157c; ἑαυτῷ π φάρμακον administer poison to oneself, POxy. 472.6 (ii A.D.); set food before one, X. Mem. 3.11.13 and 14, Pl. Lg. 792a: c. inf., π. τινὶ ἐμπιεῖν καὶ φαγεῖν X. Cyr. 7.1.1; also διψῶντι γάρ τοι πάντα προσφέρων σοφὰ οὐκ ἂν πλέον τέρψειας ἢʼ μπιεῖν διδούς S. Fr. 763; χυμὸς ἐπιτήδειος προσφέρειν Hp. VM 24; ὁ προσφέρων Id. Epid. 1.23:— Pass., τὰ προσφερόμενα ibid., X. Cyn. 6.2; ἡ προσφερομένη τροφή Pl. Sph. 230c.

data.quote: π. τὰ ῥυφήματα καὶ τὰ πόματα
διψῶντι γάρ τοι πάντα προσφέρων σοφὰ οὐκ ἂν πλέον τέρψειας ἢʼ μπιεῖν διδούς

children.definition: address proposals, an offer, etc., π. λόγον τινί Hdt. 3.134, 5.30, cf. 40; περὶ σπονδῶν Th. 3.109; ὅτι . . D. 48.6; λόγους π. τισί Th. 3.4; λόγους π. περὶ ξυμβάσεως τοῖς στρατηγοῖς Id. 2.70, cf. Hdt. 8.52; λόγους τισὶ ξυναποστῆναι Th. 1.57.

data.quote: λόγους π. περὶ ξυμβάσεως τοῖς στρατηγοῖς

children.definition: convey property by deed of gift or by bequest, Arch.Pap. 4.130 (ii A.D.):— Pass., PAmh. 2.71.6 (ii A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: contribute, pay, ἑκατὸν τάλαντα π. Hdt. 3.91, cf. Th. 1.138; π. μετοίκιον pay an alientax, X. Vect. 2.1, cf. OGI 13.20 ( Samos, iv B.C., Med.), PGiss. 50.12 (iii A.D.); bring in, yield, X. Vect. 4.15, D. 27.9.

children.label: III
children.definition: resemble, c. acc. of respect in which, π. νόον ἀθανάτοις Pi. N. 6.4; θηρὸς χρωτὶ νόον προσφέρων Id. Fr. 43; π. τρόπους παιδί Trag.Adesp. 453; cf. infr. B. I.5.

children.label: IV
children.definition: bear in addition, v. supr. A. I.2.

children.label: B
children.definition: Pass., with fut. προσοίσομαι Th. 6.44, D. 48.22: aor. προσηνεγκάμην, = προσηνέχθην, D.S. 16.8:— to be borne towards, and of ships, put in, εἰς λιμένα X. Cyr. 5.4.6: hence,

attack, assault, πρός τινας Hdt. 5.34, 111, 112, 7.209, X. HG 4.3.20, etc.; τινι Hdt. 5.109, Th. 4.126, etc.; κατὰ τὸ ἰσχυρότατον προσηνείχθησαν attacked where the enemy was strongest, Hdt. 9.71, cf. 5.101, Th. 7.44, Pl. R. 422b; προσφέρεσθαι ἄποροι difficult to engage, Hdt. 9.49, cf. Pl. Ly. 223b.

go to or towards, approach, ἐκ τοῦ Ἰκαρίου πελάγεος προσφερόμενοι sailing, Hdt. 6.96; π. τοῖσι Κορινθίοισι Id. 8.94; τῷ σκοπέλῳ, τῇ Τρῳάδι, Luc. JTr. 15, DMort. 27[19].2; πόλεμος ἀπὸ Πελοποννήσου -φερόμενος Plu. Per. 8; τὰ -όμενα πρήγματα matters that were brought to him, Hdt. 2.173.

deal with, behave oneself in a certain way towards a person, ἀπὸ τοῦ ἴσου ὑμῖν π. Th. 1.140; τοῖς κρείσσοσι καλῶς Id. 5.111, cf. X. Cyr. 7.2.16; τισὶν οὐ μετρίως D. 9.24, cf. PTeb. 750.2 (ii B.C.), Sammelb. 5675.6 (ii B.C.); φιλανθρώπως [τῇ Ποτειδαία] D.S. 16.8, cf. SIG 807.13 ( Magn. Mae.); ὀρθότατα ἵπποις π. X. Eq. 1.1; also τίνα τρόπον προσφέρῃ πρὸς τὰ παιδικά Pl. Ly. 205b, cf. Phdr. 252d; ἄριστα π. πρὸς τοὺς ἀμφισβητοῦντας D. 48.22; also of circumstances, ταῖς ξυμφοραῖς εὐξυνετώτερον meet them with intelligence, Th. 4.18; πρὸς τὰ πράγματα ἄριστα π. Id. 6.44; πρὸς τὰς τύχας Pl. R. 604d; πρὸς λόγον answer it, X. Cyr. 4.5.44: abs., χρησμῳδέων π. Hdt. 7.6; ὀλιγώρως π. Lys. 9.17.

data.quote: τίνα τρόπον προσφέρῃ πρὸς τὰ παιδικά

children.definition: προσφέρεσθαί τινι come near, be like, ὁ χαρακτὴρ τοῦ προσώπου προσφέρεσθαι ἐδόκεε ἐς ἑωυτόν Hdt. 1.116; cf. supr. A. III, and v. προσφερής.

data.quote: ὁ χαρακτὴρ τοῦ προσώπου προσφέρεσθαι ἐδόκεε ἐς ἑωυτόν

children.label: II
children.definition: to be added, Longin. Proll.Heph. p.89C.

children.label: C
children.definition: Med., with fut. -οίσομαι Phld. Sign. 8: 3 sg. aor. 1 subj. -ενέγκηται Epicur. Ep. 3p.64U.:— προσφέρεσθαί τι take, of food or drink, assimilate, π. σῖτον, ποτόν. X. Cyr. 4.2.41, cf. Aeschin. 1.145, Thphr. HP 8.4.5, Epicur. l.c., Plu. Dem. 30, Cic. 3, etc.
exhibit, ὑμῖν φιλοτιμίαν Epist. Phil. ap. D. 18.167, cf. Epicur. Ep. 1p.14U., Inscr.Prien. 42.14, 108.221 (ii B.C.), etc.; also π. ἑαυτόν ib. 111.294 (i B.C.).
Act., apply, κἂν ὁτιοῦν δουλείας Pl. R. 563d; πᾶσαν σπουδὴν καὶ μηχανήν Plb. 1.18.11, cf. Supp.Epigr. 2.663.5 ( Prusa, ii B.C.), PTeb. 27.14, al. (ii B.C.).
contribute, πλεῖστα πρός τι Athenio 1.2 (s. v. l.); bring with one as dowry, εἱματισμὸν καὶ κόσμον PEleph. 1.4 (iv B.C.), cf. PGiss. 2.12 (ii B.C.), etc.; cf. supr. A.II.
declare, μὴ εἰδέναι γράμματα PHamb. 39.63 (ii A.D.), cf. POxy. 237 vii 26 (ii A.D.), etc.
add land by deed of conveyance, κυρία ἔσται -ομένη πρὸς πόλιν ἣν ἂν βούληται OGI 225.10 ( Didyma, iii B.C.), cf. 221.44 ( Ilium, iii B.C.), al.

data.quote: κυρία ἔσται -ομένη πρὸς πόλιν ἣν ἂν βούληται

children.definition: convey property, π. ἐν προσφορᾷ [μέρος οἰκίας] PRyl. 155.7 (ii A.D.), etc.
flee for refuge to, c. dat., Plu. Pomp. 46, Cic. 3, POxy. 488.23 (ii A.D.), cf. J. AJ 1.19.8, Sm. Ez. 29.16.
one must be liable to a prosecution besides, D. 37.38 (or divisim).

definition: πρόσφημι, mostly 3 sg. aor. προσέφη ( Dor. aor. προσέφᾱσεν Call. Lav.Pall. 79),

children.definition: speak to, address, τινα Il. 1.84, Hes. Sc. 77, etc.; in a parody of Homer, Cratin. 68: c. dupl. acc., τὸν δʼ οὔ τι π. Il. 4.401: abs., 13.768, Od. 11.565:—also inf. Med., προσφάσθαι ἔπος 23.106.
call to, address, τινα E. Alc. 331, Hipp. 1097, Or. 481, etc.; salute, σῆμα AP l.c.
call by a name, call so and so, καὶ πάγον Κρόνου προσεφθέγξατο Pi. O. 10(11).50; π. μιᾷ κλήσει Pl. Plt. 287e.

children.label: II
children.definition: sound to, accompany, [ αὐλοὶ] π. χοροῖς Poll. 4.81.
accosting; δῶρα π. gifts brought to a bride with a salutation, Poll. 3.36.
addressed, saluted, σοῦ φωνῆς by thy voice, S. Ph. 1067, cf. AP 7.649 ( Anyt.).
address, salutation, mostly in pl., A. Ag. 903, Ch. 876, E. Ion 401, etc.: sg., S. Aj. 500, Ph. 235; epithet, Σαπφοῦς τὸ ἡδὺ π. Philostr. Im. 2.1.

meet to oneʼs own or anotherʼs hurt, meet in an evil hour, ἤν σοι λοιδορῆται προσφθαρείς if he, curse him, meet and insult you, Ar. Ec. 248; θεούσῃ νηῒ προσφθαρείς mischievously meeting a ship in full course, Ael. NA 2.17; θηρίῳ (of a person) προσέφθαρσαι Alciphr. 1.32, cf. 34; also, make an acquaintance in an evil hour, Plu. Frat. 2.482b:—dub. sens. in POxy. 1100.20 (iii A.D.).
addressing, saluting, μῦθοι π. words of salutation, A. Pers. 153 (anap.); π. σοι νόστου βοά ib. 935 (lyr.).
oppose through envy, Plu. Cam. 36; regard with envy, Id. Alex. 33.

definition: προσφίγγω, f.l. for προσσφίγγω in Gal. 18(1).350.

children.definition: kindness, goodwill, δαιμόνων A. Th. 515.
approach so as to kiss, οἱ προσφιλοῦντες the kissers, late phrase for οἱ ἀμείβοντες the rafters, Eust. 1327.1.

dear, beloved, τῶν ἡλίκων . . προσφιλεστάτῳ Hdt. 1.123, cf. Th. 5.40: c. dat., dear or friendly to . . , Hdt. 1.163, S. Ichn. 78, Pl. Grg. 507e, etc.: of things, pleasing, agreeable, ἔργον θεοῖσι π. A. Th. 580; στολή, χάρις, S. Ph. 224 ( Sup.), 558; πάσαις ἡλικίαις . . ἡ χρῆσις αὐτῆς (sc. τῆς μουσικῆς) ἐστὶ π. Arist. Pol. 1340a5; π. ἑκάστῳ . . τὸ κατὰ φύσιν Id. HA 590a10; τῇ αἰσθήσει Thphr. Od. 45; also of actions, lovely, ὅσα π. Ep.Phil. 4.8. Adv. -λῶς agreeably, c. dat., OGI 331.9 ( Pergam., ii B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., of persons, kindly affectioned, well-disposed, ὥς μʼ ἔθεσθε προσφιλῆ S. Ph. 532, cf. Th. 1.92, 7.86. Adv. -λῶς kindly, S. El. 442, Pl. Lg. 822b; π. ἡμῖν ἔχειν to be kindly affectioned to us, X. HG 2.3.44; π. χρῆσθαί Id. Mem. 2.3.16: Comp. -έστερον Pl. Mx. 248d: Sup. -έστατα X. Eq.Mag. 1.1, -εστάτως Isoc. (s. v.l.) ap. Poll. 3.63: poet. προσφιλέως IG 9(1).235 ( Larymna).
add from a love of splendour, ἀναθήματα Str. 13.4.2, cf. 17.1.8.

children.label: II
children.definition: have a love of beauty, Ph. 1.495.
vie with another in anything, τισὶ πρός τι Plb. 2.19.6.
cling stoutly to, τῇ δόξῃ τῇ αὑτοῦ Arist. Mete. 343b25; persist in, πολέμῳ Charito 5.1.
insist, contend, c. inf., Hld. 10.19.
J. BJ 5.11.3, Plu. QConv. 2.648d.
maintain obstinately, τῇ ἰδίᾳ δόξῃ Phlp. in Mete. 88.20.
speculate further upon, ἔτι τῷ λόγῳ Plu. QConv. 2.669c; ταῦτα π. Luc. Sat. 9.

children.label: II
children.definition: philosophize in company with another, c. dat. pers., Id. Gall. 11, Philostr. VS 2.1.9: metaph., τῇ ἐρημίᾳ καὶ τῇ δικέλλῃ Luc. Tim. 6.
employ further art, Athenio 1.25; add by art, τοῖς καταπήροις ὀνείροις παρʼ ἑαυτοῦ τι π. Artem. 1.11, cf. Iamb. in Nic. p.116P. ( Pass.): c. inf., Arr. Epict. 2.20.21.

children.label: II
children.definition: cavil, Ph. 2.509.
lavish money or enthusiasm upon, τῇ ῥαθυμίᾳ Ael. VH 9.9: abs., Ph. 1.451, Ephes. 2.20 (ii A.D.), IGRom. 4.881.7 ( Tacina, iii A.D.), Phalar. Ep. 142.2.
make affectionate overtures to a woman, Nic.Dam. 47.7J.
inflame as well, Paul.Aeg. 3.78.

go or come to frequently, resort to, τὸ κουρεῖον, ἵνα οἱ Δεκελεῖς π. Lys. 23.3, cf. Id. 24.20, D. 25.52, Hyp. Ath. 6, IG 2(2).1237.64; π. τισί associate with, Str. 14.1.32; esp. go to a master, D.H. Rh. 9.11, etc.; τοῖς παλαιοῖς λόγοις Plu. QConv. 2.653b.

children.label: II
children.definition: visit, τὰ κακὰ π. πρὸς τὸ γῆρας Antiph. 240.

data.quote: τὰ κακὰ π. πρὸς τὸ γῆρας

children.definition: bringing to, applying, τῶν κλιμάκων Plb. 5.16.7; application, use, Pl. Lg. 638c.
presenting, offering, ib. 792a; οἱ ἄρτοι τῆς π. shewbread, LXX 3 Ki. 7.48.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass.) that which is added, increase, τῶν ἡμαρτημένων ἄκη μέν ἐστι π. δʼ οὐκ ἔστʼ ἔτι S. OC 1270; bounty, benefit, ib. 581; wedding present, Thphr. Char. 30.19; offering, LXX Ps. 39(40).7, al., Act.Ap. 21.26: pl., ib. 24.17, J. AJ 11.4.1, Stud.Pal. 1.7.27 (v A.D.), etc.; offerings for the dead, PMonac. 8.5, 23 (vi A.D.), PLond. 5.1708.62 (vi A.D.); deed of gift, esp. of donatio propter nuptias, Mitteis Chr. 288.8 (ii A.D.), PTeb. 351.1 (ii A.D.), PRyl. 155.20 (ii A.D.).

data.quote: τῶν ἡμαρτημένων ἄκη μέν ἐστι π. δʼ οὐκ ἔστʼ ἔτι

children.definition: income, revenue, Antipho Fr. 31, J. AJ 19.8.2.

children.label: III
children.definition: Med.) taking of food, Arist. Somn.Vig. 458a22, Metaph. 1000a14, Thphr. HP 7.9.4, 8.4.4, Od. 5; ἡ τοῦ ὑγροῦ π. Arist. PA 671a13; πόσεις καὶ -φοραί Plu. Sanit. 2.129e.
food, victuals, Hp. Aph. 2.33 (pl.), Thphr. CP 4.9.6, Orph. Fr. 49.87.
flavour, Thphr. HP 4.8.11, Ath. 1.33f; bouquet, Thphr. HP 9.19.1.
bring to, bring in, τὰ ὅπλα Hdt. 1.82; [ τὰ δράγματα] X. HG 7.2.8.
approach, τῶν δεσποτῶν Vett.Val. 5.16 (s.v.l.).
serviceable, useful, τὰ π. τῇ στρατιῇ Hdt. 7.20, cf. S. OC 1774 (anap.), etc.: abs., ἐκπορίζεσθαι ἃ πρόσφορα ἦν Th. 1.125, cf. 7.62.

suitable, fitting, κόσμος, κόμπος, Pi. N. 3.31, 8.48, cf. E. Heracl. 480, etc.; π. καὶ οἰκεῖον Epicur. Fr. 250 (= Metrod. Fr. 1 K.): c. dat., Pi. N. 7.63, E. Supp. 338, Hec. 1246, Ar. V. 809, Av. 124 ( Comp.), prob. in Pi. N. 9.7; τροφαί Antiph. 62; οὐχὶ πρόσφορος ἁμερίῳ γέννᾳ suitable to, agreeing with, E. Ph. 129 (lyr.): c. inf., οὐ πρόσφορον μολεῖν ʼtis not fit or meet to go, A. Eu. 207, cf. Pi. O. 9.81, Ocell. 4.12; ζῴοις πρόσφορα ἐσθίειν J. BJ 6.3.3.

πρόσφορον, τό, what is fitting or suitable, Arist. EN 1180b12; ἡ φύσις αὐτὴ ζητεῖ τὸ π. Id. HA 615a26: c. gen., μακρᾶς κελεύθου . . τὰ π. attendance meet after a long journey, A. Ch. 711, cf. 714; τὰ π. τῆς νῦν παρούσης ξυμφορᾶς E. Hel. 509: abs., τὰ πρόσφορα things meet or due, esp. for the dead, Hdt. 4.14, E. Alc. 148; τὰ π. πάντα Ar. Pax 1025 (lyr.): τὰ π. as Adv., fitly, E. Hipp. 112, cf. 1361 (anap.): regul. Adv., -ρως ἔχειν τινί Thphr. CP 4.7.2, cf. Phld. Herc. 1457.7.

data.quote: ἡ φύσις αὐτὴ ζητεῖ τὸ π.
τὰ π. τῆς νῦν παρούσης ξυμφορᾶς

children.label: II
children.definition: πρόσφορα, τά, that which is taken or eaten, f.l. in Hp. VM 24; cf. προσφορά III.2.

children.label: III
children.definition: πρόσφορα, τά, revenues, rents, PTeb. 88.15 (ii B.C.), POxy. 1208.22 (iii A.D.), 1829.4 (vi A.D.), etc.; τὰ Ἀριστίππου λεγόμενα π. the place called Aristippusʼs Rents, PPetr. 2p.56 (iii B.C.).
seal beforehand, IG 2(2).1013.66.
refuge, asylum, POxy. 135.25 (vi A.D.).
= clientela, Gloss.
fleeing for refuge, Aesop. 417, v.l. in Hdn. 5.3.10.
Arist. HA 528a33.
supernumerary teeth, Hippiatr. 95.
firmly attached by growth, Thphr. CP 1.6.3; λοβοὶ ὤτων προσφυεῖς PPetr. 3p.25; ὄνυχες π. τῇ σαρκί Adam. 2.4; opp. προσαρτής, χοιράς Antyll. ap. Orib. 45.2.2.

fixed or attached to, θρῆνυν . . προσφυέʼ ἐξ αὐτῆς [τῆς κλισίης] Od. 19.58; τοῖς ὀστέοις Diog.Oen. 39: metaph., inseparable from, Epicur. Fr. 200: Comp., more akin to, Pl. Phlb. 64c, 67a. Adv. -ῶς, of kissing, Luc. DMeretr. 3.2.
π. τινί attached or devoted to, ἐδωδαῖς καὶ . . ἡδοναῖς Pl. R. 519b.

children.label: II
children.definition: naturally belonging to, suitable or fitted for a thing, τῶν δικαίων π. καὶ συγγενεῖς Id. Ep. 344a; τοῖς πράγμασι π. λέξις D.H. Th. 5; π. τῷ θεῷ ἄγαλμα Hierocl. in CA 1p.421M.: c. inf., οἰκτίσασθαι -έστατος most adapted to move pity, Longin. 34.2. Adv. -ῶς, Ion. -έως, προσφυέως λέγειν speak suitably, ably, Hdt. 1.27, cf. Ph. 2.421, al.

definition: προσφυλακή, ἡ, f.l. in Plb. 3.75.4, for προφυλ-.

children.definition: excrescence, of expletives, Demetr. Eloc. 55 (pl.).
one who seeks or is under protection, π. θεοῦ Ph. 1.187, al., Hdn. 5.3.10; client, Procop.Gaz. Ep. 72, Sch. Il. 9.640; gloss on πρόπολος, Sch. Ar. Nu. 435.
mix in, Asclep. ap. Gal. 13.248.
bedabble, αἵματι προσέφυρεν αὐτὸν ἡ σφαγὴ τῆς κόρης D.H. 11.37.

data.quote: αἵματι προσέφυρεν αὐτὸν ἡ σφαγὴ τῆς κόρης

children.definition: blow upon, πρὸς τὰ πρόσωπα Arist. Mir. 845a22:— Pass., πόλεμος -φυσώμενος ὥσπερ ὑπʼ ἀνέμων Plb. 11.4.5.

definition: πρόσφυσις, εως, Ion. ιος, ἡ, ( προσφύομαι)

children.definition: growing to: clinging to, of a rider, ἰσχυροτέρα π. a firmer seat, X. Eq. 1.11; of vine to tree, D.H. 19.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: ongrowth, attachment or point of attachment, e.g. of the legs to the body, Diog.Apoll. 6, Hp. Art. 45; of the diaphragm to the spine, τῶν φρενῶν ibid.; of the navel in embryos, Arist. GA 745b24; of the caudal vertebrae in birds, Id. IA 710a4; of flowers to spray, leaves to stem, Thphr. HP 3.16.4, al., 1.10.8, al.: freq. in Arist. of all after or adventitious growths which do not form part of the organism, ἓν γενέσθαι . . προσφύσει Ph. 227a17; ἡ τοῦ ᾠοῦ π. GA 754b12; of zoöphytes, HA 548b8; assimilation, τῆς τροφῆς Pr. 866b21 (prop., adhesion of food to tissues, Gal. Nat.Fac. 1.11, 3.1); in trees, growth of new wood, Thphr. HP 9.2.6; of a fungus, Id. Fr. 168.
plant besides, Tab.Heracl. 1.174.
adherent, τόνοι Hp. Art. 45.
cause to grow to: metaph., καὶ ταῦτʼ ἀληθῆ . . προσφύσω λόγῳ will make sure, confirm, A. Supp. 276; τοῦτο τῷ νῦν λόγῳ εὖ προσέφυσας Ar. Nu. 372.

data.quote: τοῦτο τῷ νῦν λόγῳ εὖ προσέφυσας

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., with aor. 2 and pf. Act. and fut. Med., grow to or upon, σῷ κέρατα κρατὶ προσπεφυκέναι E. Ba. 921, cf. Pl. R. 611d, Ti. 45a; σοι ταῦτα προσφύσεται will accrue, Id. Ep. 313d: freq. in Arist. of any after or adventitious growth which does not form part of the organism, π. τῇ ὑστέρᾳ τὸ ᾠόν, πρὸς τῇ ὑστέρᾳ, GA 752a11, 754b17; τὰ κέρατα π. μᾶλλον τῷ δέρματι HA 517a27, cf. LXX Da. 7.20; προσπέφυκεν ὥσπερ τὰ φύματα Arist. GA 772b29; of zoöphytes, HA 487b11, 588b13; π. ταῖς πέτραις PA 681b6; of tapeworms, HA 551a11; of food, to be assimilated, Pr. 864b8, 927a20.

data.quote: τὰ κέρατα π. μᾶλλον τῷ δέρματι

children.label: b
children.definition: to be attached, πλευραὶ προσπεφύκασι [τοῖς σφονδύλοις, sc. by joints] Hp. Art. 45.

hang upon, cling to, τῷ προσφὺς ἐχόμην Od. 12.433: abs., προσφῦσα Il. 24.213; προσφὺς ὅπως τις ἀναρίτης Herod. Fr. 11; of a fish, τὠγκίστρῳ ποτεφύετο Theoc. 21.46; of leeches, Gal. 8.265: metaph., π. τοῖς τοιούτοις consorts constantly with, Pl. Lg. 728b; προσφύντες ἔχονται τοῦ χρυσίου they cling fast to it, Luc. Pisc. 51, cf. Musc. Enc. 3, etc.

call or speak to, address, pres. first in A. Supp. 236: used by Hom. only in impf., the Ep. aor.being προσέειπον, τινα Il. 2.22, Od. 4.69: abs., 5.159, 10.109, al.: later c. dat. pers., LXX 1 Es. 2.21, Antig.Rex ap. D.L. 7.7, Ev.Matt. 11.16, Act.Ap. 22.2: c. dupl. acc., address words to a person, οὐδέ τί μιν προσεφώνεον Il. 1.332, cf. A. Fr. 159, E. Med. 664.
call by name, ποδαπὸν ὅμιλον τόνδε . . προσφωνοῦμεν; A. Supp. l.c.; ὀνόματι π. τινά E. Tr. 942; π. τινὰ βασιλέα salute him king, Plb. 10.38.3, etc.
issue directions or orders, τινι PTeb. 27.109 (ii B.C.): abs., folld. by ὅπως, ib. 124.21 (ii B.C.):— Pass., UPZ 106.20 (ii B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: pronounce, utter, τήνδε π. φάτιν S. El. 1213; τὰ ὑπογεγραμμένα IG 7.2713.7 ( Acraeph., i A.D.); address or dedicate a book, τινι Cic. Att. 16.11.4, Plu. Luc. 1, Ath. 7.313f, etc.
make a report, POxy. 475,476 (ii A.D.); περί τινος Wilcken Chr. 27.15 (ii A.D.): abs., OGI 572.43 ( Myra, ii/iii A.D.).
addressing, capable of addressing, Od. 9.456.
that which is addressed to another, address, S. OC 891: pl., ib. 325, E. Alc. 1144.
usual in addressing, λόγος π. a public oration or address, D.H. Rh. 5 tit., cf. Sch. E. Hec. 299.
addressing, address, Parmenisc. ap. Ath. 4.156d (pl.), Phld. Mort. 37, D.H. Rh. 5.1; αἱ πρὸς ἑαυτὸν π. Longin. 26.3.
dedication, Cic. Att. 13.12.3; συνταγμάτων Onos. Praef. 1; γραμμάτων Plu. TG 8 (pl.).
assignment of property, PGot. 2.1 (ii A.D.).
report, declaration, BGU 647.1 (ii A.D.), etc.; ἔγγραφος π. PAmh. 2.142.13 (iv A.D.); official intimation, PGrenf. 1.35.6 (ii/i B.C.).
one must address, τί τινι S.E. M. 1.132.
προσφωνηματικός, only in Adv. -κῶς Eust. 1410.27.
rejoice at, τινι LXX Pr. 8.30, Plu. Ant. 29.

definition: προσχάραιος [ ᾰ], ον, Dor. contr. for προ-εσχ-,

children.definition: offered before the hearth, θυσία IG 12(1).792 ( Rhodes, iv B.C.).
as extension of character, dub. in Phld. Lib. p.6O.
gratify or satisfy, τῇ γαστρί X. Oec. 13.9; stretch a point in oneʼs favour, BGU 1141.30 (i B.C.), Luc. DMeretr. 9.5; concede the truth of, τοῖς Θετταλοῖς μυθώδεις λόγους Str. 7.7.12.

children.label: II
children.definition: gratify besides, Ath.Naucr. ap. Ath. 5.211b.

children.label: III
children.definition: sacrifice something for the sake of something, τῶν πτερυγωμάτων τι τῇ μήτρᾳ Sor. 2.89.
arrogatio, Gloss.

definition: προσχάσκω, aor. προσέχᾰνον: pf. in pres. sense προσκέχηνα:—

children.definition: gape, or stare open-mouthed at one, μηδὲ . . χαμαιπετὲς βόαμα προσχάνῃς ἐμοί fall not prostrate before me with loud cries, A. Ag. 920.
gape eagerly at, be greedy for, τῷ λεγομένῳ προσκεχηνέναι παιδικῶς Plb. 4.42.7; τῷ εἴδει τινός J. AJ 11.3.5, cf. Ph. 2.560.
hold before:— Med., ward off from oneself, βέλεμνα χειρὶ προεσχεθόμην Theoc. 25.254.
winter, of an army, ἐν . . Polyaen. 4.6.11.

definition: πρόσχειρος, ον, = πρόχειρος, Phld. Ir. p.62 W.

children.definition: accomplish in addition, π. ταῖς εὐχαῖς πολλὰ ἐξ ἐπιστήμης J. BJ 4.8.3.

data.quote: π. ταῖς εὐχαῖς πολλὰ ἐξ ἐπιστήμης

children.definition: πρόσχερα δὲ ἑκάστῳ δύο κρέα Harmod. 1; προσχέρων β πήχεις νϚ two πρόσχερα = 56 cubits each, in an account for plastering or whitewashing a bath, POxy. 2145.7, cf. 10, al. (ii A.D.); cf. πρόσχορος II.
obtentus ( v.l. obtutus), Gloss.: f.l. for ὑπόσχεσις in LXX 4 Ma. 15.2.

pour to or on, LXX l.c., al., Luc. Sacr. 9 (s. v.l.):— Med., pour water on oneself, Hp. Steril. 230, Diocl. Fr. 139; have poured on one, τὸ θερμόν Arist. Somn.Vig. 457b14, cf. Pr. 875a9:— Pass., Ph. 2.242; προσεχύθη πρὸ τῶν οὔρων αἷμα Aret. SD 2.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., ὑπὸ τοῦ Χρυσίππου προσχυθεὶς ἀδολεσχίας deluged, Gal. 5.318.
that which is held before: hence,

children.label: I
children.definition: that which is held before to cover, screen, cloak, τὸ σῶφρον τοῦ ἀνάνδρου π. Th. 3.82; pretence, pretext, πατὴρ . . σοὶ π. ἀεί, ὡς ἐξ ἐμοῦ τέθνηκεν S. El. 525; τοῦτο π. ποιούμενος Lys. 6.37; also π. τοῦ λόγου in the same sense, Hdt. 4.167, cf. 6.133: c. gen., αὗται [αἱ πόλεις] π. ἦσαν τοῦ στόλου ib. 44; Φίλιππος γίγνεται π. τοῦ πολέμου Plb. 11.5.4; τῷ τῆς τέχνης π. on the ground of . ., D. 5.6; π. ποιεύμενος ὡς ἐπʼ Ἀθήνας ἐλαύνει making a pretence or show of marching against Athens, Hdt. 7.157: c. inf., π. ποιούμενοι τοὺς ἐπὶ Θρᾴκης μὴ προδώσειν pretend that they will not . ., Th. 5.30; π. ἦν ἀμύνεσθαι Id. 1.96; also π. ποιεῖσθαι or ποιήσασθαί τι to put forward as a screen or disguise, Pl. Prt. 316d, 316e, cf. 317a: πρόσχημα, as acc. abs., by way of pretext, Hdt. 9.87; καλῶν ὀνομάτων καὶ προσχημάτων μεστή full of fair words and appearances, Pl. R. 495d.

data.quote: πατὴρ . . σοὶ π. ἀεί, ὡς ἐξ ἐμοῦ τέθνηκεν

children.definition: preface, π. καὶ ἀρχὴ τοῦ λόγου Id. Hp.Ma. 286a.

children.label: II
children.definition: ornament, τῆς Ἰωνίης π., of Miletus, Hdt. 5.28, cf. Plb. 3.15.3; τῆς Ἑλλάδος Str. 10.2.3, cf. 11.11.1, Plu. Alex. 17; τὸ κλεινὸν Ἑλλάδος π. ἀγῶνος, of the Pythian games, S. El. 682; μετὰ προσχήματος ἀξίου τῆς πόλεως with a dignity, D. 18.178; τὸ τοῦ γένους π. the nobility of his birth, OGI 470.23 ( i B.C. /i A.D.); Ἀχιλλέα τινʼ ἢ Νιόβην . ., π. τῆς τραγῳδίας the pomp or show of tragedy, Ar. Ra. 913; Δαρείου τὸ π. his pomp, Arist. Mu. 398a12; of a person, π. ἑαυτῆς (sc. τῆς πόλεως) IG 12(7).395.17 ( Amorgos).
outward appearance of a wound, f.l. in Hp. Ulc. 24; aspect, τῆς ὅλης θεουργίας διττόν ἐστι π., τὸ ἱερατικὸν τῶν θεῶν π., Iamb. Myst. 4.2.
costume, uniform, PMasp. 334.12, PFlor. 288.9 (both vi A.D.).
make a pretext, Apostol. 3.33.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be protruded, become apparent, of haemorrhoids, Dsc. Eup. 1.204.
outward show, τιμῆς ἕνεκεν ἢ καὶ π. Gal. Anim. Pass. 2.2 (nisi leg. πρὸς χρηματισμόν, cf. Protr. 14).
slit before or in front, Gloss.
slit in front ( ἐσχισμένον ἐκ τῶν ἔμπροσθεν Hsch.), Ar. Fr. 842.

children.label: II
children.definition: the forepart of the shoe, from its being slit, Arist. Rh. 1392a31, Pr. 956b4.
mock or jeer besides, Plb. 4.16.4.
study formerly with, τινι Phld. Ind. Sto. 46.
ante-room of a school, Gloss.
assistant schoolmaster, Aus. Prof. 22 tit., Aug. Serm. 178 No.8, prob. in Gloss.
attuned to a stringed instrument: generally, in unison with, ἀποδιδόναι πρόσχορδα τὰ φθέγματα τοῖς φθέγμασι bring voices into unison with voices, Pl. Lg. 812d, cf. Poll. 4.58, 63.
dance to the sound of, αὐλοῖς Poll. 4.81.
supply in addition, in Pass., PTeb. 27.57, 61 ( b). 360, al. (ii B.C.).
belonging to a chorus, Ar. Fr. 843.

children.label: II
children.definition: οἶκοι π. perh. outer, external rooms, Gal. 13.570 (fort. πρόσχεροι).

use or avail oneself of a thing besides, τινι Arist. Rh. 1358b19; but more freq. simply, use, τινὶ εἴς τι Pl. Cra. 435c; χάριν τοῦ σίτου Id. Criti. 115a; τούτοις ταῦτα Id. Phlb. 44d: c. dupl. dat., ὥσπερ μάντεσι π. τισί ib.c; [ θεράπουσι] πρὸς τὰς διακονίας Arist. Pol. 1263a20, cf. Ph. 200b19, LXX Es. 8.13 ( 16.17), etc.; νόμῳ BGU 1127.21 (i B.C.):— Pass., τὰ -χρησθέντα CPHerm. 92.11 (iii A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: abuse, [ παιδίσκῃ] dub. sens. in PSI 4.406.7 (iii B.C.).

require or desire besides, c. gen., τυραννίδος οὐδεμιῆς π. Hdt. 5.11, cf. 18; οὐδὲ σοῦ προσχρῄζομεν S. Ph. 1055: c. gen. pers. et inf., προσχρηΐζω ὑμέων πείθεσθαι Μαρδονίῳ I request you to listen to him, Hdt. 8.140.βʹ: c. inf. only, τί προσχρῄζων μαθεῖν; S. OT 1155, cf. OC 1168: in poetry with inf. understood, πᾶν ὅπερ προσχρῄζετε (sc. πυθέσθαι) πεύσεσθε A. Pr. 641, cf. 787, S. OC 520, 1160, 1202.
use in addition, τοῦ ἡγεμονικοῦ M.Ant. 7.5, cf. Procl. Sacr. p.149 B.
one must use besides, μύθῳ Pl. Lg. 713a; ἀναλογίᾳ Plu. Fac.lun. 2.931d.
touch, graze, Orph. L. 53 ( Med.).
apply as salve, Hp. Morb. 2.30.
sample of colour, POxy. 1153.23 (i A.D.).
spread upon, τοῖς ἐδέσμασι D.S. 19.33 ( Pass.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Λακεδαιμονίους ὑποπεσόντας . . τῷ γραφείῳ προσέχρωσε ‘painted them black’, Plu. Herod. 2.859e.
body to body (cf. συγχρῶτα), Artem. 1.79 ( πρόσχρωτα Hercher: v.l. πρὸς χρῶτα).
pouring upon, sprinkling, τοῦ αἵματος Ep.Hebr. 11.28.
profusor, Gloss.
alluvial deposit, π. Νείλου, of the Delta of the Nile, A. Pr. 847; ποταμῶν Str. 13.1.36.

children.label: II
children.definition: mound raised for attacking a city, LXX 2 Ki. 20.15, al.

definition: προσχώννυμι ( Plb. 9.41.4, J. BJ 5.5.1) and προσχωννύω ( Thphr. HP 2.5.5): aor. προσέχωσα Hdt. 2.10, 99: pf. προσκέχωκα D.S. 1.39:— pf. Pass. -κέχωσμαι Thphr. HP 5.8.3, Palaeph. 28: aor. Pass. -εχώσθην Gp. 2.24.2:—also προσχόω, 3 sg. pres. προσχοῖ Th. 2.102:— Pass., impf. προσεχοῦτο ib. 75: part. προσχούμενος Arist. Mete. 351b7; inf. προσχοῦσθαι ib. 353a8:—

children.definition: heap upon, esp. of water, deposit mud, silt, etc.: hence,

ταῦτα τὰ χωρία π. form these new lands by deposition, of rivers, Hdt. 2.10: abs., ὁ ποταμὸς προσχοῖ ἀεί continually forms fresh deposits, Th. l.c.:— Pass., to be joined to the land by deposits of rivers, Thphr. HP 5.8.3.
choke with mud, silt up, π. τὰς ἀνωμαλίας fill up hollows, level, Plb. l.c., cf. Str. 6.2.10:— Pass., ἡ θάλαττα ἐξηραίνετο προσχουμένη Arist. Mete. 351b7, cf. 353a8.

children.label: II
children.definition: throw earth upon, J. l.c.; ἵνα αἱ ῥίζαι προσχωσθῶσι Gp. 2.24.2; also, raise mounds against, μέρη τῆς πόλεως Dius ap. J. AJ 8.5.3; form by a dam, τὸν . . ἀγκῶνα τοῦ Νείλου Hdt. 2.99:— Pass., ᾗ προσεχοῦτο where earth was being raised up against it, Th. 2.75.

children.label: III
children.definition: heap up, in Pass., ὄρος ἐξ οὗ ἡ . . ὕλη -κέχωσται Palaeph. 28.
