πυξοειδής, τὴν χρόαν π. Dsc. 1.16.

definition: πυξών, ῶνος, ὁ, = πυξεών, Ps.- Hdn.Gr. in Greg.Cor. p.225S.

children.definition: like purulent matter, γάλα Arist. HA 573a24.

discharge from a sore, matter, Hp. Aph. 2.47, Arist. GA 777a11, etc.: pl. πύα Hp. Int. 2, Aret. SD 1.10, etc.: also πύος, εος, τό, Hp. Morb. 1.15, al., IG 42(1).122.55,58 ( Epid., iv B.C.), Aret. SA 2.1; cf. πύον τὸ ἔμπυον τὸ καὶ πύος Hdn.Gr. 1.376 codd. Arc.

children.label: II
children.definition: Emp. 68.
make pus, Dsc. 2.155.
making of pus, Alex.Trall. 3.7.
making pus, Dsc. 2.72, Aret. CA 2.6; π. ἀγωγή, θεραπεία, Aët. 15.5,7.
discharge matter, Hp. Epid. 7.5, Dsc. 1.64.4, 2.151, Ruf. ap. Orib. 8.24.67.
discharge of matter, Dsc. 5.113.

first milk after the birth, whether of women or cattle ( beestings), Cratin. 142, Pherecr. 108.19, Ar. V. 710, Pax 1150, Fr. 318.5, Fr. 16 D. [ ῡ Ar., but πῠον Emp. (v. supr.); on the accent cf. Hdn. Gr. 1.111.]
surgical instrument for drawing off pus, Hero Spir. 2.18, Afric. Cest. p.27 V., Gal. 11.125, Hermes 38.283.
cause to suppurate, Eust. 464.27:— Pass., suppurate, Arist. Resp. 479b30.
cry πύππαξ, Cratin. 52.
bravo! Pl. Euthd. 303a, Com.Adesp. 1130.

definition: πῦρ (once πύυρ [⏑ ⏓] by ‘distraction’, Simon. 59 codd. Hdn.Gr. ( Rh.Mus. 35.101, 38.378)), τό, gen. πῠρός; not used in pl.,

children.definition: fire, π. καίειν or δαίειν to kindle fire, Il. 8.521, Od. 7.7, etc.; π. ἀνακαίειν, ἅπτειν, ἐξάπτειν, αἴθειν, ἐναύειν, v. sub vocc.; π. ποιεῖν, ποιήσασθαι, Anaxipp. 1.12, X. An. 5.2.27; οἴσετε π. Il. 15.718; π. προσέφερον X. An. 5.2.14; π. ἐμβαλεῖν νηυσί, κλισίῃσι, Il. 15.597, Od. 8.501 (tm.); π. φυσητέον, ῥιπίζειν, Ar. Lys. 293, Plu. Flam. 21; as exclam., " πῦρ βοᾷ Men. Sam. 208.

children.label: b
children.definition: π. τεχνικόν, v. τεχνικός.
funeral-fire (cf. πυρά) , ὄφρα πυρός με . . λελάχωσι θανόντα Il. 7.79, 22.342, cf. 15.350, 23.76; ζῶντα διδόναι τινὰ πυρί burn one alive, Hdt. 1.86.
sacrificial fire, ἐν πυρὶ βάλλε θυηλάς Il. 9.220, cf. Od. 3.341, 446; κατὰ τοῦ π. σπένδειν Pl. Criti. 120a; διὰ τοῦ π. ὀμνύναι D. 54.40.

hearth-fire, πυρὸς ἐσχάραι Il. 10.418, cf. Od. 5.59; ἕως ἂν αἴθῃ πῦρ ἐφʼ ἑστίας ἐμῆς A. Ag. 1435; πυρὶ δέχεσθαί τινα E. Or. 47; τὸ π. τὸ ἀθάνατον the fire of Vesta, Plu. Num. 9, etc.; deified, Πῦρ ἀθάνατον SIG 826 ii 14 ( Delph., ii B.C.).

data.quote: ἕως ἂν αἴθῃ πῦρ ἐφʼ ἑστίας ἐμῆς

children.definition: lightning, κεραυνὸς ἀενάου πυρός Pi. P. 1.6; πῦρ πνέοντος κεραυνοῦ Id. Fr. 146; πυρὸς ἀμφήκης βόστρυχος A. Pr. 1044 (anap.); πυρὶ καὶ στεροπαῖς S. OT 470 (anap.); παλτῷ ῥιπτεῖ πυρί Id. Ant. 131 (anap.); θείῳ πυρὶ παμφαής Id. Ph. 728 (lyr.).

children.label: b
children.definition: fire, light, or heat of the sun, θερινὸν π., opp. χειμών, Pi. P. 3.50, cf. Pl. Lg. 865b; of the stars, π. πνείοντα ἄστρα S. Ant. 1146 (lyr.); summer solstice, Alcm. 79, Paul.Al. A. 3.
flame of torches, S. Ant. 964 (lyr.), etc.; π. εὐάγγελον, ἄγγαρον, πομπόν, of the beacon fire, A. Ag. 21, 282, 299.

fever heat, violent fever, πῦρ ἔλαβέν [τινα] Hp. Epid. 1.4.8 [1.26.ηʹ], al.; ὁ δʼ ἔχων θέρμαν καὶ π. ἧκεν Ar. Fr. 690; τεταρταίῳ πυρί Call. Aet. 3.1.17 [Fr. 75.17 Pf.]; π. ἄγριον Hp. Epid. 7.20 (of erysipelas acc. to Gal. 19.134).

data.quote: ὁ δʼ ἔχων θέρμαν καὶ π. ἧκεν

children.label: II
children.definition: ἐν πυρὶ γενέσθαι to be consumed, come to nothing, Il. 2.340; φεύγων καπνὸν εἰς πῦρ δεσποτείας ἐμπεπτωκώς ‘out of the frying pan into the fire, Pl. R. 569b, cf. Prov. ap. Simp. in Epict. p.72 D.; ἦν ἄρα πυρός γʼ ἕτερα θερμότερα Ar. Eq. 382; πῦρ ἐπὶ πῦρ ἐγχεῖν, ἄγειν, φέρειν, ἐπεισφέρειν, Cratin. 18, Ar. Fr. 453, Arist. Pr. 880a21, Plu. Adul. 2.61a; εἰς π. ξαίνειν ‘plough the sands’, Pl. Lg. 780c; βασανίζειν χρυσὸν ἐν πυρί Id. R. 413e, cf. Plb. 21.20.7: as a type of things irresistible or terrible, ἀντίος εἶμι, καὶ εἰ πυρὶ χεῖρας ἔοικε Il. 20.371; μάρναντο δέμας πυρὸς αἰθομένοιο 11.596, al.; Ἕκτωρ πυρὸς αἰνὸν ἔχει μένος 17.565, cf. 6.182; so τὸ πεπρωμένον οὐ π. σχήσει Pi. Fr. 232; κρεῖσσον ἀμαιμακέτου πυρός S. OT 177; οὐδὲν θηρίον γυναικὸς ἀμαχώτερον, οὐδὲ π. Ar. Lys. 1015; ἀναρχία κρείσσων πυρός E. Hec. 608; ἐχίδνης καὶ πυρὸς περαιτέρω Id. Andr. 271; so διὰ πυρὸς ἰέναι (as we say) to go through fire and water, dash through any danger, X. Smp. 4.16, cf. Oec. 21.7, Ar. Lys. 133; but διὰ πυρὸς ἦλθε ἑτέρῳ λέχεϊ she raged furiously against the other partner of the bed, E. Andr. 487 (lyr.); διὰ πυρὸς ἔμολον ματρί Id. El. 1183 (lyr.); σωθήσεται οὕτω δὲ ὡς διὰ πυρός 1 Ep.Cor. 3.15; εἰς π. ἅλλεσθαι X. Mem. 1.3.9; κἂν εἰς π. ἐμβαῖεν Lib. Ep. 314.3; π. διέρπειν S. Ant. 265; of persons, ὦ π. σύ . . Id. Ph. 927; of Hannibal, Plu. Flam. 21: metaph. of anxious hope, θάλπει τῷδʼ ἀνηκέστῳ πυρί S. El. 888; of love, ἀρσενικῷ θέρεται π. Call. Epigr. 27.5, cf. 45.2. (Cf. Arm. hur, OE. fyr ‘fire’, etc.)

data.quote: ἦν ἄρα πυρός γʼ ἕτερα θερμότερα
ἀντίος εἶμι, καὶ εἰ πυρὶ χεῖρας ἔοικε
οὐδὲν θηρίον γυναικὸς ἀμαχώτερον, οὐδὲ π.
σωθήσεται οὕτω δὲ ὡς διὰ πυρός

children.definition: watch-fires, in Hom. only nom. and acc., καίωμεν πυρὰ πολλά Il. 8.509, cf. 554, 9.77, 10.12; ἐκκαύσαντες π. Hdt. 4.134; πύρʼ αἴθει ( ν) prob. for πυραίθει ( ν) in E. Rh. 41 (lyr.), 78, 823 (lyr.) and for πύραιθεῖν (sic) in Call. Fr. 1.13 P.; πυρὰ δαίεται E. Rh. 136 (lyr.); ὡς . . ᾐσθάνοντό τὰ πυρὰ . . φανέντα the beacon-fires, Th. 8.102; π. κατασβεννύναι X. An. 6.3.25; dat., ἐπιτυγχάνει πυροῖς ἐρήμοις ib. 7.2.18, cf. Cyr. 4.2.16; of volcanic fires, Arist. Mir. 833a1; πυρά . . εὔδηλα πᾶσι Scymn. 258: metaph., δῆμος π. ἐς τὸν Τίβεριν πολλὰ ἐνέβαλε D.C. 55.13. (A sg. πυρόν is cited by Hdn.Gr. 2.944, but rejected by Eust. 729.63: the accent, as well as dat. πυροῖς, shows that πυρά does not belong to πῦρ.)

data.quote: δῆμος π. ἐς τὸν Τίβεριν πολλὰ ἐνέβαλε

definition: πυρά, ᾶς, Ep. and Ion. πῠρή, ῆς, ἡ, ( πῦρ)

children.definition: funeral-pyre, πυραὶ νεκύων καίοντο θαμειαί Il. 1.52, etc.; πυρῆς ἐπιβάντʼ ἀλεγεινῆς 4.99, etc.; ἐν δὲ πυρῇ ὑπάτῃ νεκρὸν θέσαν 23.165, 24.787, cf. Pi. N. 9.24, S. Tr. 1254, etc.; ποίησαν δὲ πυρὴν ἑκατόμπεδον Il. 23.164; πυρὴν νῆσαι, συννῆσαι, to raise one, Hdt. 1.50, 86; πυρῆς ἁμμένης ibid.; τινὰ πυρᾷ κέαντες S. El. 757; σκῦλα πρὸς πυρὰν ἐμὴν κόμιζε Id. Ph. 1432; ἐπὶ τῇ π. κείμενος Pl. R. 614b; αἱ τῶν ζωγρηθέντων σφαγαὶ εἰς τὴν π. ib. 391b.

data.quote: ἐν δὲ πυρῇ ὑπάτῃ νεκρὸν θέσαν

children.label: b
children.definition: mound raised on the place of the pyre, tumulus, Pi. I. 8(7).63, S. El. 901, E. Hec. 386, IT 26.
altar for burnt sacrifice, Hdt. 7.167, E. Ion 1258 (troch.); ἑρκεῖος π. Id. Tr. 483; fire burning thereon, dub. l. in Hdt. 2.39.
burning mass, ib. 107, Zos. 2.13; λαμπάδων π. a mass of burning torches, D.S. 17.36.
pair of fire-tongs, Il. 18.477, Od. 3.434, Call. Del. 144.
forceps, Gal. 2.635.
singe, coined as etym. of πυρακτέω, EM 697.16.

definition: πύραθος [ ῠ], ὁ, poet. for σπύραθος, Nic. Th. 932 (pl.).

children.definition: fiery, Aglaïas 11.
the Persian fire-worshippers, Str. 15.3.15: hence πυρ-αιθεῖον, τό, their temple, ibid.
furnace, dub. in Hom. Epigr. 14.11.
fiery, dub. in PMag.Lond. 121.801.

children.label: II
children.definition: πύραινος, written for πύραυνος, Hsch.

definition: πυράκανθα [ ᾰκ], ἡ, = ὀξυάκανθα, Nic. Th. 856, Dsc. 1.19,118; acc. πυρακάνθην ib. 93.

children.definition: forfex, Gloss. ( πυραρμων cod.).
turn in the fire: hence, harden in the fire, char, Od. 9.328.

children.label: II
children.definition: burn, Nic. Th. 688.

harden in the fire, βέλη, ξύλα, Plu. QConv. 2.624b, Amat. 762b; ξύλα, τόξα, βέλη πεπυρακτωμένα, D.S. 3.25, Str. 17.2.3, Scyl. 112; πυρακτωθεὶς τὸν μηρόν wounded by such a weapon, dub.l. in Luc. Tox. 55; πεπυρακτῶσθαι, opp. ἐψύχθαι, S.E. M. 10.164, 165.
heat a cautery-iron, in Pass., Leonid. ap. Paul.Aeg. 6.44, Gal. 14.280.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be inflamed, ζήλῳ Hld. 2.9.
bird, perh. a kind of pigeon, Arist. HA 609a18, Call. Fr. 100c4, Ael. NA 4.5; πυρραλίς, Hsch.
insect said to live in fire, Plin. HN 11.119.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἐλαῖαι πυραλλίδες, a red kind of olive, Phylotim. ap. Orib. 2.69.9.
ἄμη, Sch. Ar. Pax 298 (pl.); = vatillum, Gloss.; written πυράμμη, ib.
the time of the wheat-harvest, Arist. HA 571a26, Thphr. HP 7.6.2, 9.9.2, Damocr. ap. Gal. 14.94.
pyramidal, Iamb. in Nic. p.72 P., al. Adv. -κῶς prob. cj. in Theol.Ar. 22.

definition: πυράμινος [ ᾰ], η, ον, ( πυρός) poet. for πύρινος, as κριθάμινος for κρίθινος,

children.definition: wheaten, ἀθέρες Hes. Fr. 117; ἄλευρα Polyaen. 4.3.32; cf. σπυραμινός.
pyramid, Hdt. 2.8, 124, D.S. 1.63, Str. 17.1.33, OGI 666.13 ( Egypt, i A.D.), etc.; as a sepulchral monument, PLips. 30.14 (iii A.D.).
pyramid, as a geometrical figure, Pl. Ti. 56b, Arist. Cael. 304a12, etc.

children.label: b
children.definition: pyramidal number, Speus. ap. Theol.Ar. 62.
IG 2(2).2776.16; of a fountain, Arch.Anz. 26.233 ( Panticapaeum).

children.label: II
children.definition: cake, Ephipp. 13.5 (anap.); different from πυραμοῦς, acc. to Iatrocl. ap. Ath. 14.647c codd. (but dub., cf. πυραμοῦντα· τὴν πυραμίδα, Hsch.); ἡ ἐκ πυρῶν καὶ μέλιτος, ὥσπερ σησαμὶς ἡ ἐκ σησάμων καὶ μέλιτος, EM 697.27. (Expld. by Gramm., etc., fr. πῦρ because pointed, Amm.Marc. 22.15.29, cf. Pl. l.c.; from πυρός, St.Byz.: it is suggested that the pyramids were named from resembling a πυραμίς II in shape; but the shape of a π. II is unknown: the derivation from Egypt. pr-m-wś ‘the height of a pyramid’ is doubtful.)
pyramidal, Thphr. Ign. 52; σχῆμα Ph. 1.11, cf. Arr. An. 5.7.3; τὸ π. S.E. M. 10.280; of the human heart, Corp.Herm. 5.6.

definition: πυραμοῦς, οῦντος, ὁ, contr. fr. πυραμόεις, ( πυρός)

children.definition: cake of roasted wheat and honey, Ephipp. 8.3, cf. Trypho ap. Ath. 3.114b; given to him who kept awake best during a παννυχίς, Call. Fr. 2.6P.: hence, generally, meed of victory, prize, τοῦ γὰρ τεχνάζειν ἡμέτερος ὁ π. for stratagem ‘we take the cake (or biscuit)ʼ, Ar. Th. 94, cf. Eq. 277.
Herod. 4.62 [ ῡ, cf. πυραύστης].
fiery bright, h.Mart. 6, AP 12.41 ( Mel.), Luc. Nav. 5, Nonn. D. 2.536, al.
pan of coals, Poll. 6.88: neut.sg. πύραυνον Id. 10.104.

children.label: II
children.definition: Phot., Eust. 1547.64.—Name of plays by Alexis and others.
moth that gets singed in the candle, δέδοικα μῶρον κάρτα πυραύστου μόρον A. Fr. 288, cf. Arist. HA 605b11, Ael. NA 12.8.

definition: πυραύστρα, ἡ, = πυράγρα, IG 2(2).47.18 (iv B.C.); cf. πύραστρον.

children.definition: unburnt by fire, interpol. in Suid.
casting fire, Man. 5.93.

definition: πυργαλίδαι, οἱ, name of a guild at Camirus, IG 12(1).701.11.

children.definition: like a tower, σκοπή Ion Trag. 47.
towerwise, Aret. SD 2.13; of soldiers, in masses or columns, in close array, Il. 12.43, 13.152, 15.618, D.H. 6.33; also of clouds, Nonn. D. 32.76.
to be shut up as in a tower, beleaguered, A. Th. 22, 184, E. Or. 762 (troch.), 1574, Ph. 1087.
furnished with towers, fortified, κώμη Orac. ap. Paus. 10.18.2.

definition: πυργίδιον [ ῐδ], τό, Dim. of πύργος, Ar. Eq. 793; as a farm-building, IG 2(2).2776.15,24.

children.definition: tower-like, πολίσματα (prob. for νομίματα cod. Med.) π. A. Pers. 859 (lyr.).

definition: πυργίον, τό, Dim. of πύργος, IG ΙΙ(2).287 A 154 ( Delos, iii B.C.), PTeb. 780.11 (ii B.C.), Str. 3.5.5, 12.3.18 (pl.), BGU 889.10 (ii A.D.), Luc. Pseudol. 19, Vit.Auct. 9.

children.definition: cupboard, cabinet, Herod. 7.15.

definition: πυργισκάριον, τό, Dim. of πύργος, Gloss.
πυργίσκιον, τό, = foreg., Sch.rec. A. Th. 158.

children.definition: Dim. of πύργος, burial-vault, CIG 4207.13,4212 ( Telmissus), al.
cupboard, cabinet, Ael. VH 9.13, Artem. 1.74, S.E. M. 7.102, 9. 78.
of a tower, στρουθὸς π. house-sparrow, Gal. 6.435.

children.label: II
children.definition: πυργῖτις, ιδος, ἡ, a plant, Hsch.
π. ἰατρικόν PMasp. 6ii65 (vi A.D.).
battlemented house, fortress, LXX Ps. 121(122).7.
destroying towers, πόλεμοι A. Pers. 104 (lyr.).
building towers, κιθάρη Nonn. D. 5.67; μόσχος ib. 44.41.
like a tower, J. BJ 5.5.8, D.C. 74.5.
fort, Procop. Aed. 2.5.
with towering horns, B. Fr. 31.
watch-tower, BGU 282.13, 542.6 (ii B.C.).
assault a tower, X. Cyr. 6.4.18, An. 7.8.13, Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.228d.

children.label: II
children.definition: fight from a tower, Plb. 5.84.2.
fighting from a tower, Ath. 4.154f.
building of a tower, Ph. Bel. 82.43.

tower, esp. such as were attached to the walls of a city, Il. 7.219, al., Hes. Sc. 242, Hdt. 3.74, al., Th. 2.17, al., Plb. 5.99.9, etc.: in pl., city walls or ramparts with their towers, Il. 7.338, 437; in sg., ἧντʼ ἐπὶ πύργῳ 3.153, cf. 22.447; πόλιος ἣν πέρι πύργος ὑψηλός Od. 6.262; πέριξ δὲ πύργος εἶχʼ ἔτι πτόλιν E. Hec. 1209; πύργους ἐπὶ τῶν γεφυρῶν ἐπιστῆσαι Pl. Criti. 116a.

data.quote: πέριξ δὲ πύργος εἶχʼ ἔτι πτόλιν

children.label: b
children.definition: movable tower for storming towns, X. Cyr. 6.1.53, 6.2.18; π. ὑπότροχοι Onos. 42.3.

children.label: c
children.definition: tower on the back of war-elephants, Arr. Tact. 2.4.

children.label: d
children.definition: Ζανὸς π., Pythag. name for the central fire of the universe, Arist. Fr. 204.

tower of defence, τοῖος . . σφιν π. ἀπώλεο, of Ajax, Od. 11.556; ἄνδρες πόλιος π. ἀρεύϊος Alc. Supp. 1a.10; παῖς ἄρσην πατέρʼ ἔχει π. μέγαν E. Alc. 311, cf. Med. 390; ἅπας μοι π. Ἑλλήνων πατρίς Trag.Adesp. 392; θανάτων δʼ ἐμᾷ χώρᾳ π. ἀνέστα a tower of defence from deaths, S. OT 1201 (lyr.).

data.quote: παῖς ἄρσην πατέρʼ ἔχει π. μέγαν

children.definition: the part of a house (prob. a separate building) in which the women lived and worked, αἱ ἄλλαι θεράπαιναι ἐν τῷ π. ἦσαν, οὗπερ διαιτῶνται D. 47.56; esp. if unmarried, as Hero in her tower, Musae. 32, 187, cf. Philostr.Jun. Im. 1; of the workmanʼs hut of Timon the misanthrope (which also became his tomb, cf. Luc. Tim. 42), Paus. 1.30.4, cf. AP 7.402 ( Antip.); outbuildings, esp. if used in industry, LXX Is. 5.2, Mi. 4.8, PStrassb. 110.6 (iii B.C.), BGU 1194.9 (ii B.C.), 650.8 (i A.D.), POxy. 243.15 (i A.D.), Ev.Marc. 12.1, Ev.Luc. 14.28, PGiss. 67.16 (ii A.D.), IG 2(2).2776.65 (ii A.D.); π. ἐν ᾧ βαφεῖον καὶ ἕτερα χρηστήρια PLond. 2.371.3 (i A.D.).

data.quote: αἱ ἄλλαι θεράπαιναι ἐν τῷ π. ἦσαν, οὗπερ διαιτῶνται
π. ἐν ᾧ βαφεῖον καὶ ἕτερα χρηστήρια

children.label: II
children.definition: part of an army drawn up in close order, column, Il. 4.334, 347.

children.label: III
children.definition: dice-box, AP 9.482.24 ( Agath.); cf. Lat. pyrgus.
tower-shaker, an engine of war, Anon. in Rh. 3.580 W.
undermining towers, Lyc. 469.
tower-bearer: in ships of war, platform which bore towers for defence, Plb. 16.3.12, Poll. 1.92.
bear a tower or towers, Luc. Syr.D. 15.
bearing a tower, of Rhea, AP 5.259 ( Paul.Sil.); of Demeter, Lyd. Mens. 4.63, Suid. s.v. Δημήτηρ; ἐλέφαντες Plu. Par.min. 2.307b, Hld. 9.16.
tower-guard, warder, A. Th. 168 (lyr.), PFlor. 297.469 (vi A.D.), etc.

gird or fence with towers, Θήβης ἕδος ἔκτισαν . . πύργωσάν τε Od. 11.264, cf. Hom. Epigr. 4.3, Orac. ap. Hdt. 1.174, E. Ba. 172:— Med., fortify, ὀχυρά X. Cyr. 6.1.20; ἄστη MoschioTrag. 6.27:— Pass., κορυφαὶ πεπυργωμέναι Str. 12.3.39.
fence, protect, δέμας ἀσπίδι Nonn. D. 30.52, etc.
πυργωθείς furnished with a tower, of an elephant, AP 9.285 ( Phil.).

children.label: II
children.definition: raise up to a towering height, πυργωθέντα πλοῦτον B. 3.13; πρῶτος . . πυργώσας ῥήματα σεμνά the first . . ‘ to build the lofty rhyme’, Ar. Ra. 1004; τέχνην . . ἐπύργωσʼ οἰκοδομήσας ἔπεσιν μεγάλοις κτλ. Id. Pax 749; so ἀοιδὰς εὐδαιμονίας ἐπύργωσε E. Supp. 998 (lyr.), cf. AP 7.39 ( Antip. Thess.): hence, exalt, lift up, π. ἄνω τὸ μηδὲν ὄντα E. Tr. 612; Τροίαν ib. 844 (lyr.); < ὑμᾶς> . . τυραννίσι πατὴρ ἐπύργου Id. HF 475; of doctors, πυργοῦντες αὑτούς magnifying themselves, Men. 497 (= Mimn.Trag. 2); π. χάριν exalt, exaggerate it, E. Med. 526; δὶς τόσα π. τῶν γιγνομένων Id. Heracl. 293 (anap.); τὴν τέχνην Lib. Ep. 834.5; καθαροῖς λούμασι adorn (the city) with . ., Epigr.Gr. 903: also intr., declaim, μάταιον τὸ πυργοῦν λέγοντα . . Phld. Mort. 33:— Pass., exalt oneself, τῇδʼ ἐπυργοῦτο στολῇ, of a horse, A. Pers. 192; πεπύργωσαι θράσει, λόγοις, E. Or. 1568, HF 238.
towering, S. Tr. 273.
that which is furnished with towers, fenced city, Orac. ap. Hdt. 7.140 (pl.), E. Ph. 287: pl., fenced walls, A. Th. 30, 251, 469, E. Cyc. 115, Hel. 51.
π. ὁρκάνα A. Th. 346 (lyr.).

made like a tower, ἐμπετάσματα π. curtain-hangings edged with a pattern like battlements, Callix. 2; χιτωνίσκος π. IG 2(2).1514.26,46; πίλημα Str. 15.3.19; π. στέφανος, = Lat. corona muralis, OGI 560.11 ( Tlos, i A.D.), cf. Corn. ND 6.
burning with fire, incendiary, πυρδαῆ τινα πρόνοιαν ( πυρδαῆτιν πρόνοιαν cj. Hermann), of Althaea burning Meleagerʼs fatal torch, A. Ch. 606 (lyr.).

definition: πύρδαιον, τό, = sq. II, IG 42(1).108.146 (Epid.): pl., ib. 109ii 149; Lacon. πούρδαιν (q.v.); cf. πυροδάνσιον.

children.definition: small wood for burning, = φρύγανον, Hsch.; the latter form in Lyr.Alex.Adesp. 31.

children.label: II
children.definition: kitchen or stove for cooking, Hsch.; perh. to be read in Men. Per. 2.
pellitory, Anacyclus Pyrethrum, Nic. Th. 938, Gal. 12.110, etc.; πύρεθρος (v.l. -ον) Dsc. 3.73; cf. πυρῖτις II.

definition: πυρεῖον, Ion. πυρ-ήϊον, τό, mostly in pl.,

children.definition: firesticks, h.Merc. 111, S. Ph. 36, Thphr. HP 5.3.4, D.S. 5.67, etc.; τάχʼ ἂν . . τρίβοντες, ὥσπερ ἐκ πυρείων, ἐκλάμψαι ποιήσαιμεν τὴν δικαιοσύνην Pl. R. 435a; πυρεῖά τε χερσὶν ἐνώμων Theoc. 22.33; ἀμφὶ πυρήϊα δινεύεσκον A.R. 1.1184; πυρεῖα συντρίψαντες Luc. VH 1.32; the stationary piece was called ἐσχάρα, the drill τρύπανον, Thphr. Ign. 64.

data.quote: τάχʼ ἂν . . τρίβοντες, ὥσπερ ἐκ πυρείων, ἐκλάμψαι ποιήσαιμεν τὴν δικαιοσύνην

children.label: II
children.definition: earthen pan for coals (= θυμιατήριον, Hsch. (πυρίον), Phot., Suid.), LXX Ex. 27.3: pl., ib. 2 Ch. 4.11, 21.
Olymp. in Mete. 17.15.
yielding fire, Sch. Luc. VH 1.32.

definition: πυρέκβολος, ον, neut. (?) pl. as Subst.,

children.definition: fire-throwing machines, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.38.
feverish, Gal. 16.491, Theol.Ar. 51. Adv. -κῶς Paul.Aeg. 3.43.

definition: πυρέσσω, E. Cyc. 228; Att. πυρέττω Ar. V. 813, Pl. Tht. 178c: fut. πυρέξω Hp. Mul. 1.2: aor. ἐπύρεξα Id. Prog. 16, Epid. 3.17.αʹ, 4.26, al., Arist. Ph. 228a28: pf. πεπύρεχα Id. Pr. 901b10, M.Ant. 8.15:— Pass., pf. πεπύρεγμαι Gal. 4.447: ( πυρετός):—

children.definition: to be feverish, fall ill of a fever, Hp. Aph. 2.28, E. l.c., Ar. V. 813, Aeschin. 3.115, Artem. 4.30, Sallust. 9.
hearth, PMasp. 2 iii 11 (vi A.D.).
Hp. VM 17, Epid. 4.7, etc.:— Med., ὅσα συνεχῆ πυρεταίνηται f.l. in Id. Fract. 11.

definition: πυρετέω, = foreg., dub. in PGurob 5.6 (iii B.C.).
πυρετικός, ή, όν, = πυρεκτικός, Ptol. Tetr. 85.

children.definition: slight fever, Hp. Epid. 3.17.αʹ: pl., POxy. 896.33 (iv A.D.).
burning heat, fiery heat, φέρει πυρετὸν δειλοῖσι βροτοῖσιν (sc. Sirius) Il. 22.31.

children.label: II
children.definition: fever, Hp. Aph. 2.26, Ar. V. 1038 (pl.), etc.; θνήσκειν ἐκ π. Epigr.Gr. 247 ( Mysia); π. ἀμφημερινοί, τριταῖοι, τεταρταῖοι, quotidian, tertian, quartan fevers, Pl. Ti. 86a, etc. (v. sub. vocc.); διαλείποντες Arist. Pr. 866a23.
causing fever, Sch. S. OT 27.
feverish, ῥίγεα Hp. Fract. 34; inflamed, ἕλκος ib. 25 (v.l. πυρῶδες).
subject to fever, κύστις Id. Aër. 9.
sickly season, π. θέρος ib. 10; π. νότοι Arist. Pr. 862a17, etc. Comp. -έστερος Hp. Art. 49.
one who lights fire or burns, Hsch. (pl.); πυρις (sic), = flamines, Gloss. (fort. ἱερεῖς).

children.label: II
children.definition: fire-proof vessel, cj. in AP 13.13.
one who fishes by torchlight, Poll. 1.96.
of or for fishing by torchlight, πυρευτική (sc. θήρα) Pl. Sph. 220d; cf. πυρία II.

children.label: II
children.definition: for burning, χρεία Thphr. HP 5.1.12.
light a fire, Pl. Lg. 843e.

definition: πυρή, ῆς, ἡ, Ion. and Ep. for πυρά. πῠρήϊον, τό, Ion. for πυρεῖον.

children.definition: stone of stone-fruit, as of the olive, Hdt. 2.92, Thphr. CP 5.18.4, etc.; of the pomegranate, Hp. Aff. 54, Thphr. HP 1.11.6; of the medlar, ib. 3.12.5; of the date, Arist. Mete. 342a10, Thphr. CP 1.19.2 (where ἐλάας is prob. cj. for ἰτέας); of the elder, Hp. Mul. 2.133; of the myrtle and grape, Arist. Pr. 925b26; of the wild cherry, Hdt. 4.23.
nut, the kernel of κῶνος I.2, Mnesith. ap. Ath. 2.57b, IG 2(2).1013.21.

children.label: II
children.definition: hard bone of fishes, implied by ἀπύρηνος Archestr. Fr. 8.9.

children.label: III
children.definition: grain of frankincense, Hp. ap. Gal. 19.134.

children.label: b
children.definition: aromatic, PMag.Par. 1.2874, al.

children.label: IV
children.definition: round head of a probe, Gal. UP 15.7.

children.label: V
children.definition: gem, Plin. HN 37.188; as a votive offering, IG 7.3498.17 ( Oropus).

children.label: VI
children.definition: growth under the chin of an animal, Str. 4.6.10. (Sts. misspelt πυρρ- in codd.; the quantity of υ is inferred from ἀπῡρηνος Archestr. l.c. and Lat. apȳrǐnus.)
knob-turners, guild at Ephesus, Ephes. 2.79.
fanning fire, AP 6.101 ( Phil., s.v.l.).
Dim. of πυρήν, knob, IG 11(2).223 B 19,36 ( Delos, iii B.C.), BGU 781 iii 9 (i A.D.).

definition: πυρηνίζειν, prob. for πιρην-, sine expl., Hsch.

children.definition: Dim. of πυρήν I, Thphr. HP 3.7.4, Porph. Abst. 2.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: IG ΙΙ(2).161 B 116 ( Delos, iii B.C.). * πῡρην-ίς, only in Boeot. form πουρεινίς (q.v.).
shaped like a stone in fruit, of the ὀδούς III, Gal. 2.756, UP 12.7; καυτῆρας π. provided with knobs, Paul.Aeg. 6.2.

definition: πυρηνοσμίλη, f.l. for πυρῆνος μήλης in Paul.Aeg. 6.9, 21.

children.definition: like a fruit-stone, σπέρματα Thphr. HP 1.11.3, al.; ὀφθαλμοί dub. in Arist. HA 568a1.
producing fire, AP 6.90 ( Phil., dub.).

definition: πυρήφατος, ον, ( πυρός) formed like μυλήφατος,

children.definition: wheat-pounding servant of Demeter, i.e. a millstone, AP 7.394 ( Phil., πυρηφάτου cod.P).
wheat-bearing, πεδίον Od. 3.495, h.Ap. 228.

vapour-bath, made by throwing odorous substances on hot embers confined under a cloth, Hdt. 4.75; πυρίαις χρῆσθαι ἐκ λίθων διαπύρων Str. 3.3.6; τὰ σώματα ταῖς π. εὖ διατίθησι Plu. QConv. 2.658d; πυρίαν ἐφεῦρεν [Μήδεια] Palaeph. 43: metaph., γίνονται οἷον πυρίαι ἐν τῷ αἵματι Arist. PA 651a1.

data.quote: τὰ σώματα ταῖς π. εὖ διατίθησι
γίνονται οἷον πυρίαι ἐν τῷ αἵματι

children.definition: external application of heat, ξηραὶ π. Hp. Acut. 21; ὑγραί, ξηραί, Gal. 15.519, cf. Hp. Aph. 5.28, 6.31; of cauteries, πυρίῃσι καυτήρων Aret. CD 1.2.
Moschio ap. Ath. 5.207f; so perh. in AP 11.243 ( Nicarch.).
CIG 3108,3113 ( Teos); tomb-chamber, Keil-Premerstein Dritter Bericht No.108, al., Supp.Epigr. 4.548.4 ( Ephesus), 594.11 ( Colophon).

children.label: II
children.definition: fishing by torchlight, Arist. HA 537a18 (pl.).
caught by fire, of sea-birds, Philostr. Im. 2.17.
Hp. Flat. 9, Philist. 63, Arist. Pr. 866a24; = πυρία I.1, Palaeph. 43.
warming by a vapour bath, Thphr. Ign. 37 (pl.), Dsc. 1.16 (pl.).
one must warm, Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 58.109; κατάπλασμα Antyll. ap. Orib. 10.13.18 ( v.l. πῠρι-ᾱτέον, and so Apollon. ap. Gal. 12.654).

definition: πυριάτη [ ᾱ], ἡ ( Poll. 1.248, 6.54, Phot., who says, πυριάτη θηλυκῶς, οὐχὶ πυρίατος, οὐδὲ πυριατή ὀξυτόνως),

children.definition: beestings curdled by heating over embers, ἐμπιπλάμενοι πυριάτῃ Cratin. 142; πυῷ καὶ πυριάτῃ Ar. V. 710, cf. Eub. 74.5, Luc. Lex. 3, Gal. 6.694, Poll. 1.248, Phot.; cf. πυριατόν.
hot-water bottle or warming-pan, Sor. 2.10.

definition: πυριατήριον ( Ion. πῠρι-ητήριον Hp. Steril. 230), τό,

children.definition: vapour-bath, heated by a furnace, Eup. 128, Arist. Pr. 869a19, IG 5(1).938 ( Cythera, iii B.C.), Plu. Cim. 1; τὸ π. τὸ Λακωνικόν, Lat. Laconicum, D.C. 53.27; π. τὸ ἐκ τῆς σικύης Hp. l.c.
π. φακωτά bean-shaped hot-water bottles, Archig. ap. Aët. 9.28.
heated in or for a bath, κέραμος Gal. 19.86; but πυριατόν· τὸ ἑφθὸν πυρί, ὃ γίνεται ἐκ τοῦ πρώτου γάλακτος, Hsch.

definition: πυριάω, Ion. inf. -ιῆν Hp. Nat.Mul. 107, but -ιᾶν Id. Morb. 2.14: aor. ἐπυρίησα ib. 19, -ίᾱσα Hippiatr. 100:— Med., inf. -ιῆσθαι Hp. Vict. 1.35: aor. ἐπυριησάμην Id. Nat.Mul. 7, 107, etc.:— Pass., aor. ἐπυριήθην Id. Int. 1:—

children.definition: put persons in a vapour-bath, c. acc., Id. Art. 47, Palaeph. 43, etc.: metaph., τὸν λάρυγγʼ ἥδιστα π. τεμαχίοις Crobyl. 8:— Pass., take a vapour-bath, Ath. 12.519e.
π. αὐτὴν ὅσον τριήκοντα πυρίας Hp. Mul. 1.75.
foment, τὰ ἕλκη σαρξὶν ὑείαις Str. 15.1.43:— Pass., πυριῶνται διά τινος οἱ ὀδόντες Dsc. 3.9.
Pass., to be used for vapour-baths, [ κύπερος] πρός τι πυριωμένη ἁρμόζει Id. 1.4.

definition: πυριβήτης, ου, poet. εω, ὁ, ( βαίνω)

children.definition: standing over a fire, τρίπους Arat. 983.
living in fire, ζῷα D.L. 9.79.
struck by fire, Nonn. D. 8.355: metaph., fevered, Nic. Th. 774.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., = πυροβόλος, ἀκίδες AP 12.76 ( Mel.), cf. Nonn. D. 30.91.
fiery, πλαγαί E. Fr. 781.69 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: πυρίβολον, τό, = malleolus, Gloss.
of fiery counsel, Ἑκάτη PMag.Par. 1.2752.
laden with fire, Orac. ap. Procl. in Ti. 2.54 D.
roaring with fire, ἠέλιος Orph. A. 1122 (nisi leg. -δρομος) Ζεύς Id. H. 20.2.
devoured by fire, Str. 17.1.27.
fire-wrought, χαλινοί A. Th. 207 (lyr., πυριβρεμετᾶν Dind., cf. Timachid. ap. Hsch. s.v. πυριβρεμέτας).
born in or from fire, δράκων E. Fr. 943 (lyr.); Διόνυσος Str. 13.4.11.
wrought or forged by fire, στόμια E. Hipp. 1223; κώθων Henioch. 1; π. παλάμα, i.e. a weapon, E. Or. 820 (lyr.).
fiery-eyed, Opp. C. 3.97, Orph. L. 657, etc.
barbed with fire, Opp. C. 2.166 (v.l. περι-), Nonn. D. 1.151.
producing fire, Plu. Alex. 35.

children.label: II
children.definition: πυρίγονος, ον, Pass., fire-engendered, Ael. NA 2.2; τὰ π. Ph. 1.263, 2.500.
devoured by fire, A. Eu. 1041 (lyr.).

definition: πυρίδειπνος, ον, = foreg., prob. to be written divisim in Call. Fr. 346.

children.definition: whirling fire, PMag.Par. 1.598.
Dim. of πῦρ, spark, Thphr. Fr. 33.

definition: πυρίδιον, τό, Dim. of πυρός, Ar. Lys. 1206 (pl.), PSI 6.611.2 (pl., iii B.C.).

children.definition: girt with fiery serpents, PMag.Par. 1.1404.
fiery in its course, ἥλιος Orph. H. 8.11, prob. in A. 1122.
with tresses of fire, ἀστραπά B. 16.56.

πυριάτη, Philippid. 10 (as cited by Poll. 6.54, but τοὺς πυριέφθας Ath. 14.658d cod. A, and Hsch. has πυρὶ ἔφθαι (sic) · τὸ πρῶτον γάλα, and πυριεφθής as gloss on ξηροπυρίτας, s.v. ψηροπυρίτας), cf. Gal. 6.694, Poll. 1.248, Eust. 1626.6 (ubi vulg. πύρεφθον), Phot., etc.

definition: πυριηκής or πῠρι-ήκης, ές or ες, ( ἀκή Α)

children.definition: with fiery point, μοχλός Od. 9.387.
heated in the fire, A.R. 4.926, Nic. Th. 40, AP 7.742 ( Apollonid., s.v.l., prob. περι-).
fiery-spirited, PMag.Par. 1.592.
πυρίκαυστος, AP 6.281 ( Leon.); πυρετός Gal. 16.709. [ ᾱ metri gr. in AP l.c.]
fire-burners, of the Delphians, Orac. ap. Plu. Pyth. 2.406e.
burnt in fire, Il. 13.564, Plu. Fac.lun. 2.922a, Vett.Val. 127.32; in late Ep. πῠρί-καυτος, Epic. in Arch.Pap. 7.4, Nonn. D. 10.74, al.
caused by a burn (or scald, cf. Gal. 13.384), φλυκταινίδες ὥσπερ π. Hp. Epid. 2.1.1; π. [ἕλκη] Dsc. 1.68.2, cf. Hp. Fract. 27, Arist. Pr. 866a6; later πυρίκαυτα ἕλκεα Aret. SA 1.9.
πυρίκαυστον, τό, plaster for a burn, Thphr. HP 9.19.3, Ign. 38; ἡ π. ἔμπλαστρος Asclep. ap. Gal. 13.525.

children.label: II
children.definition: inflammatory, in the form -καυτος, Pl. Ti. 85c, Luc. Asin. 6, etc.
inflamed, ὑπερῴα πυρίκαυτος Aristid. Or. 49(25).30.
burning with fire, σφαίρης πυρικαύτορα κύκλον Timo 67.7.
fire-thronging, PMag.Par. 1.597.
wrought at or with fire, λέβης Call. Del. 145, cf. Fr.anon. 50 [not found]; scorched, χρώς Nic. Th. 241; cooked, κρέα Porph. Abst. 1.13.
wherein fire lies asleep, νάρθηξ π., of the cane of Prometheus, AP 6.294 ( Phan., dub.).
of or from wheat, φόρος BGU 920.30 (ii A.D.); γόμος OGI 629.86 ( Palmyra, ii A.D.): -κά, τά, wheat, PLond. 3.924.9 (ii A.D.).

definition: πυρικρόταφος ὁ μετὰ πυρὸς κεκροτημένος σίδηρος, Hsch.

children.definition: made in or with fire, ἐν πυρικτίτῳ στέγᾳ in an earthen pot, restored by Kock (for πυρικτίτοισι γᾶς) in Tim. Fr. 23.
bright with fire, ἀστέρες AP 5.15 (Marc. Arg. cod. Plan., περιλάμπει cod.Pal.), cf. Arat. 1040, Hymn.Is. 8, Opp. C. 3.72, al.
seized by fire, πεδία π. volcanic country, Str. 12.2.7; πέτραι Id. 16.2.44.

sparkling like fire, ἀστήρ Man. 4.93, 391, Cat.Cod.Astr. 1.173.
to be fire-resisting, Zos.Alch. p.252B.
resisting fire, of a fire-proof stone, Arist. Mete. 383b5, Mir. 833b27.

children.label: II
children.definition: fiery in fight, Hsch.

definition: πυρίνη, ἡ, f.l. for πυρήν in Hp. Mul. 2.133, Hsch.

children.definition: with fiery hair, PMag.Par. 1.636.

of fire, fiery, σῶμα Arist. de An. 435a12, cf. GC 326a31; εἰ . . ὁ ἀὴρ μὴ πῦρ, ἀλλὰ π. Id. Metaph. 1049a26; ἄστρα Id. Cael. 289a16; δοκίς D.S. 15.50; θώρακες Apoc. 9.17; π. κλῇθρα PMag.Par. 1.589; π. νύμφαι hot springs, AP 14.52; π. φάρμακον fiery drug, prob. arsenic, Maria ap. Zos.Alch. p.201B.

children.label: II
children.definition: π. πόλεμος bitter, obstinate war, Plb. 35.1.6, D.S. 31.40.
π. ἀσπαστικόν fiery greeting, PMag.Par. 1.638.

of wheat, wheaten, < στάχυς> E. Fr. 373; prob. for πυρίμου ib. 350; ἄρτοι X. An. 4.5.31; σῖτος PEleph. 5.26 (iii B.C.), Babr. 26.2; πτισάνη Arist. Pr. 863a35; ἄχυρον, ἄλευρον, Thphr. HP 8.4.1, Dsc. 3.102; γράστις PSI 3.351.7 (iii B.C.), Hippiatr. 68; ἡ πυρίνη, name of a plaster containing bread, Paul.Aeg. 7.17.15.

definition: πυρίον, τό, f.l. for πυρεῖον, Corn. ND 19, Anthem. p.153 W.

children.definition: πύρινος ( πῦρ), Iamb. Myst. 2.7, Dam. Pr. 9. Adv. -ίως Iamb. Myst. 2.4 (s.v.l.).
Son of fire, of Dionysus, Opp. C. 4.287.

lord of the fount of fire, PMag.Osl. 1.155 (s.v.l.); written -άνυξ (sic) ib. 344 ( παγ-), PMag.Par. 1.3177 (prob. corrected fr. -άναξ), Rev.Phil. 1930.249 (Tab.defix., Egypt), Tab.Defix.Aud. 38.29 (ibid., iii A.D., prob.), etc.
full of fire, Orac. ap. Eus. PE 4.9.
wreathed with fire, σειρή Nonn. D. 30.83.
πυρίπνοος, ὀϊστοί Musae. 88 (v.l.).

children.label: II
children.definition: breathed on by fire, λέβητες Nonn. D. 33.6, cf. IPE 12.274 ( Olbia, i A.D., dub.).

definition: πυριπνέων, Ep. πῠρι-πνείων, ουσα, ον, part. with no Verb in use,

children.definition: fire-breathing, Musae. 41; πῦρ πνέουσαν must be read in E. Ion 203 (lyr.).

definition: πυρίπνοος, ον, contr. πῠρί-πνους, ουν, ( πνέω)

children.definition: fire-breathing, Lyc. 1314, PMag.Par. 1.592, etc.; fiery, π. τόξα [Ἔρωτος] AP 5.179 ( Mel.); ζᾶλος ib. 7.354 ( Gaet.).
surging with fire, ἀστέρες cj. in Orph. H. 7.4.
mighty with fire, Διόνυσος Nonn. D. 24.6; πολιῆται ib. 29.193, cf. PMag.Berol. 2.90.
roaring with fire, Theoc. Syrinx 8 (v.l. -σφάραγος).
sowing fire, inflaming, δῆγμα APl. 16.208 ( Gabriel.).

children.label: II
children.definition: πυρίσπορος, ον, gendered in fire, Orph. H. 45.1, Opp. C. 4.304.

fire-streaming, πέτρα π., of Etna, E. Cyc. 298.
tripod to stand on the fire, Sch. Ar. Av. 436; also πυρίστατος and πυροστάτης, Eust. 1827.56; πυρίστατος and πῠρι-ον, Gloss.
fire-wreathed or crowned, Nonn. D. 8.289.
sealed with fire, Nonn. D. 13.328.
maintaining light by fire, PMag.Par. 1.601.
with body of fire, PMag.Par. 1.595.
of or in fire, π. τὴν τέχνην, i.e. a smith, Luc. JConf. 8, cf. Sacr. 6.

children.label: II
children.definition: π. λίθος, a mineral which strikes fire, copper pyrites, Dsc. 5.125, Plin. HN 36.138; other varieties of uncertain nature, ib. 137, PHolm. 11.38, Zos.Alch. p.120B., al., Suid. s.v. ἄφαντον φῶς; of a zinc ore, Dsc. 5.74.
wheaten loaf, Aët. 2.263 (pl.), Suid.

definition: πυρῖτις (sc. βοτάνη), ιδος, ἡ, = πύρεθρον, Nic. Th. 683, Al. 531.

children.label: II
children.definition: λίθος), an unknown gem, Plin. HN 37.189.
gendered in fire, of Dionysus, Lyd. Mens. 4.160.
fire-fed, PMag.Berol. 2.94, Nonn. D. 2.486.
cherishing fire, ῥιπίδες AP 6.101 ( Phil.).
fiery in its course, Nonn. D. 14.292.
appearing in fire, PMag.Par. 1.3023.
slain by fire, A. Supp. 633 (lyr.).
fire-blazing, fiery, Orph. A. 214, PMag.Par. 1.960.
fire-borne, PMag.Par. 1.3244 (dub.).
volatile, vaporizable, Ps.-Democr. ap. Zos.Alch. p.122 B.
πυριφλεγής 2, κοιλίη Hp. Mul. 1.52, cf. 2.178.
blazing like fire, ἔσοπτρον Agesianax ap. Plu. Fac.lun. 2.921b.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pyriphlegethon, one of the rivers of hell, Od. 10.513, Pl. Phd. 114a.
flaming with fire, blazing, Plu. Frig. 2.948c; f.l. for περι- in X. HG 5.3.19.
violently inflamed, ὑστέραι Hp. Mul. 1.54; π. δίψαι burning thirst, Aret. SD 2.2.
burnt or blazing with fire, κάμακες A. Fr. 171 (anap.); πανός E. Ion 195 (lyr.); fiery, βλάβαι Lyc. 218; πόθοι AP 12.151; βοστρύχια ib. 11.66 ( Antiphil.).
flaming with fire, Emp. Sphaer. 113.
walking in fire, epith. of Persephone, Hymn.Mag. 3.25.
holding heat, prob. in Sor. 1.76.
cupping-instrument, Anon. in Rh. 170.11.
rejoicing in fire, PMag.Par. 1.593.

definition: πυρίχη [ ῐ], ἡ, poet. for πυρρίχη, AP 12.186 ( Strat.).

children.definition: fire-coloured, ὄψις Alcid. ap. Arist. Rh. 1406a2.
fire-kindler, Ναύπλιος π. title of play by S.

definition: πυρκαϊά, Ep. and Ion. πυρκα-ϊή, ἡ: trisyll. πυρκαιά E. Supp. 1207: ( καίω):—

children.definition: funeral pyre, νεκροὺς πυρκαϊῆς ἐπενήνεον Il. 7.428; πυρκαϊὴ ἐμαραίνετο 23.228; κατὰ πυρκαϊὴν σβέσαν αἴθοπι οἴνῳ quenched the burning pyre, ib. 250; πυρκαιὰς νεκρῶν E. l.c.; χλωρίωνι, ὃν . . μυθολογοῦσι γενέσθαι ἐκ πυρκαϊᾶς Arist. HA 609b10.

data.quote: χλωρίωνι, ὃν . . μυθολογοῦσι γενέσθαι ἐκ πυρκαϊᾶς

children.definition: conflagration, πυρκαϊῆς γινομένης Hdt. 2.66, cf. Arist. Mu. 400a29 (pl.); arson, Lex ap. D. 23.22; πυρκαϊᾶς γραφή, δικάζειν, Poll. 8.40, 117.
flame of love, διʼ ὅσης ἤλθετε πυρκαϊῆς AP 7.217 ( Asclep.).
burnt ruins, D.S. 16.45.

children.label: II
children.definition: olive-tree which has been burnt down to the stump, and grows up again a wild olive, Lys. 7.24 (s. v.l.).
for burnt-offerings, ἐσχάραι IG 11 (2).145.58 ( Delos, iv B.C.), 161 B 124 (ib., iii B.C.).
one who watched a sacrificial fire (at Delphi) to draw omens from it, Hsch.
fit for eating, σταφυλαί Theoc. 1.46 (nisi leg. Πυρν- as pr.n.).
wheaten bread, Od. 15.312, 17.12, 362; esp. of bread with the bran in it, Philem.Gloss. ap. Ath. 3.114d.

children.label: II
children.definition: food, meat, φήγινον π. acorns or mast, Lyc. 482 (pl.), cf. 639: pl., Hsch.

definition: πύρνος, ὁ, = ψωμός, Hsch.: pl., expld. by ζειαὶ κνηστώδεις, ὁ κατειργασμένος σῖτος, χόρτος or μαγίς, Id.

children.definition: food-producing, ἄρουρα Hymn.Is. 45.
sow wheat, PLond. 1.131.278, 285 (i A.D.).
fire-darting, τὰ πυροβόλα bolts or arrows tipped with fire, LXX 1 Ma. 5.61, Plu. Sull. 9, Ant. 66; gloss on πυρεῖα, Sch. S. Ph. 36.
eating wheat, Q.S. 2.197.
fire-born, of Dionysus, Aus. Epigr. 49.3.
made from wheat, AP 9.368 ( Jul.).
Hsch.; cf. πύρδανον.
receiving wheat, στεφάνη Opp. H. 4.501.
vaporalis, Gloss.
fiery, Pl. Lg. 895c, Arist. GC 330b24; φύσεις Epicur. Ep. 2p.39U.; of the planet Mars, Eudox. Ars 5.13. Adv. -δῶς Placit. 2.13.9 (v.l.).
fiery, κεραυνός Cleanth.1.10; ἀστήρ A.R. 3.1377; μύκητες Call. Fr. 47; ὄμματα, πόθος, AP 5.14 ( Rufin.), 9.132; κάπρος Opp. C. 1.389, al.; βέλος Nonn. D. 2.436.
ὁ Π. the planet Mars, from its fiery colour, Arist. Mu. 399a9, IG 12(1).913 ( Rhodes, i B.C.), Cic. ND 2.20.53, Alex.Eph. ap. Theo Sm. p.139 H., Ph. 1.504, Cleom. 1.3, etc.
Nonn. D., as Ares, 41.348; Dionysus, 21.222; Hephaestus, 2.225; Zeus, 6.218.

children.label: II
children.definition: πυροῦντες, οἱ, a sort of trout, Mnesith. ap. Ath. 8.358c.
working at the fire, Man. 1.78.
deal in wheat, Poll. 7.18.
theft of fire, AP 6.100 ( Crin., v.l. πυρι-).
pair of fire-tongs, Gloss.
reaping wheat, AP 6.104 ( Phil., v.l. πυριλ-).

fire-diviner, v.l. for τυρ-, Artem. 2.69.

definition: πυρομάχος [ ᾰ], ον, = πυριμάχος, Thphr. Lap. 9.
πυρομέτρης, ου, and πῡρο-μετρητής, οῦ, ὁ,

children.definition: one who measures wheat, and πῡρο-μετρέω, measure wheat, Poll. 7.18.
πυρόξανθος, v. πυρρόξανθος.
sending flames of fire, PMag.Par. 1.1362.

wheat-market, Poll. 7.18 (v.l.).
deal in wheat, D. 19.114.
wheat-merchant, corn-merchant, Poll. 7.18.
bursting in the fire, Cratin. 253.

children.label: II
children.definition: ψοφεῖ λάλον τι καὶ π. cracked, Ar. Ach. 933 (lyr.).

definition: πυρός (in dialects also σπυρός (q. v.)), ὁ,

children.definition: wheat, Triticum vulgare, μελίφρονα, μελιηδέα πυρόν, Il. 8.188, 10.569; κατὰ πυρὸν ἄλεσσαν ground it, Od. 20.109; given to geese, 19.536: pl., with other grains, πυροί τε ζειαί τε ἰδʼ εὐρυφυὲς κρῖ λευκόν 4.604; πυροὶ καὶ κριθαί 9.110, 19.112, cf. Il. 11.69, IG 1(2).76.38, al., Hdt. 2.36, 4.33, Ar. V. 1405, Pax 1145, Av. 580, Th. 6.22, D. 19.145, Thphr. HP 8.4.3, Dsc. 2.85, etc.

children.definition: a grain of wheat, ἐξ ἑνὸς πυροῦ εἷς πυθμήν Arist. GA 728b35, cf. Plu. in Hes. 84.
π. ἄγριος,= χελιδόνιον τὸ μικρόν, Dsc. 2.181. (Cf. Lith. pūraĩ (pl.) ‘wheat’, and perh. πυρήν.)
wheat-coloured, Sammelb. 7365.110 (ii A.D.).
sow with wheat, POxy. 1628.11 (i B.C.).
born of fire, epith. of Dionysus, Orph. H. 52.2.
ignitabulum, Gloss.
fieriness, Gal. 19.442, Plot. 2.6.1.
reaping of wheat, Thphr. HP 9.8.2.
wheat-destroying, νοῦσος IG 3.171.
fear fire, in Med., Hp. Ep. 19 ( Hermes 53.70).
bear wheat, App. BC 2.40.
to be πυροφόρος II, IG 42(1).227 (Epid.); π. Ἀσκληπιοῦ ib. 384.8 (ibid.).
of πυροφόροι ( = πυρφόροι) , δεῖπνα IG 5(2).269.25 ( Mantinea).
inflammatory missiles, Ph. Bel. 91.41, 94.8; engines which discharge such missiles, ib. 95.20.

children.label: II
children.definition: bearer of sacrificial fire, at Epidaurus, IG 42(1).400, al.; at Argos, SIG 735.13 (i B.C.); written πουροφόρος, πυρωφώρος, IG 5(1).997, 1021 ( Laconia).

wheat-bearing, ἄρουρα Il. 12.314; ἄρουραι 14.123, Simon. 15; πεδίον, πεδία, Il. 21.602, E. Ph. 644 (lyr.); πεδιάς Ph. 2.117; Λιβύα Pi. I. 4(3).54; γῆ Sol. 24.2, Thphr. CP 3.21.2, PSI 4.432.4 (iii B.C.); Γέλα A. Eleg. 4; cf. πυρηφόρος.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀὴρ π. air promoting the growth of wheat, Hes. Op. 549 (nisi leg. πυροφόροις . . ἐπὶ ἔργοις).

burn with fire, burn up, τὰς Ἀθήνας Hdt. 7.8.βʹ, 8.102; στέγην A. Fr. 281; ναούς S. Ant. 286; burn as a burnt sacrifice, ὀσφῦν A. Pr. 497; πυροῦτε σώματα E. HF 244; burn on a pyre, ἣν πεπύρωκαν (sic) ἐγώ Supp.Epigr. 1.569 ( Egypt); π. Κύκλωπος ὄψιν burn out his eye, E. Cyc. 594, cf. 600:— Med., παῖδα πυρωσαμένη having placed my son on the pyre, AP 7.466 ( Leon.):— Pass., to be set on fire, to be burnt, πυρωθέντων Τρώων Pi. P. 11.33; Ἴλιον πυρούμενον E. Andr. 400, cf. Tr. 1283; πυρωθῆναι δέμας Id. IT 685, cf. Med. 1190, Parth. in PLit.Lond. 64.6, Ph. 1.256.

children.label: b
children.definition: π. τὴν γεῦσιν, τὴν γλῶσσαν, seem hot to the taste or tongue, Dsc. 1.16, 4.170.

children.label: c
children.definition: ἡ ζεστολουσία . . πυροῦσα τὴν ἐπιφάνειαν reddening or warming up the surface, Theon ap. Gal. 6.208.

set on fire, inflame, Ἔρως σὺ δʼ εὐθέως με πύρωσον Anacreont. 10.15:— Pass., to be inflamed or excited, παραγγέλμασιν . . πυρωθεὶς καρδίαν A. Ag. 481 (lyr.); τινι by a person (with love), AP 12.87; εὐχαριστίᾳ Ph. 1.60, cf. 2 Ep.Cor. 11.29.

data.quote: Ἔρως σὺ δʼ εὐθέως με πύρωσον

children.label: II
children.definition: produce fire, Arist. PA 649b5:— Pass., to become fire, to be ignited, Pl. Ti. 51b, 52d, Arist. Cael. 307a24, al.

children.label: III
children.definition: treat with fire: roast, grill, Hp. Vict. 2.56; bake, πλίνθους Ph. 1.420; τὸ σταῖς Arist. Pr. 927b39, cf. 929b12 ( Pass.); warm on the fire, Agatharch. 61 ( Pass.); melt, [ ἀργυρώματα] IG 7.303.15 ( Oropus, iii B.C.); make red hot, Ph. 1.625 ( Pass.); fumigate, δῶμα θεείῳ Theoc. 24.96; cauterize, Arist. HA 515b18 ( Pass.).
Pass., to be affected by fire, ὁ χρυσὸς οὐ πυροῦται Id. Mete. 378b4.
to be proved or tested by fire, χρυσίον πεπυρωμένον ἐκ πυρός Apoc. 3.18: metaph., proved by fire, approved, LXX Ps. 17 ( 18). 31, 118 ( 119). 140, Ph. 1.57.
to be affected by heart-burn, Herod.Med. ap. Aët. 9.2.

definition: πυρπαλαμάομαι, = κακοτεχνέω, Eust. 513.30 (expl. of h.Merc. 357, wrongly divided).

children.definition: cunningly wrought from fire, π. βέλος, of the thunderbolt, Pi. O. 10(11).80.

children.label: II
children.definition: πυρπαλάμης· πυρπαλάμους ἔλεγον τοὺς διὰ τάχους τι μηχανᾶσθαι δυναμένους, καὶ τοὺς ποικίλους τὸ ἦθος, Hsch., cf. Eust. 513.30; πυρπαλάμην· ὁ ταχέως τι ἐπινοῶν καὶ παλαμώμενος ἴσα πυρί, Phot.; cf. foreg.

definition: πυρπερέγχει, f.l. for πῦρ πῦρ ἔγχει in Cratin. 18.
πύρπνοος, ον, contr. πύρ-πνους, ουν, = πυρίπνοος,

children.definition: fire-breathing, Τυφών A. Th. 511, cf. 493; ταῦροι, λέαινα, E. Med. 478, El. 473 (lyr.); χίμαιρα Anaxil. 22.3, Epin. 2.10; π. βέλος, of lightning, A. Pr. 917; βέλεσι πυρπνόου ζάλης, of Etna, ib. 373.
light and keep up a fire, watch a fire, Od. 10.30, X. Cyr. 3.3.25; π. τοὺς ἄνθρακας stir up, fan the fire, Ar. Av. 1580.

children.label: II
children.definition: burn with fire, Id. Th. 727; τινα, of the bull of Phalaris, Phalar. Ep. 66.2:— Pass., Phld. Piet. 89.

waste with fire, burn and destroy, τὴν οἰκίαν Ar. Nu. 1497; πόλιν Id. V. 1079; π. καὶ καίουσι καὶ σφάττουσι Luc. Cal. 19:— Med., πᾶσαν πυρπολέεσθαι [τὴν ʼαττικήν] cause it to be burnt with fire, Hdt. 8.50.
assail with fiery missiles, τοὺς ἐπὶ τῷ πύργῳ τοξότας Palaeph. 38, cf. 40.
ὥσπερ ἡ χίμαιρα π. τοὺς βαρβάρους, of a ἑταίρα, Anaxil. 22.9, cf. Men. Mon. 195; also of disease or pain, Nic. Th. 245, 364; of love, Ach.Tat. 1.11.
watch-fire, beacon, E. Hel. 767.
wasting with fire, J. BJ 3.7.11 (pl.).
Hsch.
wasting with fire, burning, κεραυνός E. Supp. 640.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., ἄστη δέ τε π. θήσει wasted by fire, Orac. ap. Phleg. Fr. 36.3 J.
a red-coloured bird, Ael. NA 4.5.
to be fiery red, of the sky, Ev.Matt. 16.2.
red robe (?), Supp.Epigr. 4.188 ( Halic., iii B.C.).
red-haired man, prob. for porracius in Gloss.
red, ruddy, LXX 1 Ki. 16.12, al., PPetr. 3p.1 (iii B.C.), PCair.Zen. 76.11 (iii B.C.): acc. sg. written πυρράκη ib. 374.5; also πυρράκων, Suid.
red-coloured serpent, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: Redhead, common name of a slave, prop. of the red-haired slaves from Thrace, Ar. Ra. 730, etc.; cf. πυρρός II.
to be or become red: blush, Ach.Tat. 2.11, Hld. 3.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be of a ruddy complexion, Procop. Arc. 8.
to be red or ruddy, LXX Le. 13.19, al.
named after Pyrrhus, of a certain breed of sheep, Arist. HA 522b24; prob. for πυρρίχας ib. 595b18.

war-dance, Ar. Ra. 153, X. An. 6.1.12, Pl. Lg. 816b; called from one Πύρριχος the inventor, acc. to Aristox. Fr.Hist. 46, Str. 10.3.8, 10.4.16; but acc. to Arist. Fr. 519, from its being first used at the funeral of Patroclus (from πυρά); as a prizecontest, CIG 2758 IV ( Aphrodisias), 3089 ( Teos).
δειναὶ π. strange contortions, E. Andr. 1135: prov., πυρρίχην βλέπειν ‘to look daggers’, Ar. Av. 1169.
pyrrhic, [ μέτρον] Heph. 8.8; [ λέξις] Hdn.Gr. 1.562.
dance the πυρρίχη, Arist. Fr. 519, Plu. Vind. 2.554b, Luc. D Deor. 13[8].1.
the foot ⏑⏑⏑⏑_, Diom. p.481 K.
of or belonging to the πυρρίχη, π. [εἶδος], ὄρχησις, the Pyrrhic dance, Luc. Salt. 9, Hld. 3.10; π. δρόμος Hdn. 4.2.9.

children.label: II
children.definition: ποὺς π. a pyrrhic, i.e. a foot consisting of two short syllables, used in the πυρρίχη, Longin. 41.1, Heph. 3.1, Aristid.Quint. 1.15.
dancing of the πυρρίχη, J. AJ 19.1.14 (pl.).
dancer of the πυρρίχη: οἱ π. the chorus of Pyrrhic dancers, Lys. 21.1, Is. 5.36, IG 2(2).2311.72.
of or like a πυρριχιστής, Poll. 4.73.
red, ταῦρος ὁ π. Theoc. 4.20.
of or with red earth, Antyll. ap. Orib. 9.11.6.
red-bearded, AP 7.707 ( Diosc.).
red-haired, Sol. 22 (v.l.), Arist. Pr. 966b33.

definition: πυρροκόμης, ου, ὁ, = foreg., Sch.D Il. 2.642.

children.definition: Alpine chough, Corvus pyrrhocorax, Plin. HN 10.133.

definition: πυρρομάκρεια μοσχεύματα, dub. sens. in PCair.Zen. 196.9 (iii B.C.).

children.definition: reddish-yellow, prob. for πυρό- in Pall. in Hp. 2.15 D.
become red, Arist. Pr. 966b32, Aq., Sm., Thd. Ex. 25.5; Act. and Pass. dub. in Plu. Comm.not. 2.1081b.
red-spotted, of red granite, Plin. HN 36.157, Tz. H. 6.610.
red-winged, prob. cj. in Com.Adesp. 1 D. (anap.).

definition: πυρρός, ά ( Ion. ή), όν, but Trag. and Dor. πυρσός, ή ( Dor. ά), όν, E. Ph. 32, HF 361 (lyr.), Mosch. 2.70, cj. in A. Pers. 316; rare in Prose, Plu. Pel. 22: ( πῦρ):—

children.definition: flame-coloured, yellowish-red ( πυρρὸν ξανθοῦ τε καὶ φαιοῦ κράσει γίγνεται Pl. Ti. 68c, cf. Arist. Metaph. 1054b13, Gal. 9.600), ᾠοῦ τὸ π. the yolk of an egg, Hp. Mul. 2.171, PLit.Lond. 170 (i A.D.); ἡ λευκότης γίγνεται πυρρή Hp. Aër. 20; of sediment in urine, Id. Epid. 6.1.5.

data.quote: πυρρὸν ξανθοῦ τε καὶ φαιοῦ κράσει γίγνεται

children.definition: with red hair, Xenoph. 16.2, Hdt. 4.108; π. τὸ Σκυθικὸν γένος Hp. Aër. 20; οἱ ἁλιεῖς π. Arist. Pr. 966b26; π. τρίχες Id. GA 785a19; of the colour of the first beard, γενειάς A. l.c.; γένυες E. Ph. 32; [ θρίξ] Theoc. 15.130, cf. 6.3.

tawny, λέων E. HF l.c., Arist. GA 785b17, AP 6.263 ( Leon.); βοῦς PLond. 3.890.5, 10 ( i B.C., written πυραί), Plu. Isid. 2.363b; ἵππος Apoc. 6.4; [ πώλου] ἡ χρόα στίλβουσα τῆς χαίτης πυρσότατον Plu. Pel. 22; αἶγες PHib. 1.120.6 (iii B.C.); τὰ χρώματα τῶν κυνῶν X. Cyn. 4.7.

data.quote: πώλου] ἡ χρόα στίλβουσα τῆς χαίτης πυρσότατον

children.definition: red, χλανίς Hdt. 3.139; ῥόδον Mosch. 2.70; ἕψημα LXX Ge. 25.30; τὸ π. redness, Ar. Ec. 329:— Ep. Comp. (for πυρρότερα) , πῠρώτερα φοινίσσεσθαι to be of a brighter red, Arat. 798.
blushing, Ar. Eq. 900; also κύων . . πύρσʼ ἔχουσα δέργματα glaring with bloodshot eyes, E. Hec. 1265.

children.label: II
children.definition: Πύρρος, ὁ, Pyrrhus, as pr. n.; also Πύρϝος, name of a horse, GDI 3119h50 ( Corinth); cf. Πυρϝίας IG 4.492.5 ( Mycenae, vi B.C.), Πυρϝαλίων ib. 517.4 ( Argos). (Prob. from *πυρσϝός.)
babylonicum, dub. in Gloss.
redness, of hair, Arist. GA 785a20, Gal. 6.21.
Theoc. 8.3.
red-coloured bird (cf. πύρρα), perh. the bullfinch, Pyrrhula vulgaris, Arist. HA 592b22 (v.l. πυρρουράς, etc.).
red-coloured, Plu. Isid. 2.363b, 364b, PRyl. 134.16 (i A.D.).

definition: πυρρώδης, f.l. for ῥυπώδης, Hsch. s.v. σκεῖρος.

children.definition: of Pyrrho the Sceptic, Gal. 1.589, D.L. Praef. 20, al.; σοφίσματα Arr. Epict. 1.27.2; ὑποτυπώσεις, title of work by S.E.; also Subst. Πυρρωνιαστής, οῦ, ὁ, follower of P., IGRom. 4.1740 ( Cyme).
tinge with red, ξανθὰν χαίταν π. E. Tr. 227 (lyr.), cf. Sotion p.191 W.; τὸ πρόσωπον φύκειπ. Poll. 5.102; ἡ πυρσαίνουσα μίλτος τὰ χείλη Philostr. Ep. 40.
fiery bright, Orph. H. 19.1.
communication by means of πυρσοί, Plb. 10.43.1 (pl.); ἀποδιδόναι τὴν π. ἀλλήλοις ib. 45.8.
one who heats a bath, Aret. SD 1.11.
fire-signaller, Aen.Tact. 6.7.

light up, kindle, πυρσεύσας . . σέλας Εὔβοιαν having lit it up with beacon-fires ( σέλας combining with the notion of the Verb), E. Hel. 1126 (lyr.); γαῖαν πᾶσαν, of the Sun, Lyr.Alex.Adesp. 35.16: metaph., π. ἔχθραν D.S. 11.64; τὸ κάλλος Philostr. Ep. 12:— Pass., blaze, μαρμαρυγῇ Hld. 7.5; ὥρα τις εἰαρινὴ π. beams forth, Id. 5.13.
set on fire, τρίχα Opp. C. 1.327.

children.label: II
children.definition: communicate news by means of πυρσοί, signal by beacon-fires, X. An. 7.8.15, Onos. 25.3, etc.; τισι to others, D.S. 12.49; τῶν φρυκτωρῶν (or -ίων) κατὰ διαδοχὰς πυρσευόντων ἀλλήλοις Arist. Mu. 398a33; πυρσεύετε κραυγὴν ἀγῶνος give a shout in signal of battle, E. El. 694:— Pass., ἄν τι πυρσευθῇ Aen.Tact. 15.1; δόξα ὥσπερ ἀπὸ σκοπῆς τῆς Ἑλλάδος εἰς τὴν οἰκουμένην πυρσεύεται Plu. Apophth.reg. 2.182f: impers., πυρσεύεται fire-signals are made, Luc. Hist.Conscr. 62.

data.quote: δόξα ὥσπερ ἀπὸ σκοπῆς τῆς Ἑλλάδος εἰς τὴν οἰκουμένην πυρσεύεται

children.definition: shoot forth fire, π. ἀκτῖνας Man. 4.214.
shooting forth fire, ἀκτῖνες AP 12.196 ( Strat.), Man. 4.438.
fire-producing, Nonn. D. 2.495.
ignipotens, Gloss.
writhing in fire, Procl. ap. Marin. Procl. 28.
Poll. 4.144, prob. (for πυρρό-) in E. IA 225 (lyr.).
red-maned, λέων A. Fr. 110.
straps of leather dried at the fire, Antim. 93; cf. Hsch. s.vv. πυρσολεῖφοι ἢ πυρσόλειφθοι.
red-backed, δράκων E. HF 397 (lyr.).

definition: πυρσός (A), ὁ, heterocl. pl. πυρσά E. Rh. 97: ( πῦρ, πυρρός):—

children.definition: firebrand, torch, Il. 18.211 (pl.), E. Ph. 1377, etc.: pl., fires, λίθος μήτηρ πυρσῶν AP 6.28 ( Jul.Aegypt.); ἠελίοιο Opp. H. 4.353; of lightning, Orac. ap. Eus. PE 6.3: metaph., ἅψαι πυρσὸν ὕμνων Pi. I. 4(3).43, cf. AP 5 Praef.; πυρσὸν ἄναπτε κακῶν IG 12(5).229.14 ( Paros): pl., of the fires of love, Theoc. 23.7, AP 12.17.

children.label: II
children.definition: beacon or signal-fire ( = Att. φρυκτός), Hdt. 7.183, 9.3, Aen.Tact. 6.7, Plb. 10.44.10, etc.: metaph., πυρσὸν ὣς Ἕλλᾱσι φαίνων B. 12.82.
πυρσά, watch-fires, E. Rh. 97, cf. 43 (lyr.).
fire-producing, π. λίθος a flint, AP 6.27 ( Theaet.); λᾶϊγξ Nonn. D. 37.59; π. Ἄρης Man. 4.467.

definition: πυρσουρίς, ίδος, ἡ, = foreg., Anon. ap. Suid.
πυρσουρός, ὁ, = φρυκτωρός, PGurob 22.1 (iii B.C.), prob. in Polyaen. 3.9.55.

children.definition: carrying fire, νάρθηξ Nonn. D. 7.340, al., dub. in D.S. 20.48.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., torch-bearer, Hsch.; large brazier, Id.
red-haired, κάρα B. 17.51.
like a firebrand, bright-burning, φλόξ E. Ba. 146 (lyr.).
fiery-eyed, Opp. C. 1.181; red, Marc.Sid. 49.
to be a torch-bearer, E. Tr. 348: c. acc., π. λαμπάδιον Hld. 4.1.

children.label: b
children.definition: to be a πυρφόρος or bearer of sacred fire, IG 7.1776 (Thesp.); ὁ παῖς ὁ τῷ πυρφορῶν ib. 42(1).121.43 ( Epid., iv B.C.).
carry fire, θεωρὶς ναῦς ἐκ Δήλου π. Philostr. Her. 19.14.

children.label: II
children.definition: set on fire, A. Th. 341 (lyr.): metaph., ψυχήν Charito 2.4.
fire-bearing, esp. of lightning, π. κεραυνός Pi. N. 10.71, A. Th. 444, S. OC 1658; ἀστραπαί Id. OT 200 (lyr.); Διὸς ἔγχος Ar. Av. 1749 (lyr.); πυρφόρος αἰθέρος ἀστήρ Id. Th. 1050 (lyr.).

children.label: b
children.definition: π. οἰστοί arrows with combustibles tied to them, so that they may set fire to woodwork, Th. 2.75, Arr. An. 2.21.3; τοῖς μὲν π . . . τοῖς δʼ ἄλλοις βέλεσι D.S. 20.96; οἱ π. ibid.; πυρφόρα, τά, ib. 88; πυρφόρος, ὁ, engine for throwing fire, fire-dart, Plb. 21.7.1 (dub.), Jul. Or. 2.62d.

data.quote: τοῖς μὲν π . . . τοῖς δʼ ἄλλοις βέλεσι

children.definition: lightnings, S. Ph. 1198 (anap.); of Demeter, prob. in reference to the torches used by her worshippers, E. Supp. 260; similarly π. θεαί of Demeter and Persephone, IG 4.666.9 ( Lerna), E. Ph. 687 (lyr.); π. Ἀρτέμιδος αἴγλας S. OT 206 (lyr.); Προμηθεὺς π. the Fire-bringer, title of a satyric play of A., cf. S. OC 55; also of Capaneus, A. Th. 432, S. Ant. 135 (lyr.); of Eros, AP 5.87 ( Rufin.); but, θεὸς π. the fire-bearing god, the god who produces plague or fever, S. OT 27.
bearer of sacred fire in the worship of Asclepius, Ἀσκληπιοῦ δμῶα π. IG 3.693; of the Syrian Goddess, Luc. Syr.D. 42.

children.label: b
children.definition: πυρφόρος, ὁ, in the Spartan army, the priest who kept the sacrificial fire, which was never allowed to go out, X. Lac. 13.2: hence prov. of a total defeat, ἔδει δὲ μηδὲ πυρφόρον . . περιγενέσθαι Hdt. 8.6, cf. D.C. 39.45; οὐκ ἔσται π. (v.l. πυροφόρος) τῷ οἴκῳ Ἠσαύ LXX Ob. 18.
π. ἡ ἐκ Δελφῶν bearer of sacred fire from Delphi, SIG 711 D 22 (ii B.C.), cf. 728 I (i B.C.); Φοίβου πυρφόροι IG 4.666.15 ( Lerna); also in a Bacchic thiasos, AJA 37.253 ( Latium, ii A.D.).
cereal, καρποί Str. 2.2.3.

like fire, fiery, ὄμματα Emp. ap. Arist. GA 779b15; Διὸς ἀστεροπαί Ar. Av. 1746 (anap.); μαρμαρυγαί Pl. Criti. 116c; ἀρχὴ π. Arist. Mete. 344a17; ἀναθυμίασις ξηρὰ καὶ π. ib. 372b33; στεφάνη Parm. ap. Placit. 2.7.1; χωρίον Ph. 1.39: Sup., -εστάτη αὐγή J. BJ 5.5.6; τὸ π. fiery or hot substance, Parm. l.c., Arist. MA 703a24, Plu. Aud.poet. 2.19f, etc.: metaph., π. λόγος Ph. 1.144; τὸ π. fiery nature, of Achilles, Ath. 14.624a. Adv. -δῶς v.l. for πυροειδῶς in Diog.Apoll. ap. Placit. 2.13.9: neut. as Adv., πυρῶδες ὑποβλέπειν Poll. 5.79.

children.label: II
children.definition: flamelike, bright, Arist. Mete. 342b8, de An. 419a3; ἐρύθημα Plu. Demetr. 38.

children.label: III
children.definition: inflamed, betokening inflammation, ἕλκος Hp. Fract. 25 (v.l. πυρετῶδες): metaph., ἔνθερμος ἡ ψυχὴ γενομένη καὶ π. Plu. Def.orac. 2.432e.
inflammation, Ptol. Tetr. 152, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(1).182.

definition: πυρών, ῶνος, ὁ, dub. sens. in Inscr.Délos 444 B 107 (ii B.C.).

children.definition: presiding over the purchase of wheat, epith. of Artemis, Paus. 8.15.9.

definition: πυρώπης, ες, = sq., Opp. C. 2.317; fem. πῠρ-ῶπις, ιδος, Nonn. D. 5.221.

children.definition: fiery-eyed, fiery, κεραυνός A. Pr. 667; γλῆνος Id. Fr. 300.4; διʼ ἀστέρων διῆλθε τὰν π. κέλευθον IG 9(1).880.7 (Corc.); [ ῥόδον] τῇ ὄψει π. Plu. QConv. 2.648a; τὸ λαμπρὸν καὶ π. ib. Pyth. 404d: neut. as Adv., πυρωπὸν ἐμβλέπειν Ph. 2.331.

data.quote: διʼ ἀστέρων διῆλθε τὰν π. κέλευθον

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. pyropus, a kind of red bronze, Plin. HN 34.94.
firing, burning, Thphr. HP 5.9.1.
exposure to the action of fire, as in cooking, Arist. Pr. 928a24, Thphr. HP 7.7.2, Lap. 4, al.; ἡ ἐν τῷ ὑγρῷ π. boiling, Arist. Mete. 380b28; μαλακὴ π. Mnesith. ap. Ath. 8.357d.
proving by fire, LXX Pr. 27.21, 1 Ep.Pet. 4.12, Hsch.
cautery, Antyll. ap. Orib. 44.23.42.
destruction by fire, γῆν πυρώσει ἀφανίζων J. AJ 1.11.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: flame, Arist. Mete. 369b6.

children.label: III
children.definition: burning desire, Sch. Ar. Pl. 975.

children.label: IV
children.definition: fever, S.E. P. 2.240: pl., feverish states, Hp. Loc.Hom. 27.
inflammation, Epicur. Fr. 60; στομάχου Dsc. 2.124.

definition: πυρώτερος, α, ον, poet. Comp. of πυρρός (q.v.).

children.definition: one who works with fire, smith, LXX Ne. 3.8 (v.l.), Aq., Sm. Is. 41.7, Je. 6.29.
heating, δύναμις Dsc. 2.171; ἄκοπον τὸ π. Hippiatr. 103; τὸ π. τῶν σωμάτων Corn. ND 30.
fiery, Antiph. 217.21; epith. of the planet Mars, Vett.Val. 249.5.

definition: πῦς, Dor. for ποῖ, Sophr. 75, prob. in Id. 5.

children.definition: question, Ph. 1.99, al., Plu. Pyth. 2.408c (pl.): distd. fr. ἐρώτημα, as requiring an explanatory answer, and not merely assent or dissent, S.E. P. 1.189, Alex. Fig. 1.23, Anon. Fig. 18p.179S.

children.label: II
children.definition: interrogative particle, A.D. Synt. 307.12, al.

interrogative, A.D. Synt. 72.23, al.; χρεῖαι Hermog. Prog. 3; σχῆμα Tib. Fig. 13, S.E. M. 1.315: τὰ -κά interrogative particles, EM 67.6; distd. fr. πευστικά, ib. 759.29. Adv. πυσματικῶς A.D. Pron. 27.16, Sch. S. OC 3.
muzzle put on calves’ noses to prevent their sucking, Hsch.; also πύσσᾰκος, cj. in Lyr.Adesp. 46A.
inquire, as of a god, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.292e, Phot.: impf. in Hsch.
inquiry, τὰς π. ἐρωτῶντες, εἰ . . introducing the questions whether . ., Th. 1.5; κοινὴ . . ἡ π. ὑπὲρ ἐμοῦ τε καὶ σοῦ Pl. La. 196c.

data.quote: κοινὴ . . ἡ π. ὑπὲρ ἐμοῦ τε καὶ σοῦ

children.label: II
children.definition: that which is learnt by asking, tidings, news, A. Th. 54 ( Stob. read πίστις), E. El. 690; π. κατʼ ἐσθλὴν ὕδατος AP 6.203 ( Laco or Phil.); κατὰ πύστιν ᾗ χωροίη according as they learnt which way he was gone, Th. 1.136; κατὰ π. τοῦ τρέφοντος by information received from the foster-father, D.H. 1.81; πύστει τῶν προγενομένων by hearing of what was done before, Th. 3.82; τὰ ὑπὸ πύστιν ἐρχόμενα J. AJ 5.2.3.

definition: πυτά τὰ ἐρυθρὰ ἱμάτια ( Lacon.), Hsch.

πυτία, ἡ, = πυετία, Arist. GA 729a12 (v.l. πιτύα), Mete. 381a7 (v.l. πυετία), Mir. 835b31 (v.l. πιτύα), UPZ 149 ii 38 (ii B.C.); πιτύα is written in Thphr. HP 9.11.3, Dsc. 2.75, Erot. s.v. τάμισος, Plu. QConv. 2.700d; φώκης Thphr., Dsc. Il.cc., Plu. Vind. 2.552f, cf. Arist. Mir. 835b31:

children.definition: αὐτὸς γὰρ εὗρε τοῦ κακοῦ τὴν πιτύαν (codd. πητ-) ‘he asked for trouble’, Diogenian. 3.18, Suid.s.vv. αὐτός, πητύα.

children.label: II
children.definition: a sort of junket, Alciphr. Fr. 6.10 (pl.).
spit frequently, spurt water from oneʼs mouth, EM 697.57: hence Lat. pȳtissare, spit out wine after tasting, Ter. Heaut. 457; pytisma, spittle, Vitr. 7.4.5, Juv. 11.175.
of a πυτίνη, πτερά Ar. Av. 798.
flask covered with plaited osier, Poll. 7.175; name of a comedy by Cratinus.

children.label: II
children.definition: Hsch. (Cf. βυτίνη.)
manufacturer of πυτῖναι, Sch. Ar. Av. 1442.

definition: πύτινος [ ῡ], ὁ, name of a

children.definition: fish, prob.l. in Numen. ap. Ath. 7.327f (written πίτυνος ib. 304e); cf. Gloss.
like pus, πτύελον, οὖρον, Hp. Prog. 18, 19; οὐρήσιες v.l. (ap. Gal. 16.754) for ἀφρώδεες in Prorrh. 1.113; θρόμβοι Aret. SD 2.3, cf. Hippiatr. 6, al.: metaph., M.Ant. 3.8.
suppuration, Gal. 19.433.
where? Hsch.; for πόθεν; Sophr. 125, A. Ag. 1507 (lyr.), Orph. Fr. 32 (b). 3, cf. A.D. Adv. 185.15, EM 773.19.

children.label: II
children.definition: πῶ μάλα; or πώμαλα; where in the world? how in the name of fortune? or, without a question, = οὐδαμῶς, not a whit, Pherecr. 9, Ar. Pl. 66, Fr. 346, Lys. Fr. 254 S., D. 19.51.
drink! Alc. 54 A: Cypr. πῶθι, Inscr.Cypr. 144 H.

up to this time, yet, in early Ep. always with a neg., with which it sts. forms one word, cf. οὔπω, μήπω, etc.; sts. a word is interposed, οὐδʼ ἄρα πώ τι ᾔδεε Il. 17.401; μὴ δή πω . . λυώμεθα . . ἵππους 23.7, cf. A. Pr. 27, 511, S. OT 105, Tr. 591, 1061, etc.; μὴ συναλλάξαντά πω Id. OT 1110.

children.label: II
children.definition: at all, with neg. in Ep., οὐδέ τί πω ἴδμεν ( που Ar.Byz.) Il. 1.124; οὔ πω τλήσομʼ 3.306; μὴ δή πω χάζεσθε 15.426: after Hom. sts. with questions which imply a negative, ἢ ξυναλλάξας τί πω; S. OT 1130 ( v.l. που) ; πόλις ἀφισταμένη τίς πω τούτῳ ἐπεχείρησε; has ever a city meditating revolt . .? Th. 3.45.

beard, πώγωνα μέγαν ἴσχει Hdt. 1.175; φύει π. grows a beard, Id. 8.104; πώγωνα καθεῖναι to let it grow, Ar. Ec. 99; ὑποκαθιεὶς ἄτομα πώγωνος βάθη Ephipp. 14.7; βαθὺν π. καθειμένος Luc. Philops. 5, cf. Pisc. 11, Plu. Ant. 18; π. ποδήρης καθεῖται Id. Adul. 2.52c; πώγωνος ἤδη ὑποπιμπλάμενος just beginning to have a beard, Pl. Prt. 309a; τὸν π. ξύρεσθαι, κατακείρειν, Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.198, Plu. Adul. 2.52c ( Pass.).

π. [ἱππελάφου] Arist. HA 498b34; of the fish τράγος, Clearch. 73; beard of the cock sparrow, Arist. HA 613a31, cf. Clytus 1, etc.; wattles of a cock, Ammon. Diff. s.v. κάλλαια; growth under the chin of a serpent, Philum. Ven. 30.2.
Gal. 12.420, dub.l. in Thphr. HP 6.4.5; γεραὸν πώγωνα, = τραγοπώγωνα, Nic. Fr. 74.71.
barb of an arrow, Poll. 7.158, Nonn. D. 29.100 (pl.), Hsch. s.v. ὄγκους, etc.
πώγων φλογός, πυρός, beard or tail of fire, A. Ag. 306, E. Fr. 836.
Hdt. 8.42 (whence prov. πλεύσειας εἰς Τροιζῆνα, of those wearing false beards, Eust. 287.14; also εἰς Τ. δεῖ βαδίζειν, Suid.).
bearded, Gloss.
bearded, Cratin. 439, Procop. Pers. 2.4; ἀλεκτρυόνες Ptol. Geog. 7.2.23.

children.label: II
children.definition: π., with or without ἀστήρ, bearded star, i.e. comet, Arist. Mete. 344a23, Stoic. 2.201, Placit. 3.2.5, etc.

definition: πωγωνιάτης [ ᾱ], ου, ὁ, = πωγωνίτης, epith. of Zeus, in Ion. form πωγων-ιήτης, EM 698.8, Suid.

children.definition: bearded, Gloss.

definition: πωγώνιον, τό, Dim. of πώγων, Luc. Par. 50, AP 11.157 ( Ammian.).

children.definition: bearded, Hdn. Epim. 112, Sch. Theoc. 6.2, EM 698.8.
barbatoria, Gloss.
let the beard grow, Str. 15.1.71, D.S. 4.5, Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.230b.
letting the beard grow, Plu. Isid. 2.352c (pl.).
wearing a beard, Scyl. 112, Xenocr. ap. Orib. 2.58.42, Luc. Epigr. 46.
πῶθι, v. πῶ.
Dim. of πῶλος, young foal, Pl. ap. D.L. 5.2, Ar.Byz. Epit. 145.1, Sch. Ar. V. 195.
breeding of foals, stud, X. Eq. 2.2; breed, Str. 5.1.4; written πωλέα, BGU 563 i 10, al. (ii A.D.).
of a foal, χαίτη Suid.

definition: πωλέομαι, Ion. πωλεῦμαι, used by Hom. in 2 sg. πώλεαι Od. 4.811; part. πωλεύμενος 2.55 (also in A. Pr. 645): impf. πωλεύμην Od. 22.352, πωλεῖτο 9.189; Ion. impf. πωλέσκετο Il. 1.490, Od. 11.240: fut. πωλήσομαι h.Ap. 329, Ep. 2 sg. πωλήσεαι Il. 5.350:—

children.definition: Ep. Verb, prop. Frequentat. of πολέομαι, go up and down or to and fro: hence, go or come frequently, οὔτε ποτʼ εἰς ἀγορὴν πωλέσκετο . ., οὔτε ποτʼ ἐς πόλεμον Il. 1.490, cf. 5.350, 788; εἰς ἡμέτερον [δῶμα] πωλεύμενοι ἤματα πάντα Od. 2.55, cf. 22.352; πωλεῖταί τις δεῦρο 4.384; ἐνθάδε h.Ap. 170; ἔνθα καὶ ἔνθα h.Ven. 80; μετʼ ἄλλους Od. 9.189; εἰς εὐνήν h.Ap. 329; ἐπʼ Ἐνιπῆος ῥέεθρα Od. 11.240; π. μετὰ πᾶσι τετιμένος Emp. 112.5; περὶ πόλιν πωλεύμενος Archil. 46; ἀγγελίην (prob.) πωλεῖται ἐπʼ εὐρέα νῶτα θαλάσσης she goes on a message, Hes. Th. 781; ὄψεις ἔννυχοι πωλεύμεναι ἐς παρθενῶνας A. l.c.

data.quote: οὔτε ποτʼ εἰς ἀγορὴν πωλέσκετο . ., οὔτε ποτʼ ἐς πόλεμον

children.definition: colt, Max.Tyr. 7.8.
horsebreaking, X. Eq. 2.1.
horsebreaker, Max.Tyr. 7.8: generally, trainer of animals, keeper, ἐλέφαντος Ael. NA 7.41, cf. 8.17, 13.8.
skilled in horsebreaking, Ael. NA 11.36.
break in a young horse, X. Eq. 2.1, Poll. 1.182, Him. Ecl. 13.36:— Pass., ib. 21.4: generally, to be trained, of elephants, ὀσμῇ πωλευθησόμενοι Ael. NA 13.8; ἐκ νηπίων πεπωλευμένοι ib. 16.36.

definition: πωλέω, Ion. impf. πωλέεσκε Hdt. 1.196: fut. -ήσω Ar. Fr. 543, X. Cyr. 6.2.38; Dor. 3 pl. πωλησεῦντι IG 12(1).3.2 ( Rhodes, i A.D.): aor. ἐπώλησα Plu. Phil. 16:— Pass., fut. in med. form πωλήσεται Eub. 74.1: 2 fut. πεπωλήσεται Aen.Tact. 10.19: aor. ἐπωλήθην Pl. Plt. 260d, prob. in IG 1(2).60.10:—

children.definition: sell or offer for sale, opp. ὠνεῖσθαι, Hdt. 1.165, 196, etc.; opp. ἀποδίδοσθαι (of the actual sale), X. Smp. 8.21, cf. Mem. 2.5.5 ( Pass.); μετʼ ἀβακίου καὶ τραπεζίου π. ἑαυτόν sell oneself across the counter, Lys. Fr. 50: c. gen. pretii, ἐπώλεε ἐς Σάρδις χρημάτων μεγάλων sold at a high price for exportation to Sardis, Hdt. 8.105, cf. Ar. l.c.; πωλέω οὐδενὸς χρήματος refuse to sell it at any price, Hdt. 3.139; τὰ ξύμπαντα τούτου ἑνὸς ἂν πωλοῖτο Th. 2.60; τῶν πόνων π. ἁμῖν πάντα τἀγάθʼ οἱ θεοί Epich. 287; ἀργυρίου π. τι X. Mem. 1.6.13, etc.; τὰ σφῶν αὐτῶν μικροῦ λήμματος π. D. 11.18; ἔρωμαι ὁπόσου πωλεῖ; ask what he wants for it, X. Mem. 1.2.36; π. δὶς πρὸς ἀργύριον Thphr. HP 9.6.4 ( Pass.); τὴν Ἀσίην πωλῶ πρὸς μύρα AP 11.3; π. τινί τι Stratt. 13.1, cf. X. Hier. 1.13 ( Pass.); τι πρός τινας Hdt. 9.80, Pl. Lg. 741b; ὑπὸ κήρυκος π. τὰ κοινά D. 51.22: abs., carry on business, trade, ἐν τῇ πόλει OGI 629.83 ( Palmyra, ii A.D.); π. πρός τινα deal with one, Ar. Ach. 722; π. πάλιν retail, Pl. Plt. 260d:— Pass., to be sold or offered for sale, εἰν ἀγορῇ πωλεύμενα Hom. Epigr. 14.5, cf. Berl.Sitzb. 1927.160 ( Cyrene), Hdt. 8.105; of a person, to be sold up, POxy. 1477.3 (iii/iv A.D.).

data.quote: τὰ ξύμπαντα τούτου ἑνὸς ἂν πωλοῖτο
τῶν πόνων π. ἁμῖν πάντα τἀγάθʼ οἱ θεοί

children.definition: π. τέλη let out the taxes, Aeschin. 1.119; μέταλλα Arist. Ath. 47.2; ὠνάς SIG 284.28 ( Erythrae, iv B.C.).

children.label: b
children.definition: sell or farm out offices, priesthoods, etc., [ τὰς ἀρχάς] Arist. Ath. 62.1; ἐπὶ τοῖσδε πωλοῦμεν τὴν ἱερωσύνην τοῦ Διονύσου SIG 1003.2 ( Priene, ii B.C.).

data.quote: ἐπὶ τοῖσδε πωλοῦμεν τὴν ἱερωσύνην τοῦ Διονύσου

children.definition: sell, i.e. give up, betray, τὰς γραφάς D. 58.35; τὰ τῆς πόλεως Id. 19.141; τὰ οἴκοι Id. 7.17:— Pass., of persons, to be bought and sold, betrayed, Ar. Pax 633.

definition: πώλη, Dor. πώλα, ἡ, = πώλησις, Sophr. 71 (pl.), Hyp. Fr. 12.

children.definition: thing sold or sale, IG 14.426 i 9, 430 ii 23 ( Tauromenium), X. ap. Poll. 3.127, 7.8.
seller, dealer, found only in compds., exc. in Ar. Eq. 131, 133, 140 (used comically, as the last part of an intended compd.).
selling, sale, X. Oec. 3.9, Arist. EE 1232a3, BGU 184.1 (i A.D.).
πωλητής, Ph. 1.161; τοὶ π. τᾶν δεκατᾶν SIG 241.195 (Delph., iv. B.C.).
place where wares are sold, auction-room, shop, Hermipp. 93 (nisi leg. πωλητῆρα), X. Vect. 3.13 (pl.), App. BC 3.23 (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: τὸ π. τοῦ μετοικίου the office of the πωληταί, who farmed out the metic-tax, D. 25.57, cf. Hyp. Fr. 270.
seller, Plu. Galb. 24: but,

officials who farmed out taxes and other revenues, sold confiscated property, and entered into contracts for public works, IG 1(2).36.7, al., Antipho 6.49, Arist. Ath. 7.3, 47.2; also at Rhodes, SIG 581.97 (ii B.C.); τοὶ π. μισθωσάντω ἀναγράψαι τὸ ψάφισμα ib. 398.49 ( Cos, iii B.C.); they also sold up the metics who failed to pay their tax, D. 25.58.
who regulated commercial dealings with the neighbouring barbarians, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.297f.
offering for sale, τὸ τῆς . . ἀρετῆς π. the trade of offering excellence for sale, Pl. Sph. 224d.
for sale, ἱερωσύνα SIG 1006.6 ( Cos, iii B.C.).

definition: πωλήτρια, ἡ, fem. of πωλητήρ, Poll. 3.80.

children.definition: of foals, fillies, or young horses, π. ἀπήνη a chariot drawn by young horses or (generally) by horses, S. OT 802; so π. ἄντυγες, ὄχημα, ζυγά, ὄχος, E. Rh. 567, 621, IA 619, 623, etc.; π. διώγματα pursuit in a chariot drawn by young horses, Id. Andr. 992; in races, π. τέθριππον, opp. τέλεον τέθριππον, IG 5(2).549 (Arc., iv B.C.); ἵππων πωλικῷ ζεύγει ib. 22.2311.52; συνωρὶς π. ib. 42(1).101.46 ( Epid., i A.D.), Supp.Epigr. 1.380b ( Samos, ii B.C.); ἅρμα π. IG 42(1).101.48.
of any young animal, -κὸν ζεῦγος βοῶν a team of young oxen, Alc.Com. 14.
π. ἑδώλια the girls’ apartments, A. Th. 454 (lyr.).
for sale, PCair.Zen. 225.6 (iii B.C.).
Dim. of πῶλος, pony, Ar. V. 189, Pax 75, And. 1.61, Arist. GA 748a29; also, a young elephant, Ael. NA 3.46.

children.label: II
children.definition: the membrane round the foal in the uterus, Arist. HA 605a6.

definition: πωλοδαμαστής, οῦ, ὁ, = πωλοδάμνης, PMich.Zen. 71.4 (iii B.C.), D.S. 17.76.

children.definition: πωλοδαμνική, St.Byz. s.v. Ἄχναι.
break young horses, E. Rh. 187, 624, X. Oec. 3.10; ἵπποι πωλοδαμνηθέντες Plu. Lib.educ. 2.2e.
train, αὐτὸν ἐν νόμοις πατρὸς δεῖ πωλοδαμνεῖν S. Aj. 549; π. τὴν νεότητα Luc. Am. 45; νεότης πωλοδαμνεῖται Plu. Lib.educ. 2.13e.
